abilities.name: Mist Coil
abilities.description: Abaddon releases a coil of deathly mist that can damage an enemy unit or heal a friendly unit at the cost of some of Abaddon's health.
notes: Abaddon can not kill himself with this skill.
abilities.lore: A mysterious vapor from the Font of Avernus now infuses the breath of Abaddon, who releases it at will.

abilities.name: Aphotic Shield
abilities.description: Summons dark energies around an ally unit, creating an all damage barrier that absorbs a set amount of damage before expiring. When the barrier is destroyed it will burst and deal damage equal to the amount it could absorb to an area around it. Removes certain types of negative buffs and stuns on cast.
notes: The max damage is always dealt whether the barrier is destroyed by expiring or absorbing damage.
The explosion does not damage units hidden by the fog of war.
abilities.lore: The powers of the black mist rise to absorb attacks like the black mist absorbs light.

abilities.name: Curse of Avernus
abilities.description: Abaddon strikes an enemy, slowing the target's movement speed. If the target gets hit 4 times, they become affected by a chilling curse causing them to be silenced and slowed, and all attacks against them gain an attack speed boost.
abilities.lore: While the baptized draw strength from the Font, the gifts of Avernus are debilitating to the uninitiated.

abilities.name: Borrowed Time
abilities.description: When activated, all damage dealt to you will heal instead of harm. Most negative buffs will also be removed. If the ability is not on cooldown, it will automatically activate if your health falls below 400.
notes: Borrowed Time can be manually activated while Abaddon is disabled, but not while silenced.  The passive activation can still occur while silenced.
Aphotic Shield does not block any damage to Abaddon when Borrowed Time is active, allowing him to heal.
abilities.lore: The most unnatural of all the gifts of the Font of Avernus, this power defies mortal understanding.  What should hurt, instead heals; and what should kill gives strength anew.

abilities.name: Acid Spray
abilities.description: Sprays high-pressure acid across a target area. Enemy units who step across the contaminated terrain take damage per second and have their armor reduced.
abilities.lore: Using traditional Alchemy from the Darkbrew family, Razzil concocts an acid that dissolves even the toughest metals.

abilities.name: Unstable Concoction
abilities.description: Alchemist brews up an unstable concoction that he can throw at an enemy hero, to stun and deal damage in an area around the explosion. The longer the concoction brews, the more damage it deals and the longer the stun. Alchemist is faster while charging the concoction. After 5.0 seconds, the brew reaches its maximum damage and stun time. However, after 5.5 seconds, the concoction will explode on Alchemist himself if not thrown.
notes: While brewing, this ability is replaced by Unstable Concoction Throw.  Alchemist can move and act normally while brewing.
A timer above Alchemist's head will indicate the remaining brew time. This timer is visible to enemies.
You can deny yourself with this skill.
Unstable Concoction cannot be disjointed and once thrown Unstable Concoction stops brewing.
Unstable Concoction explosion damages heroes and creeps.
abilities.lore: A silver lining to the failure of turning a mountain into gold, this volatile solution has destructive potential.

abilities.name: Corrosive Weaponry
abilities.description: Alchemist coats his weapons with an acid that applies a stacking slow and status resistance reduction to enemies hit.

abilities.name: Berserk Potion
abilities.description: Alchemist throws a potion at an ally, applying a basic dispel and giving them attack speed, movement speed and HP regen.DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

abilities.name: Greevil's Greed
abilities.description: Alchemist synthesizes additional gold from his enemies and bounty runes. With each kill, Alchemist earns base bonus gold and extra bonus gold. If Alchemist kills another unit which yields gold within the next 36 seconds, an additional instance of Extra Bonus Gold is added to the total. Additionally, causes bounty runes to yield more gold.
abilities.lore: While it is not a mountain, Razzil has mastered the conversion of smaller compounds to line his pockets.

abilities.name: Chemical Rage
abilities.description: Alchemist causes his Ogre to enter a chemically induced rage, reducing base attack cooldown and increasing movement speed and health regeneration.
notes: Has a 0.35 second transformation time, which can be used to dodge projectiles and stuns.
abilities.lore: The brew Razzil gave to the Ogre during their prison bust has become a useful potion in the midst of combat.

abilities.name: Unstable Concoction Thro
abilities.description: Throw it before it blows up!

abilities.name: Cold Feet
abilities.description: Places a frozen hex on an enemy unit that deals damage over time, but can be dispelled by moving away from the initial cast point.  If the enemy unit doesn't move outside of the given range, it will be stunned and frozen in place after 4 seconds.
notes: Deals damage every half second.
abilities.lore: Kaldr's presence draws those around him into a frozen void, threatening to lock them in an icy prison for eternity.

abilities.name: Ice Vortex
abilities.description: Creates a vortex of icy energy that deals damage, slows and increases magic damage done to enemies in its range.
notes: Provides vision in a small area where it is placed.
abilities.lore: Frozen, caustic winds are at the whim of Kaldr, chilling the field of battle.

abilities.name: Chilling Touch
abilities.description: Enhances Ancient Apparition's attack with increased range, heavy magic damage, and movement slow.
abilities.lore: The Ancient Apparition's eternal knowledge brings a frigid enchantment to his attacks.

abilities.name: Ice Blast
abilities.description: Launches a tracer toward any location on the battlefield, which must be triggered again to mark the area to be blasted by a damaging explosion of hail. The further the tracer travels, the larger the explosion will be. Enemies caught in the explosion, or who touch the icy ball of hail as it travels, are Frostbitten, taking damage and prevented from regenerating or healing. If a Frostbitten unit's health drops below a certain percentage, they will instantly shatter.
notes: Upon cast, this ability is replaced by Release, used to stop the tracer on the target area.
The area of effect is 275 + 50.0*TimeTraveled, capped at 1000.  The freeze area along the path is 275.
Kill will be granted to the source of the damage that triggers the shatter.
The shatter effect doesn't work on illusions.
The HP Freeze prevents most kinds of healing, including the fountain, except Sunder, Time Lapse and Supernova.
abilities.lore: Ice storms from ages past flow through Kaldr's frosty limbs, crashing into the world and turning its inhabitants into monuments to his eternal power.

abilities.name: Release
abilities.description: Releases the ice blast to explode at the tracer's current location.

abilities.name: Mana Break
abilities.description: Burns an opponent's mana on each attack and deals damage equal to a percentage of the mana burnt. Enemies with no mana left are temporarily slowed.
notes: Mana Break has 50% effect if caused by illusions.

stats.name: move speed slow on full drain

abilities.lore: A modified technique of the Turstarkuri monks' peaceful ways is to turn magical energies on their owner.

abilities.name: Blink
abilities.description: Short distance teleportation that allows Anti-Mage to move in and out of combat.
notes: You can use Blink to dodge incoming projectiles.
abilities.lore: In his encounter with the Dead Gods, Anti-Mage learned the value of being elusive.

abilities.name: Counterspell
abilities.description: Passively grants magic resistance. Counterspell may be activated to create an anti-magic shell around Anti-Mage that blocks and sends any targeted spells back towards enemies instead.
abilities.lore: With the proper focus, Anti-Mage turns innate resistance into calculated retaliation.

abilities.name: Blink Fragment
abilities.description: Blinks an illusion to the target enemy or location, which attacks for a brief time. Counterspell is replicated on the Blink Fragment illusion. Has 3 Charges.

abilities.name: Mana Void
abilities.description: For each point of mana missing by the target unit, damage is dealt to it and surrounding enemies.  The main target is also mini-stunned.
notes: Damage is calculated based on the primary target's mana, but applied to all enemies within the area of effect.
abilities.lore: After bringing enemies to their knees, Anti-Mage punishes them for their use of the arcane arts.

abilities.name: Flux
abilities.description: Infuses a lone enemy unit with swirling, volatile energy, dealing damage over time. The damage is not applied if another enemy unit is near the target.  Arc Warden: Slows the target's movement speed. Tempest Double: Movement speed slow is decreased, but damage is increased.
abilities.lore: An infinitesimal fraction of the power which imprisoned the Ancients.

abilities.name: Magnetic Field
abilities.description: Arc Warden: Generates a circular distortion field of magnetic energy that grants bonus attack speed and protects allied heroes and buildings within it by evading attacks coming from outside the field.  Tempest Double: Allies gain bonus attack range and deal bonus magic damage with their attacks. Duration is increased.
abilities.lore: Time and space are of little consequence to one as old as Zet.

abilities.name: Spark Wraith
abilities.description: Arc Warden: Summons a Spark Wraith that slowly materializes and patrols a targeted area until an enemy comes within its range. Once a target has been found the wraith fuses with them, dealing magical damage and slowing the unit. Tempest Double: Increased Wraith Speed and slow duration, decreased Activation Delay and Damage.
notes: Spark Wraiths can not be disjointed.
abilities.lore: Lesser fragments of Zet's original self.

abilities.name: Tempest Double
abilities.description: Briefly refocusing its fractured elements into a single form, the Arc Warden is able to create a perfect electrical duplication of itself. The duplicate can use all of Arc Warden's current items and special Tempest Double versions of his spells, except most consumables and items that drop on death. The duplicate has separate item and ability cooldowns.  The Tempest Double gives bounty gold to enemies when killed. The Tempest Double loses its sense of self if he is too far away from Arc Warden and deals less attack damage.
notes: Tempest Double and Refresher Orb cannot be used by the duplicate.
abilities.lore: Warped by the power of its peers, Arc Warden becomes what it despises most: disharmony.

abilities.name: Berserker's Call
abilities.description: Axe taunts nearby enemy units, forcing them to attack him, while he gains bonus armor during the duration.
abilities.lore: Mogul Khan's warcry taunts opponents into engaging in an unconquerable battle with the Axe.

abilities.name: Battle Hunger
abilities.description: Enrages an enemy unit, causing it to take damage over time until it kills another unit or the duration ends. The damage is increased by a factor of Axe's armor. The enemy is also slowed as long as they are facing away from Axe.
notes: Destroying buildings will also remove the debuff.
abilities.lore: Ordinary heroes cannot withstand Mogul Khan's rage for battle, such that it injures them until it is satisfied.

abilities.name: Counter Helix
abilities.description: After a set number of attacks, Axe will perform a helix counter attack, dealing pure damage to all nearby enemies.
notes: Counter Helix triggers when the attack hits.
abilities.lore: Axe is the only reinforcement this army needs.

abilities.name: Culling Blade
abilities.description: Axe spots a weakness and strikes, dealing pure damage. When an enemy hero is killed with Culling Blade, its cooldown is reset, Axe gains bonus armor permanently and all nearby allied units gain bonus movement speed.
notes: Culling Blade death cannot be prevented with other abilities like Shallow Grave.
abilities.lore: Mogul Khan is the embodiment of battle and fury, launching into a gruesome fatality against those who dare engage the Axe in combat.

abilities.name: Enfeeble
abilities.description: Deals damage every second and lowers the enemy's total attack damage and cast range.
abilities.lore: Each tendril of fear that Atropos weaves increases the vulnerability of his victims to arcane and unknown arts.

abilities.name: Brain Sap
abilities.description: Feasts on the vital energies of an enemy unit, healing Bane and dealing damage.
abilities.lore: Atropos finds no greater pleasure than to harvest the fear he creates.

abilities.name: Nightmare
abilities.description: Puts the target enemy or friendly Hero to sleep. Sleeping units are awakened when damaged. If the target was directly attacked, the Nightmare passes to the attacking unit. Bane can attack nightmared targets freely.
notes: In the first second of Nightmare, the unit is invulnerable.
Bane can wake himself from Nightmare.
On cast, replaced with Nightmare End: Ends all ongoing Nightmares on any affected units.
abilities.lore: A stolen prowess from the goddess Nyctasha is to put his prey into forever sleep.

abilities.name: Fiend's Grip
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Grips an enemy unit, disabling it and causing heavy damage over time, while stealing mana every 0.5 seconds based on the unit's maximum mana.
abilities.lore: Victims of Atropos are frequently torn apart by vivid conjurations of their own nightmares.

abilities.name: Nightmare End
abilities.description: Ends all ongoing Nightmares.

abilities.name: Sticky Napalm
abilities.description: Drenches an area in sticky oil, amplifying damage from Batrider's attacks and abilities and slowing the movement speed and turn rate of enemies in the area.  Additional casts of Sticky Napalm continue to increase damage, up to [10, 10, 10, 10] stacks. Applies a small amount of damage with each cast.
notes: All damage from Batrider gets amplified, except for Radiance, Orb of Venom, Urn of Shadows, and Spirit Vessel.
Sticky Napalm does not require turning to cast.
Sticky Napalm deals 50% damage to creeps.
abilities.lore: It's not uncommon to hear the Rider cackle while he increases the flammability of his opponents.

abilities.name: Flamebreak
abilities.description: Hurls an explosive cocktail that explodes when it reaches the target location, knocking back, slowing and dealing damage over time to enemies in the area.
abilities.lore: A molotov cocktail is the weapon of choice for Batrider.

abilities.name: Firefly
abilities.description: Batrider takes to the skies, laying down a trail of flames from the air.  The fire damages any enemies it touches, and destroys trees below Batrider.
notes: During this the Batrider can fly above units, trees and impassable terrain.
If duration ends when above impassable terrain, the Batrider can get stuck.
The trail persists through Batrider's death.
abilities.lore: When an enemy escapes into the Yama Raskav Jungle, most would cut through the brush to find the fugitive.  Batrider just chooses to destroy the jungle along with his foes.

abilities.name: Flaming Lasso
abilities.description: Lassoes an enemy and drags them in Batrider's wake. Dragged units cannot move, attack, or use abilities.  Teleporting or blinking will break the lasso.
notes: Killing the target or the Batrider will break the lasso before its expiration.
If Batrider moves more than 425 units in 0.05 seconds the lasso breaks.
Batrider cannot attack while using Flaming Lasso.
abilities.lore: Few dare to ask to ride on the bat, as Batrider gives them free of charge.

abilities.name: Wild Axes
abilities.description: Beastmaster sends his axes flying and calls them home again, slicing through enemy units and trees along their path.  Each axe can hit an enemy once, and amplifies subsequent damage from Beastmaster and his units.
notes: This ability destroys trees.
abilities.lore: While learning to maneuver in nature alone, the Beastmaster also mastered the use of a pair of tomahawks, adept at cutting down trees as well as adversaries.

abilities.name: Call of the Wild Boar
abilities.description: Beastmaster calls forth a Boar to aid in the battlefield. The Boar has a passive poison attack that slows attack and movement speeds.
abilities.lore: After befriending the strange beast of his childhood, Beastmaster has learned to call to animals in times of need.

abilities.name: Call of the Wild Hawk
abilities.description: Beastmaster sends an invisible Hawk to scout an area.
abilities.lore: After befriending the strange beast of his childhood, Beastmaster has learned to call to animals in times of need.

abilities.name: Inner Beast
abilities.description: Untaps the inner fury of nearby allies, passively increasing their attack speed.
abilities.lore: Beastmaster's ability to incite the innate strength of animals was seen in the mauling of the king of Slom.

abilities.name: Drums of Slom
abilities.description: Attacks from Beastmaster or a nearby unit he controls will cause him bang his drum, dealing damage to nearby units and  healing Beastmaster and units under his control for a portion of the damage dealt. Every attack decreases the interval between drum hits down to a minimum of 0.4s between hits after 20 attacks. If no attacks are made, the intervals gradually increase.Using Primal Roar counts as 10/15/20 attacks, based on the current level of Primal Roar.
abilities.lore: Nature's rage is timeless, and for those who know the secrets, it's easy to stir the echoes of ire that rejoiced in the downfall of Slom.

abilities.name: Primal Roar
abilities.description: Beastmaster lets loose a deafening roar that stuns, and shoves open a path to its target. All units in the path of the roar are damaged, while units shoved aside by the roar have their movement and attack speed slowed. Additionally, Beastmaster and his units gain 40% movement speed for 3 seconds.
abilities.lore: The Beastmaster has learned to channel his primal instincts into an animalistic roar, causing devastation in the ranks of enemies.

abilities.name: Drums of Slom Cance
abilities.description: Cancels Drums of Slom ability

abilities.name: Bloodrage
abilities.description: Drives Bloodseeker into a bloodthirsty rage which causes him to attack faster and deal more spell damage at the cost of a percentage of his health per second. Provides half attack speed to allied heroes.
notes: Damage dealt to Bloodseeker or allies is non-lethal and can never kill a hero.
abilities.lore: Strygwyr shares his animalistic thirst for bloodshed.

abilities.name: Blood Rite
abilities.description: Bloodseeker baptizes an area in sacred blood. After 2.9 seconds the ritual completes, causing any enemies caught in the area to take damage and become silenced.
notes: Total time is a 2.6 second delay plus a [0.3] second cast time.
abilities.lore: The Flayed Twins are ever willing to aid those who spill blood upon the field of battle.

abilities.name: Thirst
abilities.description: Bloodseeker is invigorated by the wounds of his enemies, restoring some life when he kills a unit. Restores for half values when denying, or if an ally kills a nearby enemy hero. Also gains bonus movement speed when an enemy hero's health falls below 80%, with the bonuses increasing as their health falls further. If an enemy hero's health falls below 25%, he will also gain vision and True Sight of that hero. Bonuses stack per hero. Unlocks max movement speed for Bloodseeker.
notes: Not triggered by Illusions.
Max movement speed bonus occurs when an enemy's health is at or below 25%.
Effects linger for 4.0 seconds if a target dies.
abilities.lore: Strygwyr becomes frenzied when blood is spilled.

abilities.name: Blood Mist
abilities.description: Bloodseeker sprays his blood continuously in the area around him, losing health to damage and slow his enemies. While active, Thirst's healing is increased. Cannot be turned off while on cooldown. Additionally, passively turns all your overheal from your own abilities into an all damage barrier up to 50% of Bloodseeker's Max Health. Barrier amount decays by 0.5% per second.
notes: Damage dealt to Bloodseeker is non-lethal and can never kill a hero.

abilities.name: Rupture
abilities.description: Causes an enemy unit's skin to rupture, dealing initial damage based on its current health. If the unit moves, it takes damage based on the distance moved.
abilities.lore: When the Bloodseeker hunts you, injuries become fatalities.

abilities.name: Shuriken Toss
abilities.description: Hurls a deadly shuriken at an enemy unit, dealing damage and briefly slowing the target.  The shuriken will bounce to any Tracked units who are within a 1200 radius of each other.  Deals bonus damage to Tracked targets.
abilities.lore: While the shuriken may be small, Gondar's precise aim can cause critical damage.

abilities.name: Jinada
abilities.description: Bounty Hunter plans his next hit, dealing bonus damage and stealing some unreliable gold.
abilities.lore: Gondar's vast experience ensures he never walks away from a transaction empty-handed.

abilities.name: Shadow Walk
abilities.description: Bounty Hunter becomes invisible and gains the ability to move through other units until he attacks or uses an ability.  If he breaks the invisibility with an attack, that attack will stun the target for a short duration.
notes: Will not break most channeling of spells upon activation.
abilities.lore: The court jesters present during King Goff's assassination can recount no other image than a dancing shadow.

abilities.name: Track
abilities.description: Tracks an enemy hero, granting True Sight of the target, and information on how much gold it is carrying. Bounty Hunter moves fast when near the tracked unit and deals critical strikes when attacking it. If the target dies, Bounty Hunter and nearby heroes collect a bonus bounty of gold. Casting Track does not take you out of invisibility.
notes: Bounty Hunter will get the bonus gold if the target dies while Track is active, regardless of how it died.
Track's effect is only visible to allies.
You can see the amount of gold the target is carrying by mousing over the debuff icon above the target's ability bar.
Bonus gold is reliable gold.
abilities.lore: Using his elevated senses of sight and smell, Gondar's hits have quite a good chance of success.

abilities.name: Thunder Clap
abilities.description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy units.
abilities.lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.

abilities.name: Cinder Brew
abilities.description: Drenches himself and an area in alcohol, causing enemy units to move slower and ignited once they take any spell damage. Duration is increased by 3.0 seconds when enemies are ignited. While Brewmaster is Brewed Up, His Drunken Brawler Stances are stronger.
abilities.lore: The Order of the Oyo's solution to all problems - another round!

abilities.name: Drunken Brawler
abilities.description: Brewmaster can switch stances based on the elements he controls, gaining passive bonuses that improve against enemies when Brewed Up.
notes: Stacks diminishingly with other sources of Evasion.
abilities.lore: When Mangix won his title as the Brewmaster of the Order of Oyo, he also claimed his place in the mastery of inebriation.

abilities.name: Primal Companion
abilities.description: Creates a Brewling based on Brewmaster's current Drunken Brawler Stance. If the Brewling moves 1600 range away from Brewmaster, it can no longer cast spells and is slowed by 50%. Otherwise, all of the Brewling spells have a 100% cooldown penalty. A new Brewling cannot be resummoned for 3s if the current one takes damage from enemy Heroes or hero-controlled units. If the Brewling dies, the ability goes on cooldown for 70 seconds.Only one Brewling can exist at a time. If Brewmaster uses Primal Split, the existing Brewling disappears.
abilities.lore: Mangix doesn't hold to it by rule, but he vaguely recalls an old master musing that, if one could manage, scaring up a companion was always preferable to drinking alone.

abilities.name: Primal Split
abilities.description: Splits Brewmaster into elements, forming 4 specialized warriors, adept at survival, each with their own abilities. If any of them survive until the end of their summoned timer, the Brewmaster is reborn.
notes: The Earth Element will carry all auras that the Brewmaster has, as well as True Sight.
The Fire Element has phased movement.
When the spell ends, Brewmaster will take the place of an element in this order, assuming they are alive: Earth, Storm, Fire.
abilities.lore: It isn't clear whether Mangix is consciously aware of his potent bond with nature, as it often occurs in the midst of a drunken stupor.

abilities.name: Viscous Nasal Goo
abilities.description: Covers a target in snot, causing it to have reduced armor and movement speed.  Multiple casts stack and refresh the duration.
abilities.lore: Having caught a cold while stuck in the snow, Bristleback turns it to his advantage.

abilities.name: Quill Spray
abilities.description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback.  Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14.0 seconds.
notes: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.
abilities.lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.

abilities.name: Bristleback
abilities.description: Bristleback takes less damage if hit on the sides or rear.  If Bristleback takes 225 damage from the rear, he releases a Quill Spray of the current level.
notes: Bristleback's rear is considered to be within 70 degrees from the back.
Bristleback's side is considered to be within 110 degrees from the back.
abilities.lore: Turning his back to a fight might be just the thing.

abilities.name: Hairball
abilities.description: Coughs a quill-packed hairball towards the target location. Erupts at the location, hitting enemies in with Viscous Nasal Goo and stacks of Quill Spray.

abilities.name: Warpath
abilities.description: Bristleback works himself up into a fury every time he casts a spell, increasing his movement speed and damage.
notes: Bristleback's illusions will receive the bonuses.
Items will not trigger Warpath.
abilities.lore: 'Temper, temper,' his mum always chided.  But in a fight, a temper can come in handy.

abilities.name: Insatiable Hunger
abilities.description: A violent lust for vital fluids increases Broodmother's attack damage and gives her a vampiric attack.
notes: Fully stacks with other sources of lifesteal.
abilities.lore: While most of her prey is wrapped in silken cocoons and saved for her young, the Broodmother herself has a taste for wandering heroes.

abilities.name: Spin Web
abilities.description: Spins a large web that grants Broodmother a passive movement speed increase, increases her Turn Rate, and boosts regeneration while in its vicinity, as well as giving free movement. Spin Web charges restore every 30 seconds, with a max of [4, 6, 8, 10] charges. Spin Web can be cast from anywhere as long as the new web touches an existing web. Webs never expire, and can be manually destroyed. When the maximum limit of webs is exceeded, the oldest web disappears. The movement bonus is proportional to the unit's HP
notes: Also affects Spiderling and Spiderites.
Grants full movement speed bonus at 100% HP, 0% movement speed bonus at 1HP
abilities.lore: Weaving a bed of silken fibers, Arachnia's web both protects her and her offspring, as well as giving advancing opponents a sense of foreboding.

abilities.name: Silken Bola
abilities.description: Deals impact damage, then slows the target and causes them to miss some attacks. Units that attack the target deal bonus magic damage.

abilities.name: Spinner's Snare
abilities.description: Broodmother may create up to 5 invisible web lines touching any existing web. Enemy Heroes that cross the web line will spring the trap, becoming rooted, revealed in fog, and take damage over time.  Multiple Heroes can trip on the same line until it's destroyed after being initially triggered.  Broodmother's team is alerted via the minimap when an enemy has triggered the snare.
abilities.lore: The slightest tremor of her web is all Arachnia needs to find her prey.

abilities.name: Spawn Spiderlings
abilities.description: Broodmother injects her young into an enemy unit, dealing damage. The spiderlings will hatch if the target is killed while under this influence.
notes: If the target is killed within 20 seconds of being hit with this skill, the Spiderlings will spawn.
Units killed by Spiderlings will then give birth to Spiderites, smaller and less powerful versions of the Spiderlings.
abilities.lore: Black Arachnia continues to raise her young, even amidst the field of combat.  The brood quickly learns how to support their mother.

abilities.name: Hoof Stomp
abilities.description: Slams the ground, stunning and damaging nearby enemy units.
abilities.lore: When the mighty hoof of the Warrunner touches soil, the tremors are felt far and wide.

abilities.name: Double Edge
abilities.description: Centaur strikes a mighty blow at melee range, damaging both himself and a small area around the target. Deals extra damage based on your strength. Centaur cannot die from Double Edge.
notes: Double Edge deals magic type damage to both the targets and himself.
abilities.lore: In the spurs of combat, Bradwarden's vicious strikes sometimes cause self-inflicted collateral damage.

abilities.name: Retaliate
abilities.description: Centaur counters all attacks, dealing damage back to the attacker. Returns a fixed amount plus a percentage of your strength. Deals half damage to towers.
notes: Retaliate triggers when the attack hits.
Retaliate deals damage to towers.
abilities.lore: Bradwarden has no need to parry his opponent's attacks; his armor-like hide does it for him.

abilities.name: Hitch A Ride
abilities.description: Centaur tosses an ally into a cart hitched behind him. While in the cart, Centaur gains the benefit of Stampede and the ally can still cast and attack normally, but cannot move independently or be targeted by opponents. Non-targeted effects can still affect the hitched ally. Increases the attack range of melee heroes by 200.
abilities.lore: The needs of Bradwarden's ample pride pale greatly in the face of his demand for victory.

abilities.name: Stampede
abilities.description: Centaur leads all allies into a vicious charge causing them to move through units at max speed and slow any enemy units they trample. Trampled enemies take damage based on Centaur Warrunner's strength. Each enemy can be trampled once.
abilities.lore: The great belt of Omexe, which labels Bradwarden as the greatest warrior of his kind, incites his fellow gladiators to follow him into barbarous combat.

abilities.name: Chaos Bolt
abilities.description: Throws a mysterious bolt of energy at the target unit. It stuns for a random duration and deals random damage.
notes: The stun duration and damage values dealt are inversely related.
Nearby illusions will mimic the cast animation.
abilities.lore: Even Chaos Knight cannot predict this manifest of unholy energy.

abilities.name: Reality Rift
abilities.description: Teleports Chaos Knight, any illusions he has, and the target unit to a point along the line between him and the target. Reduces armor of the enemy unit for 6.0 seconds.
notes: Chaos Knight and the target unit are made to face each other, and Chaos Knight and his phantasms are issued an attack order against the target.
abilities.lore: Armageddon rides between the planes, bringing Chaos Knight to his victim wherever he may hide.

abilities.name: Chaos Strike
abilities.description: Chaos Knight and his illusions' attacks have a chance to deal a critical strike of varying strength with bonus lifesteal. Deals 1.5x damage to creeps, but lifesteal from creeps is reduced by 50%.
abilities.lore: Chaos Knight's unwieldy power bludgeons those who stand before him, crushing the thickest of armors.

abilities.name: Phantasm
abilities.description: Summons several phantasmal copies of the Chaos Knight from alternate dimensions. The phantasms are strong illusions that deal 100% damage, but take 325% damage.
notes: Removes most negative buffs from Chaos Knight.
Chaos Knight is invulnerable for 0.5 seconds when casting, allowing him to dodge stuns and damage.
Strong Illusions are not instantly killed by spells.
abilities.lore: Drawing on his battles fought across many worlds and many times, phantasms of the Chaos Knight rise up to quell all who oppose him.

abilities.name: Penitence
abilities.description: Forces an enemy unit to move slower and for allies to attack it more quickly.
abilities.lore: Although Chen's brand of animal enthrallment isn't quite strong enough to control the minds of enemy heroes, it still tests their resolve in combat.

abilities.name: Holy Persuasion
abilities.description: Chen takes control of an enemy or neutral creep and receives gold equal to its bounty. If the persuaded creep's base health is naturally below the health minimum, its base health will be raised to the health minimum. Converted creeps will have increased movement speed and bonus damage.
notes: Persuading a new creep above max unit count causes the oldest persuaded creep to die.
Can target Ancient creeps when Chen has Aghanim's Shard.
The health of creeps already under Chen's control does not update to the new level upon leveling Holy Persuasion further.
Fully restores the creep's mana upon converting.
abilities.lore: Although they may not be knights, Chen incorporates beasts into the Fold in the same way he himself was converted.

abilities.name: Divine Favor
abilities.description: Passively provides an aura that grants increased health regeneration and armor.
abilities.lore: Chen's zeal is infectious, blessing his allies with vitality and compelling them to his side.

abilities.name: Hand of God
abilities.description: Heals all allied heroes on the map as well as all units under Chen's control. A large heal is applied at first and a slow heal over time is applied for 8 seconds afterwards.
notes: Can heal invulnerable and hidden/banished allies.
abilities.lore: Using the mental link with his thralls, Chen calls down restoration and well-being to those who share his fanaticism.

abilities.name: Strafe
abilities.description: Clinkz gains attack speed and has bonus attack range. Any current Burning Skeleton Archers skeletons within a 1200 radius of Clinkz also gain bonus attack range and 50% of the attack speed bonus.  Casting Strafe does not break Skeleton Walk invisibility.

abilities.name: Tar Bomb
abilities.description: Clinkz throws a projectile filled with tar at the target enemy, dealing Magic damage on impact. After impact, the tar spills onto the ground and stays there for 5 seconds. Any enemy that walks across it gets slowed, and attacks from Clinkz or his Burning Army Skeleton Archers will deal bonus physical damage. When the Tar Bomb hits, any Burning Army skeletons within attack range will attack the target.

abilities.name: Death Pact
abilities.description: Clinkz consumes the target enemy creep or friendly skeleton and creates a Burning Skeleton Archer in their place, healing and gaining max health. Does not take Clinkz out of Skeleton Walk. Archers are immobile and die within several attacks from a hero. Skeletons deal a percentage of Clinkz' damage. Attack range is equal to Clinkz's attack range. Only one archer can be summoned from Death Pact at a time. Skeletons deal 25% less damage to buildings
notes: If the target is an enemy, Clinkz will gain the correct experience and gold.
Increases Clinkz' current and max HP.
When the duration ends, max HP returns to normal, but current HP stays the same.
abilities.lore: Sutherex' bond of life and death has become a part of Clinkz, and his old bones are refreshed with repetition of the pact on lesser beings.

abilities.name: Burning Army
abilities.description: Summons a row of Burning Skeleton Archers in the target location.
abilities.lore: Existing on the brink of life and death, Clinkz has learned to temporarily bridge the gap between the two.

abilities.name: Burning Barrage
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Clinkz channels and shoots multiple piercing arrows in the target direction that hit all enemy units dealing a percentage of Clinkz' attack damage and applying attack modifiers, and dousing enemies with Tar Bomb slow.
notes: Bonus Attack Range increases the length of Burning Barrage.
abilities.lore: It's hard to say whether the blur around the Bone Fletcher is from his flaming heart or his speed with the quiver.

abilities.name: Skeleton Walk
abilities.description: Clinkz moves invisibly through units until the moment he attacks or uses items. Leaving Skeleton Walk creates Burning Skeleton Archers
notes: Has a fadetime of [0, 0, 0] seconds.
abilities.lore: With a burst of fire and puff of smoke, the Bone Fletcher was nowhere to be seen.

abilities.name: Battery Assault
abilities.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun. Deals double damage to creeps.
notes: Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled.
abilities.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.

abilities.name: Power Cogs
abilities.description: Forms a barrier of energized cogs around Clockwerk, trapping any units that are near. Allies in the cogs when they are created receive a magic damage barrier. Enemies outside the trap that touch a cog are knocked back, losing health and mana. Once a cog has delivered a shock, it will power down.  Cogs can be destroyed by enemy attacks, but Clockwerk can destroy them with just one.
notes: Cogs can shock invisible units.
abilities.lore: One of Clockwerk's inventions of which he is most proud is the power cog - though it is sometimes despised by his allies.

abilities.name: Rocket Flare
abilities.description: Fires a global range flare that explodes over a given area. Upon impact, enemies in the area take damage and are briefly slowed. Rocket flare provides vision over the impact area for 6.0 seconds.
abilities.lore: What started as a festive display has become a useful scouting and bombardment tool.

abilities.name: Overclocking
abilities.description: Supercharges Clockwerks abilities: Battery Assault affects all enemies in it's range; Clockwerk's attack speed in Power Cogs is increased; Rocket Flares have a reduced cooldown and fire additional rockets to either side of the target; Hookshot stun radius and duration is increased. Clockwerk becomes stunned after the duration runs out.
abilities.lore: Rattletrap understands the limitations of his armor. Just as he understands the risks of pushing past them in times of need.

abilities.name: Jetpack
abilities.description: Clockwerk activates a jetpack, gaining flying movement, flying vision, and bonus movement speed. Clockwerk has a severely-limited turn rate during this time and cannot attack. Jetpack is cancelled upon casting Hookshot.

abilities.name: Hookshot
abilities.description: Fires a grappling device rapidly at the target location.  If the hook hits a unit, Clockwerk launches himself into the target, stunning and dealing damage to everyone in a [175, 175, 175] radius around the hit target.  Any enemies Clockwerk collides with along the way are damaged and stunned.
notes: Hookshot will latch and take Clockwerk to allies, but not damage or disable them.
abilities.lore: A somewhat unwieldy device, the Hookshot sends the otherwise clunky Clockwerk armor flying through the air.

abilities.name: Crystal Nova
abilities.description: A burst of damaging frost slows enemy movement and attack rate in the targeted area.
notes: Crystal Nova provides vision in the targeted area for the duration.
abilities.lore: The air temperature around Rylai drops rapidly, chilling all around her to the core.

abilities.name: Frostbite
abilities.description: Encases an enemy unit in ice, prohibiting movement and attack, while dealing damage over time. Lasts 10 seconds on creeps level 6 or lower.
notes: Frostbite is considered a root.
abilities.lore: Rylai channels winds from the Blueheart Glacier, imprisoning attackers in thick blocks of ice.

abilities.name: Arcane Aura
abilities.description: Gives additional mana regeneration to all friendly units on the map. Allies within a 1200 radius of Crystal Maiden receive 3x the mana regeneration. Crystal Maiden herself receives 6x the bonus.
abilities.lore: Cold temperatures promote the essence of magic, causing Rylai's presence to allow spell usage in abundance.

abilities.name: Freezing Field
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Surrounds Crystal Maiden with 100 random icy explosions that slow enemies and deal massive damage. Grants bonus armor while channeling. Lasts 10 seconds.
notes: The slow is applied on all enemies in the radius, even if they aren't hit by an explosion (lasts 1.0 second).
Explosions occur every 0.1 seconds.
abilities.lore: Once the place of her exile, Icewrack has become an anchor for Rylai's frigid onslaught.

abilities.name: Stop Freezing Field
abilities.description: Immediately stops the Freezing Field

abilities.name: Vacuum
abilities.description: Dark Seer creates a vacuum over the target area that sucks in enemy units, disrupting them and dealing damage.
notes: This ability interrupts channeling.
Pulls units over [0.3, 0.4, 0.5, 0.6] seconds before dealing damage.
Trees near the center of the vacuum will be destroyed.
abilities.lore: Ish'Kafel modifies the center of gravity to a place of his choosing.

abilities.name: Ion Shell
abilities.description: Surrounds the target unit with a bristling shield that damages enemy units in an area around it.
notes: Deals small amounts of damage in 0.2 second intervals.
Doesn't damage the target it is cast on.
If cast on a unit that already has Ion Shell, the new Shell replaces the old one.
abilities.lore: The Dark Seer slices holes into the 'Land Behind the Wall,' causing prismatic energy to seep forth.

abilities.name: Surge
abilities.description: Charges a target friendly unit with power, giving it a brief burst of phased movement speed. Allows the unit to reach maximum movement speed and cannot be slowed.
notes: Units with Surge cannot be slowed unless the Surge effect is removed.
abilities.lore: Ish'Kafel once used his speed of mind to navigate the maze between the walls.

abilities.name: Normal Punch
abilities.description: Passive ability. Causes Dark Seer's next attack on a hero to have True Strike, knock a replica out of the victim, damaging and stunning them based on how far Dark Seer has moved in the past 3.0 seconds. Max power is reached after 900 distance moved.

abilities.name: Wall of Replica
abilities.description: Raises a wall of warping light that slows and creates replicas of any enemy hero who crosses it. Enemy replicas serve at the Dark Seer's will. Replicas last until they are destroyed, or until the wall's duration ends.
notes: Doesn't create illusions from other illusions.
There cannot be more than one illusion per player per wall.
Wall of Replica will not slow spell-immune enemies.
abilities.lore: The Dark Seer, while unable to return to his natural realm, can channel part of the prismatic wall with powerful strength of mind, sowing confusion amongst enemy ranks.

abilities.name: Bramble Maze
abilities.description: Dark Willow creates a maze of brambles that grow in the target area after 0.3 seconds.  Enemies that walk into a bramble are rooted and take damage over time.
notes: Does not reveal rooted invisible enemies.
Does not interrupt channeling spells upon rooting.
abilities.lore: The fae realm exists all around you, merely waiting to draw you in...

abilities.name: Shadow Realm
abilities.description: Dark Willow recedes into the shadows, becoming untargetable.  Her next attack has increased attack range and deals bonus magic damage, and will end Shadow Realm. Damage scales based on how long she remains under the effects of Shadow Realm, the maximum being reached after 3.5 seconds.
notes: Disjoints projectiles upon cast.
Grants phased movement.
Spells which require vision cannot affect Dark Willow in the Shadow Realm.
abilities.lore: What you can't see will most definitely hurt you.

abilities.name: Cursed Crown
abilities.description: Dark Willow casts an ancient fae curse on the target. After a delay, the target and nearby enemies are stunned.
abilities.lore: Didn't anyone ever tell you? Never strike a deal with a fairy...

abilities.name: Bedlam
abilities.description: Dark Willow's pet wisp roams around her for the duration, rapidly attacking nearby enemies.  Bedlam cannot be used while Terrorize is active.
abilities.lore: You'll have to excuse my friend Jex. He's really into murder.

abilities.name: Terrorize
abilities.description: Dark Willow releases her pet wisp to terrorize her enemies. After a short delay, all enemies in the target area become fearful and run toward their home fountain. Terrorize cannot be used while Bedlam is active.
notes: Terrorize provides vision on affected units.
abilities.lore: You think you know the first thing about fear? Jex'll show you what that word truly means...

abilities.name: Starbreaker
abilities.description: Dawnbreaker whirls her hammer around 3 times, damaging enemies with her attack plus bonus damage. On the final strike, she smashes her hammer down, stunning and damaging enemies in front of her.
notes: Dawnbreaker travels at a rate of 215 for the duration of the ability and takes a brief 0.2s to recover after the final strike.
Celestial Hammer or Solar Guardian cannot be cast during the combo.
Cleave does not work with this ability.
Can be self-cast to move forward
abilities.lore: Across the vast lineage of star progeny, there were multitudes unwilling to align with the aims of the Children of Light. To those who dared organize defiance, the Children would dispatch Valora and her hammer to show a measure of their power--to leave the rebels either shattered or set back to rights.

abilities.name: Celestial Hammer
abilities.description: Dawnbreaker hurls her weapon at a target, damaging enemies struck along the way. The hammer pauses for 2 seconds at the destination before flying back to her, leaving a trail of fire that slows enemies. Dawnbreaker can recall the hammer at any time, pulling her towards it so they meet in the middle.
notes: The hammer damages enemies both when thrown and when returning to Dawnbreaker.
Dawnbreaker's Converge movement distance is capped at the ability's cast range.
Starbreaker or Solar Guardian cannot be cast while the Hammer is out.
abilities.lore: The Brightmaul is Valora's oldest companion and sole remaining connection to the glow of her creators.

abilities.name: Luminosity
abilities.description: After a number of attacks, Dawnbreaker powers up, charging her next attack with a critical hit that heals all allied heroes within 650 units around her for a portion of attack damage dealt. Creeps and neutral enemies provide less healing. Allies are healed for 50% of the amount.
notes: Luminosity Heal is considered a lifesteal and increased by sources of Lifesteal Amplification.
abilities.lore: Diminished in power without access to the Children's replenishing light, Valora can still recharge herself and her allies by creating order from the chaos which resides within each fight.

abilities.name: Converge
abilities.description: Dawnbreaker recalls her hammer, pulling them together so they meet in the middle.

abilities.name: Solar Guardian
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Dawnbreaker creates a pulsing effect at a location within 350 units of an allied hero anywhere on the map, damaging enemies and healing allies with each pulse. After a short duration, she flies to the target location, dealing additional damage and stunning enemies upon landing. Once channeled, Dawnbreaker cannot stop the ability.
notes: Pulse interval is 0.5s.
Total duration flight duration is [1.7] seconds of channel time + 0.8 of flight time.
Cannot be cast without the Hammer.
Healing does not affect Dawnbreaker herself.
abilities.lore: Only in defense of an ally will Valora relent to call upon the last reserves of her old powers that still allow cosmic flight.

abilities.name: Land Solar Guardian
abilities.description: Can be cast to land Dawnbreaker into the target area at any time.

abilities.name: Poison Touch
abilities.description: Releases a cone of poison that strikes multiple enemy units. Deals damage over time and slows the targets. Anytime the targets get attacked by Dazzle, the debuff duration is refreshed and slow is increased.
notes: The damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.
abilities.lore: One of the few Dezun rites used for offensive purposes, the paralytic enchantment often proves useful.

abilities.name: Shallow Grave
abilities.description: An ally blessed with Shallow Grave, no matter how close to death, cannot die while under its protection. Healing on that ally is also amplified for the duration based on the hero's HP.
notes: HP cannot go below 1 while under the effects of Shallow Grave, but Axe's Culling Blade will still kill the hero.
abilities.lore: Only a seasoned acolyte of the Shadow can properly perform the rite of preventing death.

abilities.name: Shadow Wave
abilities.description: Sends out a bolt of power that arcs between allies, healing them while damaging any enemy units standing nearby.  Dazzle is always healed by Shadow Wave.
notes: Prioritizes allied heroes over creeps.
If enemies are near multiple allied units affected by Shadow Wave, they will take multiple instances of damage.
abilities.lore: While it is a simplistic and routine rite among Shadow Priests, the Shadow Wave is also the most critical for success.

abilities.name: Bad Juju
abilities.description: Whenever a Unit is affected by Dazzle's spells they temporarily gain/lose armor.
abilities.lore: Each invocation of the Nothl realm helps it further permeate the surroundings of our own.

abilities.name: Crypt Swarm
abilities.description: Sends a swarm of winged beasts to savage enemy units in front of Death Prophet.
notes: Can hit units up to 1110 range away.
abilities.lore: Krobelus' many trips to the grave gather a flock of the damned.

abilities.name: Silence
abilities.description: Fires a projectile that prevents enemy units in a target area from casting spells.
notes: Doesn't prevent usage of items.
abilities.lore: Peering into the veil of her opponent's demise, Krobelus sees a silent future.

abilities.name: Spirit Siphon
abilities.description: Creates a spirit link between Death Prophet and an enemy unit, draining health from the enemy.
notes: Cannot cast multiple on same target.
abilities.lore: Krobelus willingly shows others the path she alone cannot follow.

abilities.name: Exorcism
abilities.description: Unleashes evil spirits to drain the life of nearby enemy units and structures. Spirits need to return back to Death Prophet in order to attack again. At the end of the spell's duration, Death Prophet is healed in proportion to the damage dealt. Deals 50% damage to buildings. Lasts [35] seconds. Passively grants Movement Speed.
notes: Radius represents the area in which the spirits will acquire targets around Death Prophet.
Spirit damage isn't reduced by damage block abilities.
abilities.lore: Over time, the banshee remnants of her previous lives return to haunt the present.

abilities.name: Thunder Strike
abilities.description: Repeatedly strikes the targeted unit with lightning.  Each strike damages nearby enemy units in a small radius and slows enemy movement and attack speed by 100% for [0, 0, 0, 0] seconds.  Provides vision of its target.
abilities.lore: Disruptor's charged coils occasionally overload, and a singed armor plate or tuft of fur is the enemy's result.

abilities.name: Glimpse
abilities.description: Teleports the target hero back to where it was 4 seconds ago.  Instantly kills illusions. Deals damage based on distance glimpsed, with max damage dealt at 1400 distance.
notes: The travel time is a function of the distance the target will travel.
abilities.lore: Playing with electricity can have unexpected results.

abilities.name: Kinetic Field
abilities.description: After a short formation time, creates a circular barrier of kinetic energy that enemies can't pass.
notes: Debuff Immune units can travel through the field.
abilities.lore: The stryder is immune to the gale-force winds that will consume its adversaries.

abilities.name: Static Storm
abilities.description: Creates a damaging static storm that also silences all enemy units in the area for the duration.  The damage starts off weak, but increases in power over the duration.
abilities.lore: A summer squall in Druud is a hardship that only an Oglodi can survive.

abilities.name: Devour
abilities.description: Consumes an enemy or neutral creep, acquiring any special abilities that it possessed and gaining armor temporarily while it digests the creep. If autocast is deactivated, Doom will not acquire the creep's abilities. Duration is equal to the cooldown.
notes: Gives Doom the original bounty of the creep, along with the bonus gold.
If you devour a creep without abilities, you'll keep the abilities you had previously.
abilities.lore: Lucifer's appetite and greed are never sated.

abilities.name: Scorched Earth
abilities.description: Carpets the nearby earth in flames which damage enemies, while also granting him increased movement speed.
notes: Scorched Earth follows Doom, centered on his location.
abilities.lore: The Fallen One spreads destruction in his wake, sparing none from the flame which sustains him.

abilities.name: Infernal Blade
abilities.description: Doom swings his burning sword, igniting the enemy. Stuns for 0.5 seconds and applies a 4.0 second burn that deals a base damage plus a percentage of the target's Max HP as damage per second.
notes: Interrupts channeling abilities.
abilities.lore: Lucifer shares the fire branding bestowed upon him at the time of his exile.

abilities.name: Doom
abilities.description: Inflicts a curse that dispels an enemy Hero and prevents them from casting spells or using items, while taking damage over time.
notes: Units afflicted by Doom can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.
abilities.lore: When a name is tolled from the bell of Vashundol, doom is sure to follow.

abilities.name: Breathe Fire
abilities.description: Unleashes a breath of fire in front of Dragon Knight that burns enemies and reduces the damage their attacks deal.While in Dragon Form, applies the corresponding debuff from Corrosive Breath and Frost Breath when in those forms.
notes: Hits units up to 900 away.
abilities.lore: Knight Davion's breath has become that of the mighty Eldwurm Slyrak, remembered for burning numerous other knights to a crisp.

abilities.name: Dragon Tail
abilities.description: Dragon Knight smites an enemy unit in melee range with his shield, stunning it while dealing minor damage.  When in Elder Dragon Form, the cast range increases to 400.
abilities.lore: Davion's combination of dragon talents and knightly skills makes him a vicious opponent in melee combat.

abilities.name: Dragon Blood
abilities.description: The life blood of the Dragon improves health regeneration and strengthens armor.
abilities.lore: Slyrak's blood still courses through Davion's veins, giving him twice the vitality of an ordinary knight.

abilities.name: Fireball
abilities.description: Ignites an area, dealing damage over time that lingers on enemies in it. Has reduced cast range when melee.

abilities.name: Elder Dragon Form
abilities.description: Dragon Knight takes the form of one of three powerful elder dragons, increasing his speed, and Dragon Tail's range, while granting him new powers.
notes: Corrosive Breath poison damage is lethal.
Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Dragon Knight was in when the item was used.
abilities.lore: The dormant dragon power springs forth from within Davion, combining the powers of a legendary knight with a legendary Eldwurm.

abilities.name: Frost Arrows
abilities.description: Adds a freezing effect to Drow's attacks, slowing enemy movement and dealing bonus damage.  Slow lasts [1.5] seconds.
notes: The slow duration is refreshed on successive casts.
abilities.lore: Ice-encased arrows pierce the silence, chilling their victims to the core.

abilities.name: Gust
abilities.description: Releases a wave that silences and knocks back enemy units. Knockback distance is relative to how close they are to Drow. Drow Gains Movement Speed for the same duration.
abilities.lore: Traxex is rather fond of the tranquility of physical combat, calling on her Drow heritage to end the incantations of opposing magi.

abilities.name: Multishot
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Drow releases a flurry of arrows in continuous salvos, hitting enemies for extra damage and applying longer duration Frost Arrows. Lasts up to [1.75] seconds.
notes: Arrow base damage pierces magic immunity.
Frost Arrows' damage and slow do not pierce magic immunity.
abilities.lore: In the ranger's youth, learning to fire multiple arrows at once was considered a distracting frivolity. In the war of the Ancients, such technique has become strange necessity.

abilities.name: Glacier
abilities.description: Drow Ranger creates a hill of ice beneath her. While standing on the hill, attackers gain bonus attack range and high ground advantage - they cannot miss and gain flying vision. Drow Ranger additionally gets bonus Multishot arrows per wave while on the hill. The front of the hill obscures vision and cannot be moved through.

abilities.name: Marksmanship
abilities.description: Drow's experiences in battle grant her a chance to launch arrows with incredible accuracy and effectiveness. Pierces through the enemy's defenses, ignoring their base armor. Grants Drow and nearby ranged heroes with bonus agility based on Drow's current agility, with allies receiving 50% of the bonus Drow receives. This ability is disabled if there is an enemy hero within 400 range.
notes: Marksmanship procs have true strike.
abilities.lore: The Drow Ranger is the epitome of archery prowess.

abilities.name: Boulder Smash
abilities.description: Earth Spirit smashes the target enemy or ally, sending them in the direction he is facing. If Earth Spirit targets an area, he will smash the nearest unit in a 200 radius, prioritizing Stone Remnants. The travelling unit or Remnant damages all enemy units it hits.  If an enemy is hit by a Stone Remnant, they are also slowed. Stone Remnants travel further than other units. Deals 1.25x damage to creeps.
abilities.lore: It is with the power of a mountain that Earth Spirit strikes his enemies.

abilities.name: Rolling Boulder
abilities.description: Earth Spirit gathers himself into a boulder and, after a 0.5s delay, rolls toward the target location, dealing 30 + 100% STR damage and stunning enemy units. He will stop if he collides with an enemy hero or is stunned. If he rolls over a Stone Remnant, he will travel further and faster, and stun enemies for longer.
notes: Rolling over a Stone Remnant will destroy the Remnant.
The boulder has a radius of 160.
abilities.lore: Calling upon his connection to the land, the Earth Spirit draws loose stone to him, which forms a protective ball that he can use to roll short distances.

abilities.name: Geomagnetic Grip
abilities.description: Earth Spirit pulls the target Stone Remnant. Enemies struck by the gripped target will be silenced and take damage.
notes: Will not work on a unit inside Chronosphere, Duel, or Black Hole.
Geomagnetic Grip can also target allied creeps.
abilities.lore: Like calls to like. Even the minerals found in the blood and bones of living beings are not immune to the call of the Earth Spirit.

abilities.name: Stone Remnant
abilities.description: Call a Stone Remnant to the target location.  Stone Remnants have no vision and are invulnerable, and can be used with Earth Spirit's abilities.  Calling a Stone Remnant consumes a charge, which recharge over time. Gains additional charges every 5 hero levels.
abilities.lore: Earth Spirit calls forth a remnant of his stone army, long buried with him in the dark embrace of the Earth.

abilities.name: Enchant Remnant
abilities.description: Earth Spirit temporarily enchants a hero, granting them the properties of a Stone Remnant. After a short duration the remnant shatters, releasing the hero and damaging nearby enemies. < br>Can be cast on Stone Remnants. Has a 5 second cooldown when used that way.Has a larger cast range when cast on an ally hero.
notes: Earth Spirit himself can be targeted by Boulder Smash if he is enchanted.
abilities.lore: Kaolin uses the elemental power of the Earth to temporarily petrify living beings, so that they might be conscripted into his stone funerary army.

abilities.name: Magnetize
abilities.description: Magnetizes units in a small nearby area, causing them to take damage for a short duration. Magnetized heroes cause nearby Stone Remnants to explode, destroying the remnant and refreshing Magnetize's duration on all nearby enemies. This process can repeat multiple times. If an enemy hero is affected by Geomagnetic Grip or Boulder Smash, all magnetized heroes share the effects.
abilities.lore: At the Earth Spirit's call, the minerals in the blood and bones of his enemies rebel against the bodies they find themselves in.

abilities.name: Fissure
abilities.description: Slams the ground with a mighty totem, creating an impassable ridge of stone while stunning and damaging enemy units along its line.
notes: Creeps will wait for Fissure to disappear. They will not attempt to walk around it.
Fissure is not blocked by Linken's Sphere.
abilities.lore: The Nishian totem splits the world to its core with tectonic force.

abilities.name: Enchant Totem
abilities.description: Empowers Earthshaker's totem, causing it to deal extra damage and have 75 bonus attack range on the next attack.
notes: Bonus damage is based on base damage and that given by primary attribute.
abilities.lore: Raigor's gorilla strength can destroy mountains.

abilities.name: Aftershock
abilities.description: Causes the earth to shake underfoot, adding additional damage and stuns to nearby enemy units when Earthshaker casts his abilities.
notes: Using items does not trigger Aftershock.
abilities.lore: The earth trembles beneath the mighty footsteps of Raigor.

abilities.name: Echo Slam
abilities.description: Shockwaves travel through the ground, damaging enemy units.  Each enemy hit causes an echo to damage nearby units. Real heroes cause two echoes.
abilities.lore: Tectonic plates crack, mountains fold, and foes are crushed by the Echo Slam.

abilities.name: Echo Stomp
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Elder Titan and his Astral Spirit both stomp the ground, damaging and knocking nearby enemy units unconscious around their locations.  The Elder Titan stomp deals physical damage, while the Spirit stomp deals magical damage.
notes: If a unit is hit by Astral Spirit and Elder Titan, they will take both instances of damage.
abilities.lore: The force of creation still echoes in the stomp of the Titan.

abilities.name: Astral Spirit
abilities.description: Elder Titan sends forth his Astral Spirit, damaging any units it passes through.  When the spirit rejoins the Titan, it grants bonus damage, armor, and movement speed for each unit it passed through.
abilities.lore: Like the four fundamentals, Elder Titan exists across all planes at once and can draw other aspects of himself to assist in times of need.

abilities.name: Natural Order
abilities.description: Reduces all elements to their basic levels, removing base armor and magic damage resistance from nearby enemy units. The armor reduction is centered around the hero, while the magic armor reduction is centered around Astral Spirit.
notes: When the Astral Spirit isn't present, both the armor and magic armor reduction is centered around Elder Titan.
abilities.lore: As it was at the beginning, Elder Titan makes it so again.

abilities.name: Move Astral Spirit
abilities.description: Moves the Astral Spirit to target location.

abilities.name: Earth Splitter
abilities.description: Sends forth a jagged crack in front of Elder Titan. After 3 seconds, the crack implodes, slowing movement while dealing damage to each enemy based on their maximum life. Half of the damage dealt is Magical damage, while the other half is Physical damage.
abilities.lore: That which he created, the titan tears asunder.

abilities.name: Return Astral Spirit
abilities.description: Returns the Astral Spirit to Elder Titan.

abilities.name: Searing Chains
abilities.description: Ember Spirit unleashes fiery bolas that wrap around nearby enemies, anchoring them in place and dealing damage each second.
notes: Targets are chosen randomly around Xin.
Does not affect Debuff Immune or invisible units.
abilities.lore: Xin's harshest lessons often employed the use of red-hot chains.

abilities.name: Sleight of Fist
abilities.description: Ember Spirit dashes around with blazing speed, attacking all enemies in the targeted area of effect, then returning to his start location.  Deals bonus damage to heroes.
notes: Targets are determined when the spell is cast.
A regular attack is done to each target every 0.2 seconds.
Any attack modifier that Xin has (such as Critical Strike, Bash, Cleave, or Orb effects) will be applied normally on these attacks.
Abilities and items can be used while Sleight of Fist is active.
abilities.lore: The studied warrior must whip and weave through its enemies, burning each without pause.

abilities.name: Flame Guard
abilities.description: Ember Spirit surrounds himself with a ring of fire that creates a magic damage barrier, absorbing a percentage of the damage taken.  Flame Guard deals damage per second in an area around Ember Spirit while Flame Guard is active.  If the barrier is broken, the damage is also lost.
notes: Magic damage reduction is calculated before any reductions.
abilities.lore: An enemy should never be allowed to approach without difficulty.

abilities.name: Activate Fire Remnant
abilities.description: Select the Fire Remnant to arrive at.
abilities.lore: With blazing speed does a spirit fly!

abilities.name: Fire Remnant
abilities.description: Sends a Fire Remnant that runs to the target location at 250% Ember Spirit's speed.  Using Activate Fire Remnant, Ember Spirit will dash out to all active Fire Remnants, destroying them and dealing damage in an area and then moving to the nearest Remnant.  Ember Spirit will end at the Remnant closest to the targeted location.
notes: Starts with 3 charges (maximum).
abilities.lore: By the spirit's power are Xin's teachings spread anew.

abilities.name: Impetus
abilities.description: Places an enchantment on each attack while activated, causing it to deal additional damage based on how far away the target is.  The farther the target, the greater the damage dealt. Deals double damage to creeps and illusions.
notes: The damage is capped at 1750 distance.
Distance to target is measured when the projectile hits.
abilities.lore: While Aiushtha favors peaceful means, she is capable of a magical onslaught from a distance, her spears gaining energy from the natural life around her.

abilities.name: Enchant
abilities.description: Enchantress charms an enemy. If the enemy is a hero, they are slowed. If the enemy is a creep, she brings it under her control, increasing its attack damage and max health.
notes: Illusions can be converted.
abilities.lore: A true steward of the forest, Aiushtha befriends all within it - from lowly trolls to powerful centaurs.

abilities.name: Nature's Attendants
abilities.description: A cloud of wisps heals Enchantress and any friendly units nearby. Lasts [9, 10, 11, 12] seconds.
notes: Units with full HP will not be selected for the heal.
abilities.lore: Whimsical spirits of the woods possess a healing power that is quite subtle, but gains strength in numbers.

abilities.name: Sproink
abilities.description: Leaps backward, dodges incoming projectiles, and launches an Impetus attack on the 3 furthest enemy units within Enchantress' attack range + 200.
abilities.lore: Sproink is as Sproink does.

abilities.name: Little Friends
abilities.description: All creeps, ally, enemy and neutral within a radius will gain bonus movement and attack speed and attack Enchantress' chosen target for 6 seconds.

abilities.name: Untouchable
abilities.description: Enchantress beguiles her enemies, slowing their attacks when she is attacked.
notes: All units who directly attack Enchantress will get slowed.
The slow is applied on the attacking unit when the attack starts, not when damage is applied.
abilities.lore: After attacking Aiushtha, most opponents are overwhelmed with guilt having attacked such a natural beauty.

abilities.name: Malefice
abilities.description: Focuses Enigma's power on a target, causing it to take damage and become repeatedly stunned for multiple instances.  An instance strikes every [2, 2, 2, 2] seconds.
abilities.lore: Strange gravities pull at the core of those who would oppose you, holding them in place.

abilities.name: Demonic Conversion
abilities.description: Transforms a creep into three fragments of Enigma himself.  These eidolons are all under Enigma's control, and repeated successful attacks cause them to multiply.  When this happens, the eidolons have their health restored.
notes: Converted enemy units will give gold bounty and experience.
Converted allied units will be denied.
Cannot be used on Ancient creeps or neutral creeps that are greater than level 4.
Cannot be used on allied Flagbearer creeps.
abilities.lore: Enigma is capable of drawing aspects of himself from other dimensions - the result is a trio of dark eidolons that hunt the corporeal plane.

abilities.name: Midnight Pulse
abilities.description: Steeps an area in dark resonance, damaging enemy units based on their current HP.
notes: This ability destroys trees in its area.
Multiple instances of Midnight Pulse do not stack.
abilities.lore: A section of the world slowly descends into the void.

abilities.name: Black Hole
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Summons a vortex that sucks in nearby enemy units.  Enemies affected by Black Hole cannot move, attack, or cast spells.
abilities.lore: The ground trembles as Enigma channels his ultimate vortex of destruction, a singularity with the power to end worlds.

abilities.name: Time Walk
abilities.description: Rushes to a target location while backtracking any damage taken the last 2.0 seconds.
notes: Faceless Void is invulnerable while using Time Walk.
abilities.lore: Darkterror tears a hole in time, passing through Claszureme, and appearing back in an instant.

abilities.name: Time Dilation
abilities.description: Faceless Void traps all nearby enemies in a time dilation field for [8, 9, 10, 11] seconds, extending their cooldowns and slowing their movement and attack speed by 10% for each cooldown extended. Deals bonus damage per second for each cooldown. The debuff does not tick down while inside Chronosphere.
notes: Does not affect item cooldowns.
abilities.lore: For those facing off against Darkterror, each moment seems to stretch into eternity.

abilities.name: Time Lock
abilities.description: Adds the chance for an attack to lock an enemy unit in time while attacking it a second time.
abilities.lore: The strike of the Faceless Void lands with dimension shifting force.

abilities.name: Reverse Time Walk
abilities.description: Available for 1.5 seconds after landing Time Walk. If used in this period, you will reverse your time walk back to your previous cast location. Does not affect health or proc scepter hits.

abilities.name: Chronosphere
abilities.description: Creates a blister in spacetime, trapping all units caught in its sphere of influence and causes you to move very quickly inside it.  All ability and item cooldowns are frozen. Only Faceless Void and any units he controls are unaffected.  Invisible enemies in the sphere will be revealed.
notes: Pauses all units and buildings, friendly or enemy, except those owned by Faceless Void.
Faceless Void is never affected by Chronospheres with any owner.
abilities.lore: When a rift opens to Claszureme, all poor souls caught within will likely never return.

abilities.name: Stroke of Fate
abilities.description: Grimstroke paints a path of ink with his brush, damaging and slowing enemies. The damage is increased with each enemy the ink hits.
abilities.lore: The corruptive force of Grimstroke's ink, drawn from the reservoir of his fallen people, consumes any enemy caught in its path.

abilities.name: Phantom's Embrace
abilities.description: Summons a phantom that moves quickly towards the target, latching to it when she arrives. Once latched, the phantom damages and silences. If she survives the full latch duration she rends her victim for heavy damage and refreshes Phantom's Embrace's cooldown.
notes: The phantom falls off if the target becomes invisible or spell immune.
The phantom will return if the target dies during the latch.
abilities.lore: Grimstroke holds no sorrow for the downfall of his people. Only for Yaovhi, she who was most dear to him, does he feel even a semblance of longing.

abilities.name: Ink Swell
abilities.description: Grimstroke shrouds an allied unit in ink, increasing its movement speed. Enemies in range of the allied unit are damaged with inky tendrils over time. After 3.0 seconds it triggers, applying damage and stun in an area around the unit in proportion to how long ink tendril was near any hero.
abilities.lore: Now that the rise of the ink tide no longer threatens to overwhelm Grimstroke, its tendrils of power are never far from his hand.

abilities.name: Dark Portrait
abilities.description: Creates an ink illusion of a target enemy hero. Illusion is debuff immune, has 95% magic resistance, and has bonus movement speed and attack damage.
abilities.lore: No dark creation is beyond the skill of the master's hand.

abilities.name: Soulbind
abilities.description: Binds a targeted enemy hero to its nearest allied hero within the bind radius, preventing both from moving away from each other. Any unit-targeted ability that either bound hero receives also gets cast on the other hero. If the bind is broken before the duration expires, the initial target will be bound to its nearest allied hero in the radius.
notes: If bound to another unit, affected units are leashed and prevented from blinking.
Provides vision of both leashed units.
abilities.lore: The Ascended were chosen sons of Ashkavor, granted immense power by the bonds forged between their own souls and those they were charged with protecting. In the years that followed the ruination of his kin, Grimstroke discovered much more sinister applications for the binding rituals...

abilities.name: Rocket Barrage
abilities.description: Launches a salvo of rockets at nearby enemy units in a radius around the Gyrocopter.  Lasts [3] seconds.
notes: Rocket Barrage can't hit units Gyrocopter has no vision over.
abilities.lore: Aurel's new craft has an increased payload for rockets, enhancing their rapid-fire capabilities.

abilities.name: Homing Missile
abilities.description: Fires a homing missile to seek the targeted enemy unit. The missile gains speed over time, dealing damage and stunning when it impacts the target. Enemy units can destroy the missile before it reaches its target.
notes: Towers do half damage to the missile.
The crosshair effect is visible to allies only.
The missile will follow and hit invisible units.
abilities.lore: The biggest missile Aurel could possibly attach to his craft, The Bomb™ has carefully calculated aerodynamics and explosives for maximum impact.

abilities.name: Flak Cannon
abilities.description: Gyrocopter's attacks hit all enemy units in an area around it for a limited number of attacks.  Only the main target of attacks will receive attack bonuses such as Critical Strike.  Lasts [12] seconds or until the attacks are used.
notes: Attack range for the primary attack is unchanged.
abilities.lore: This newly revamped Gyrocopter has attached enough armaments to assault in a 360 degree radius.

abilities.name: Call Down
abilities.description: Call down an aerial missile strike on enemy units in a target area. After 2 seconds, two missiles arrive in succession, with 2 seconds between them.
notes: The visual indicator is visible to allies only.
abilities.lore: 'Bombs Away!'

abilities.name: Acorn Shot
abilities.description: Fires Hoodwink's attack with an acorn at the target unit.  The acorn bounces to nearby targets, slowing them and dealing a percentage of Hoodwink's attack with bonus damage.
notes: The same target can be hit more than once.
Bounces will seek units in the fog of war in a 525 radius, but not invisible units.
The planted tree lasts for 20 seconds.
Acorn Shot benefits from attack range bonuses.
abilities.lore: Though she'll make do with almost anything, Oak and Ironwood acorns make the most effective projectiles -- and the bulk of Hoodwink's stash.

abilities.name: Bushwhack
abilities.description: Tosses a net trap that stuns enemies if they are near a tree in the area.  Affected enemies take damage over time and are pulled towards the tree nearest to them within the target area, and have their vision reduced to 0 for the duration of the stun.
notes: Units can be freed from the stun by destroying the tree.
Bushwhack does not hit invisible units.
abilities.lore: Hoodwink favors Ironwood groves for ambushes, but the wary step carefully in all areas of the mistwoods.

abilities.name: Scurry
abilities.description: Hoodwink passively has a chance to evade physical attacks while near trees.  When activated, Hoodwink gains bonus movement speed, phased collision, and tree-walking for a brief time.
abilities.lore: There's not a nook or cranny in the Wood Tomo'kan out of reach of Hoodwink's paws.

abilities.name: Decoy
abilities.description: Hoodwink turns invisible, increasing her movement speed, and creates a decoy illusion that starts aiming a decreased damage Sharpshooter at the nearest enemy hero. If the illusion is attacked or hit by a targeted ability, it is destroyed and it throws a lesser bushwhack towards the enemy.

abilities.name: Hunter's Boomerang
abilities.description: Tosses a boomerang in an arc. Upon contact, it returns to Hoodwink.  The boomerang will deal damage as it passes through or hits enemies, and apply a Hunter's Mark that causes affected enemies to be slowed and be more vulnerable to spell damage.

abilities.name: Sharpshooter
abilities.description: Hoodwink charges up and fires a deadly bolt from her crossbow, dealing heavy damage, break and slow to an enemy Hero.  The damage and debuff duration scale up to max after 3.0 seconds, and the bolt is fired automatically after 5.0 seconds.
abilities.lore: While her first arbalest was a chance discovery, Hoodwink now takes great care in carving and caring for her own -- of course with some necessary components pilfered or otherwise cleverly procured.
