abilities.name: End Sharpshooter
abilities.description: Release the charged up shot, regain ability to move and attack.
abilities.lore: Fire!

abilities.name: Inner Fire
abilities.description: In a fiery rage, knocks all nearby enemies away from you to a fixed distance, dealing damage and disarming them.
abilities.lore: Not even Huskar's own flesh can contain the unending expansion of his life force.

abilities.name: Burning Spear
abilities.description: Huskar sets his spears aflame, dealing damage over time with his regular attack.  Multiple attacks will stack additional damage.  Each attack drains some of Huskar's health.
notes: Burning Spear stacks additively when used multiple times on one target.  There is no cap.
Huskar cannot kill himself with this skill.
abilities.lore: The Sacred Warrior ignites his weaponry after marking it with his own blood - causing far greater pain than he himself feels.

abilities.name: Berserker's Blood
abilities.description: Huskar's injuries feed his power, giving increased attack speed, magic resistance and health regen based on missing health. Health regen is a percentage of your strength.
notes: Bonuses are provided linearly, no bonus at Full HP and full bonus at strictly less than 10% HP.
abilities.lore: After losing his birthright, Huskar gained a lethality in physical combat that is only heightened as his own blood is spilled.

abilities.name: Life Break
abilities.description: Huskar draws upon his health to break an enemy's life, leaping at a target to shatter a percentage of that hero's current health, and slowing them.  While leaping, Huskar is Debuff Immune and has 50% increases magic resistance.
notes: If Huskar is disabled during the charge or the target moves more than 1400 units in 0.015 seconds, the charge stops.
Slow works on Spell Immune units.
Life Break cannot be disjointed.
abilities.lore: No matter the danger, Huskar thrusts himself into melees that only he can survive.

abilities.name: Quas
abilities.description: Allows manipulation of ice elements. Passively grants +2 Strength per level. Each Quas instance provides increased health regeneration.
notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

abilities.name: Wex
abilities.description: Allows manipulation of storm elements. Passively grants +2 Agility per level. Each Wex instance provides increased attack speed and movement speed.
notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

abilities.name: Exort
abilities.description: Allows manipulation of fire elements. Passively grants +2 Intelligence per level. Each Exort instance provides increased attack damage.
notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

abilities.name: Invoke
abilities.description: Combines the properties of the elements currently being manipulated to create a new spell for Invoker to use. Invoke cooldown is reduced by 0.3 seconds for each orb level.  Click the help button to see the list of possible spells.
notes: The arrangement of instances does not matter.
Invoke will not cost mana or go on cooldown if the only effect is to swap the positions of existing spells.
abilities.lore: So begins a new age of knowledge.

abilities.name: Cold Snap
abilities.description: Invoker draws the heat from an enemy, chilling them to their very core for a duration based on the level of Quas. The enemy will take damage and be briefly frozen. Further damage taken in this state will freeze the enemy again, dealing bonus damage. The enemy can only be frozen so often, but the freeze cooldown decreases based on the level of Quas.
notes: The freeze stun only triggers on damage greater than 10.0 after reductions.
abilities.lore: Sadron's Protracted Frisson.

abilities.name: Ghost Walk
abilities.description: Invoker manipulates the ice and electrical energies around him, rendering his body invisible. The elemental imbalance created as a consequence slows nearby enemies based on the level of Quas, and slows Invoker as well based on the level of Wex.
notes: The slow effect does not work on Spell Immune enemies.
abilities.lore: Myrault's Hinder-Gast.

abilities.name: Tornado
abilities.description: Unleashes a fast moving tornado that picks up enemy units in its path, suspending them helplessly in the air shortly before allowing them to plummet to their doom. Travels further based on the level of Wex. Holds enemies in the air for a duration based on the level of Quas. Deals base damage plus added damage based on levels in Wex.
notes: Units are invulnerable while affected by Tornado, and the damage is dealt when landing.
abilities.lore: Claws of Tornarus.

abilities.name: E.M.P.
abilities.description: Invoker builds up a charge of electromagnetic energy at a targeted location which automatically detonates after 2.9 seconds. The detonation covers an area, draining mana based on the level of Wex. Deals damage for each point of mana drained.  If EMP drains mana from an enemy hero, Invoker gains 50% of the mana drained.
notes: Will not affect cycloned units (Tornado or Eul's Scepter of Divinity).
abilities.lore: Endoleon's Malevolent Perturbation.

abilities.name: Alacrity
abilities.description: Invoker infuses an ally with an immense surge of energy, increasing their attack speed based on the level of Wex and their damage based on the level of Exort.
abilities.lore: Gaster's Mandate of Impetuous Strife.

abilities.name: Chaos Meteor
abilities.description: Invoker pulls a flaming meteor from space onto the targeted location. Upon landing, the meteor rolls forward, constantly dealing damage based on the level of Exort, and rolling further based on the level of Wex. Units hit by the meteor will also be set on fire for a short time, receiving additional damage based on the level of Exort.
notes: Deals main damage to enemy units under meteor every 0.5 seconds and burns enemies for smaller damage over 3.0 seconds.
The meteor moves at a speed of 300.
abilities.lore: Tarak's Descent of Fire.

abilities.name: Sun Strike
abilities.description: Sends a catastrophic ray of fierce energy from the sun at any targeted location, incinerating all enemies standing beneath it once it reaches the earth. Deals damage based on the level of Exort, however this damage is spread evenly over all enemies hit.
notes: Gives vision of the target area before the strike.
Invoker gains experience with kills made from Sun Strike, even if made from outside of experience range.
abilities.lore: Harlek's Incantation of Incineration.

abilities.name: Forge Spirit
abilities.description: Invoker forges a spirit embodying the strength of fire and fortitude of ice. Damage and armor are based on the level of Exort while attack range, health, and duration are based on the level of Quas. The elemental's scorching attack is capable of melting the armor of enemy heroes. Spawns two spirits when Quas and Exort are at least level 4.
notes: Casting this ability will replace currently summoned Forged Spirits.
abilities.lore: Culween's Most Cunning Fabrications.

abilities.name: Ice Wall
abilities.description: Generates a wall of solid ice directly in front of Invoker for a duration based on the level of Quas. The bitter cold emanating from it greatly slows nearby enemies based on the level of Quas and deals damage each second based on the level of Exort.
abilities.lore: Killing Wall of Koryx.

abilities.name: Deafening Blast
abilities.description: Invoker unleashes a mighty sonic wave in front of him, dealing damage to any enemy unit it collides with based on the level of Exort. The sheer impact from the blast is enough to knock those enemy units back for a duration based on the level of Quas, then disarm their attacks for a duration based on the level of Wex.
abilities.lore: Buluphont's Aureal Incapacitator.

abilities.name: Tether
abilities.description: Tethers Io to an allied unit, granting bonus movement speed to both. When Io restores health or mana, the tethered unit gains a portion of that amount. The tether breaks when the allied unit moves too far away, or Io cancels the tether. Tether briefly slows enemies touching it.
notes: If you try to tether a unit that is 700 distance or further away from Io, he will latch on and pull himself closer to the tethered unit (to a distance of 300).
The tethered unit will heal faster and will heal even if Io is at full health.
Io's movement speed matches the tethered unit's.
abilities.lore: The benevolent touch of Io brings strength from between the planes.

abilities.name: Spirits
abilities.description: Summon five particle spirits that dance in a circle around Io. If a particle collides with an enemy hero, it explodes, damaging all enemy units in an area around it.  Creeps take minor damage from touching a particle spirit, but do not cause them to explode.  When its duration ends, any remaining Spirits explode.
notes: After summoning, Io can call the spirits in and out.
abilities.lore: Io twists the particles of the universe with its unimaginable capabilities.

abilities.name: Overcharge
abilities.description: Io gains bonus attack speed, spell amplification, and HP Regen based on max health.  If Io is Tethered to an ally, that unit also gains the bonuses.
abilities.lore: Drawing on the energy of matter from all worlds, Io begins the unravelling of time.

abilities.name: Spirits In
abilities.description: Sends the spirits closer to you. Can be toggled on and off.

abilities.name: Spirits Out
abilities.description: Sends the spirits farther away from you. Can be toggled on and off.

abilities.name: Relocate
abilities.description: Teleports Io and a tethered ally to any location. After the spell expires, Io and the tethered ally will return to their original location. Double-click to teleport to your team's base fountain.
notes: Enemies receive a visual indicator in the world and on the minimap of the target location during the cast delay.
If Io is disabled during the cast delay, Relocate is cancelled.
If an allied hero is Tethered, that hero will teleport along with you. You can break the tether at any time to prevent that hero from teleporting with you.
Only heroes, creep heroes, and illusions can be relocated.
abilities.lore: Io is the embodiment of the mystery of the universe.

abilities.name: Break Tethe
abilities.description: Break the link to the tethered unit.

abilities.name: Dual Breath
abilities.description: An icy blast followed by a wave of fire launches out in a path in front of Jakiro. The ice slows enemies, while the fire delivers damage over time.
notes: Can hit units up to 1025 range away.
Has a 0.2 second interval between each breath.
abilities.lore: Pyrexae dragons have tremendously dangerous breath for each branch of the species; combining them is unimaginable.

abilities.name: Ice Path
abilities.description: Creates a path of ice that stuns and damages enemies that touch it.
notes: It takes 0.5 seconds for the path to reach its full extent.
The stun is removed once Ice Path is destroyed.
abilities.lore: Jakiro's cunning right head calls upon its frozen heritage, glazing the earth with blistering cold.

abilities.name: Liquid Fire
abilities.description: Jakiro burns his enemies in an area of effect with fire added to his attack, while slowing their attacks.
notes: Works on both units and buildings.
abilities.lore: The left maw of Jakiro opens, laying waste to any in its path.

abilities.name: Liquid Frost
abilities.description: Jakiro adds a frost effect to his attack. Enemies hit are slowed for 4.0 seconds and are damaged for a percent of their max health plus a base amount every 1.0 second for 4.0 seconds.

abilities.name: Macropyre
abilities.description: Jakiro exhales a wide line of lasting flames, which deals damage per second to any enemy units caught in the fire.
notes: Units hit by Macropyre will continue to be affected after they leave the area for 2.0 additional seconds.
abilities.lore: Ice and fire combine to rip the battlefield to shreds with extreme temperatures.

abilities.name: Blade Fury
abilities.description: Causes a bladestorm of destructive force around Juggernaut, rendering him debuff immune, increasing his magic resistance by 80%, and dealing damage to nearby enemy units.
notes: You can use items during Blade Fury.
Juggernaut can still perform attacks while in Blade Fury. However, only units that are not affected by Blade Fury, such as wards or structures, will take damage from these attacks.
abilities.lore: Yurnero's renowned katana techniques are feared by warriors and sorcerors alike.

abilities.name: Healing Ward
abilities.description: Summons a Healing Ward which heals all nearby allied units, based on their max health.  The Healing Ward moves at 325 movement speed after being summoned.  Lasts [25] seconds.
notes: The Healing Ward can be controlled.
Multiple Healing Wards do not stack.
abilities.lore: Of the rituals learned at the Isle of Masks, tending wounds with a bit of voodoo magic has proven to be quite useful.

abilities.name: Blade Dance
abilities.description: Gives Juggernaut a chance to deal critical damage on each attack.
abilities.lore: The last remnant of his heritage's commitment to bladework, Yurnero ensures that the style is remembered.

abilities.name: Swiftslash
abilities.description: Performs a short Omnislash for 1 seconds.

abilities.name: Omnislash
abilities.description: Juggernaut leaps towards the target enemy units, and then slashes the target and other nearby enemy units at an increased attack rate. Juggernaut is invulnerable for the duration.
notes: You can use items during Omnislash.
abilities.lore: 'The fruits of discipline; with practice comes strength.'

abilities.name: Illuminate
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Channels light energy, building power the longer it's channeled.  Once released, a wave is sent forth that deals damage and gives vision in its path.  The longer it is channeled, the more damage is dealt.
notes: Gives increasing vision over the channeling time.
abilities.lore: Ezalor's hidden light reveals itself in marvelous fashion.

abilities.name: Blinding Light
abilities.description: A blinding light flashes over the targeted area, knocking back and blinding the units in the area, causing them to miss some attacks. Knockback is 400 range over 0.6 seconds.
notes: Upon landing, units will destroy trees in a 150 radius.
abilities.lore: The Primordial light turns the tides of battle in favor of Ezalor and his allies.

abilities.name: Chakra Magic
abilities.description: Restores mana to the target unit and reduces cooldowns of all abilities currently on cooldown by a fixed amount.
notes: Chakra Magic does not reduce the cooldown of Ultimate abilities
abilities.lore: In the same vein, Ezalor bestows his harmony among others.

abilities.name: Solar Bind
abilities.description: Weakens an enemy's magical resistance, and applies a slow that increases in strength the more the target moves.

abilities.name: Will-O-Wisp
abilities.description: Summons Ignis Fatuus at the targeted area. Alternates on and off, drawing enemies closer with its mesmerising flicker.
notes: Ignus Fatuus applies a non-interrupting pull towards it on all enemies within the radius.
abilities.lore: Though he would not claim to 'know' them, Ezalor holds an uncanny influence over many powerful creatures always willing to come to his aid.

abilities.name: Spirit Form
abilities.description: Ezalor temporarily turns his body luminescent, gaining bonus movement speed, cast range, grants the Blinding Light ability, and allows Illuminate to be channeled by a separate spirit and heal allies.
abilities.lore: In a flash of light, Ezalor reveals his true nature.

abilities.name: Release Illuminat
abilities.description: Release the channel early.

abilities.name: Illuminat
abilities.description: Channels light energy, building power the longer it's channeled.  Once released, a wave is sent forth that deals damage and gives vision in its path.  The longer it is channeled, the more damage is dealt.
notes: Gives increasing vision over the channeling time.
abilities.lore: Ezalor's hidden light reveals itself in marvelous fashion.

abilities.name: Release Illuminat
abilities.description: Release the channel early.

abilities.name: Recal

effects.name: ability
effects.text: Channelled, No Target, Point Target, Unit Target

abilities.description: After a short delay, teleports the targeted friendly hero to your location.  If the targeted friendly hero takes player based damage during this time, the ability is interrupted.
notes: If Keeper of the Light dies, the spell effect is interrupted.
Recall will interrupt channeling spells.
You can disable help to prevent Keeper from casting this spell on you.
Can be cast through the minimap, choosing the nearest friendly hero.
abilities.lore: Walk towards the light.

abilities.name: Torrent
abilities.description: Summons a rising torrent that, after a short delay, hurls enemy units into the sky, stunning, dealing damage and slowing movement speed.
notes: The initial bubble effect is only visible to allies and provides vision in fog of war.
Units tossed in the air will be stunned and still able to be attacked.
abilities.lore: An ancestral rush of water explodes from the center of the world, called upon by the Admiral.

abilities.name: Tidebringer
abilities.description: Kunkka's legendary sword grants increased damage and cleaves a large area of effect in front of him for a single strike.
abilities.lore: A lost Claddish soul inhabits Kunkka's trusty Tidebringer, empowering it to destroy demons of the Cataract.

abilities.name: X Marks the Spot
abilities.description: Targets a friendly or enemy Hero, marks their position with an X, and returns them to it after several seconds.  Kunkka can trigger the return at any time during the duration. Lasts twice as long on allied heroes.
abilities.lore: The Admiral's set of arcane abilities includes some that can be used for battle as well as entertainment.

abilities.name: Torrent Storm
abilities.description: Releases a visible Torrent in a random area around Kunkka once every 0.25 for 5.0 seconds. Spawns within 1100 range of him.
abilities.lore: A hundred leagues of dry land couldn't keep these seas at bay.

abilities.name: Tidal Wave
abilities.description: Releases a Tidal Wave that spawns behind Kunkka. Deals damage and drags enemies along it for the duration. Enemies cannot attack while being dragged.

abilities.name: Ghostship
abilities.description: Summons a ghostly ship that sails through the battle before smashing apart, damaging and stunning all enemies caught near the wreckage. Allied heroes touched by the Ghostship are given a swig of The Admiral's Rum, receiving bonus movement speed and a delayed reaction to incoming damage.
notes: Damage dealt after Rum wears off is non-lethal and can never kill a hero.
Actual area of effect of ship's collision is larger than the boat itself.
The boat has a movement speed of 650.
abilities.lore: The final ship of the Claddish Navy is nothing but a phantom, but it is all too real to the enemies of the Admiral.

abilities.name: Retur
abilities.description: Returns the marked hero to the X.

abilities.name: Overwhelming Odds
abilities.description: Turns the enemies' numbers against them, dealing damage per unit or per hero and granting you bonus attack speed . Deals bonus damage to illusions and summoned units as a percent of their current health. Can be cast during Duel.
abilities.lore: The archers of Stonehall are ready at Tresdin's command.

abilities.name: Press The Attack
abilities.description: Removes debuffs and disables from the target friendly unit, and grants bonus movement speed and health regen for a short time.
abilities.lore: The rallying horn of the Bronze Legion is able to inspire any heart.

abilities.name: Moment of Courage
abilities.description: When attacked, Legion Commander has a chance to immediately counterattack with bonus lifesteal.
abilities.lore: Tresdin knows that an enemy's most vulnerable moment often follows their fiercest stroke.

abilities.name: Duel
abilities.description: Legion Commander and the target enemy hero are forced to attack each other for a short duration.  Neither hero can use items or abilities. If either hero dies during the duration, the hero winning the Duel gains permanent bonus damage.
notes: Duels will end if the units are pushed 2000 units apart.
Winning a Duel automatically casts Press the Attack on yourself.
abilities.lore: To face a soldier of Stonehall in single combat is a challenge few can resist.

abilities.name: Split Earth
abilities.description: Splits the earth under enemies. Deals damage and stuns for a short duration.
notes: Split Earth will destroy trees in its area of effect.
There is a 0.35 second delay before the effect is applied.
abilities.lore: Twisting nature to his vile will, the shifting earth consumes those unlucky enough to cross Leshrac's path.

abilities.name: Diabolic Edict
abilities.description: Saturates the area around Leshrac with magical explosions that deal pure damage to enemy units and structures.  The fewer units available to attack, the more damage those units will take. Lasts [10] seconds.
notes: The explosions will continue even if Leshrac is killed.
abilities.lore: Chronoptic energy bursts from one plane to the other, evaporating anything it touches.

abilities.name: Lightning Storm
abilities.description: Summons a lightning storm that blasts the target enemy unit, then strikes any nearby enemy units. Struck enemies are slowed.
abilities.lore: The Tormented Soul's mastery of the elements is evident in the massive storms that strike down armies before him.

abilities.name: Nihilism
abilities.description: Causes Leshrac and all nearby enemies to turn ethereal, preventing them from attacking, slowing them, and making them take more magic damage. Increases Leshrac's speed rather than reducing it. Does not cause Leshrac to take amplified damage.

abilities.name: Pulse Nova
abilities.description: Creates waves of damaging energy around Leshrac, one per second, to damage nearby enemy units. Drains Leshrac's mana with each pulse.
abilities.lore: If necessary, the Tormented Soul can manipulate space time itself, ravaging lesser beings.

abilities.name: Frost Blast
abilities.description: Blasts the target enemy unit with damaging frost, dealing area damage and slowing movement and attack rates for [4] seconds.  The primary target receives both base and area damage.
abilities.lore: Frost-mage Ethreain has not forgotten even the simplest of ice manipulation.

abilities.name: Frost Shield
abilities.description: Applies a magical frost shield around the target, reducing damage from attacks against it. While the shield is active, ice magic will affect nearby enemy units every 1 seconds, dealing minor damage and slowing them.
notes: Spell-immune enemies are not affected by the damage or slow.
Frost Shield can be cast on buildings.
abilities.lore: First conceived of to protect him in his mortal years, the frost magic that Ethreain weaves around himself has only grown colder with time.

abilities.name: Sinister Gaze
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Hypnotizes an enemy unit, causing it to move towards a point between the two of you and drains a percentage of its current mana. If cast on a creep lasts 2x longer and deals 250 damage per second.
abilities.lore: Mind the cold...

abilities.name: Ice Spire
abilities.description: Creates an Ice Spire at the target spot, slowing enemies around it. Can take 5 hero hits or 10 creep hits and when destroyed it will create a Frost Blast around it.Chain Frost can bounce to the Spire if there are no other enemies in range.Lich can cast Frost Shield on the Spire. Each Frost Shield tick will heal the spire by 1 hero attack.

abilities.name: Chain Frost
abilities.description: Releases an orb of frost that bounces between nearby enemy units up to [10, 10, 10] times, slowing and damaging each time it hits. Each bounce increases the damage for the subsequent bounces.
notes: Chain Frost cannot be disjointed.
Chain Frost has a movement speed of 850.
Chain Frost doesn't bounce to Zombies.
abilities.lore: Almost universally considered the ultimate in frost magic, Ethreain's orb of frozen death strikes fear into those who dare stand against him.

abilities.name: Rage
abilities.description: Launch into a maddened rage, becoming Debuff Immune, increasing magic resistance by 80%, and gaining increased movement speed.
notes: Upon casting, many buffs and debuffs will be removed.
abilities.lore: The madness and brutality of N'aix makes him a vicious and unrelenting foe in combat.

abilities.name: Feast
abilities.description: Lifestealer's attacks deal damage and provide heal for a percentage of his target's max health.
notes: Does not affect Roshan.
The heal is independent of the damage.
Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.
abilities.lore: After escaping from his cell in Devarque, N'aix subsisted on flesh and bones of those unfortunate to cross his path.

abilities.name: Ghoul Frenzy
abilities.description: Passively causes Lifestealer's attacks to significantly slow enemy movement speed for 1.5 seconds. Grants you Attack Speed.

abilities.name: Open Wounds
abilities.description: Lifestealer rends an enemy unit, slowing the victim's movement speed and allowing all allies to regain health for a percentage of the damage they deal to that unit. All damage dealt will steal life, including damage from spells. The victim recovers movement speed over the duration. Deals 2% of the target's max health per attack on the target from real heroes. After receiving 500 damage, the Open Wounds fester and spread to a non-infected random enemy within 700 radius.
notes: Open Wounds slows over 8 different steps: 50% / 50% / 40% / 30% / 20% / 10% / 10% / 10%, with the slow decreasing one step per second.
Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.
abilities.lore: Fresh wounds and the scent of blood often draw out the scavengers to finish the job.

abilities.name: Infest
abilities.description: Lifestealer infests the body of a target unit, becoming undetectable, and healing for a portion of his max hitpoints every second while inside. He can then explode from the host body, dealing damage to nearby enemies. If the infested unit is an enemy creep or a neutral creep, he can take control of the unit's ability to move and attack. Does not work on enemy heroes.
notes: Lifestealer gains experience while under the effects of Infest.
Creeps that are controlled while Infested gain Infest's movement speed bonus.
Infest Level 2 and 3 can be used on Ancient creeps.
abilities.lore: With this infestation, N'aix consumes the life blood of the host, restoring him back to full unholy power.

abilities.name: Consume
abilities.description: Lifestealer eats the host body from the inside out, exploding from within.

abilities.name: Dragon Slave
abilities.description: Lina channels the breath of a dragon, sending out a wave of fire that scorches every enemy in its path.
notes: Dragon Slave can hit units up to 1225 units away.
abilities.lore: In the scorched barren of Misrule, Lina learned to manipulate the fiery breath of the Desert Wyrm as a form of entertainment.

abilities.name: Light Strike Array
abilities.description: Summons a column of flames that damages and stuns enemies.
notes: Light Strike Array will destroy trees in its area of effect.
abilities.lore: Lina's essence allows her to focus the sun's energies, causing air to combust at will.

abilities.name: Fiery Soul
abilities.description: Grants bonus attack and movement speed each time Lina hits an enemy with a spell. Stacks with itself. Lasts 18 seconds.
notes: Duration refreshes each time an opponent is hit with a spell.
Using items does not trigger Fiery Soul.
abilities.lore: Dancing flames embody Lina's playful nature, bringing out her true blazing self.

abilities.name: Flame Cloak
abilities.description: Grants Lina unobstructed movement and increases her spell damage and magic resistance. Grants max fiery soul stacks on activation.
abilities.lore: A natural defense equally suited to keeping anything from unwanted sisters to snarling hellbeasts at bay.

abilities.name: Laguna Blade
abilities.description: Fires off a bolt of lightning at a single enemy unit, dealing massive damage.
notes: Laguna Blade has a 0.25 delay before the damage is applied after the spell is cast, allowing certain abilities to avoid the damage.
abilities.lore: The air around Lina becomes so intensely torrid that it scorches a foe that comes too close with white-hot lightning.

abilities.name: Earth Spike
abilities.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
notes: The spikes move at 2800 units per second.
abilities.lore: The Demon Witch exercises his demonic covenant, opening a fissure from hell.

abilities.name: Hex
abilities.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless beast, with all special abilities disabled.
notes: Instantly destroys illusions.
The target will have a base movement speed of 120, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled.
abilities.lore: Lion is compelled to share his transfiguration, twisting the essence of those who oppose him.

abilities.name: Mana Drain
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Absorbs the magical energies of a target enemy unit by taking mana from it every second.
notes: Instantly destroys illusions and prevents heroes from going invisible.
abilities.lore: Lesser magi are nothing more than a source of magical restoration for the Demon Witch.

abilities.name: Finger of Death
abilities.description: Rips at an enemy unit, trying to turn it inside-out. Deals massive damage and grows stronger with each life it consumes.
notes: Finger of Death has a 0.25 delay before the damage is applied after the spell is cast, allowing certain abilities to avoid the damage.
Finger of Death only gains damage if the enemy hero dies within 3 seconds of being affected by Finger of Death.
abilities.lore: Lion's disfigured hand is also the source of his greatest power, capable of flooding victims with malefic force.

abilities.name: Summon Spirit Bear
abilities.description: Summons a powerful Spirit Bear companion that can equip items.  If the bear moves 1100 distance away from the Lone Druid, it cannot attack.  Lone Druid suffers 20.0% of his max health as backlash damage if the Spirit Bear dies. Spirit Bear does not benefit from attributes.
notes: Most spells interact with the Spirit Bear in the same way as they do with heroes.
abilities.lore: Sylla's lifelong companion is symbiotic with his spirit and heart, coming to aid him in any time of need.

abilities.name: Spirit Link
abilities.description: Links Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear, sharing a percentage of their armor with each other, increasing the attack speed of both and causing damage dealt by the Spirit Bear to heal Lone Druid.
abilities.lore: Sylla is emboldened by the presence of his companion, his vitality replenished with each swipe of the Spirit Bear's claws.

abilities.name: Savage Roar
abilities.description: Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear roar fiercely causing nearby enemies to flee towards their base in terror. Their movement speed is increased by 20%.
notes: An entangled hero will not be able to move.
Cooldown is shared with Spirit Bear.
abilities.lore: Sylla studies and masters the arts of the lost Bear Clan, enhancing his attunement with the wild.

abilities.name: True Form
abilities.description: Lone Druid learns to morph himself into a raging bear, losing his ranged advantage, but gaining increased bonus armor and health, and improved versions of Entangling Claws and Demolish.
notes: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Lone Druid was in when the item was used.
abilities.lore: The mighty bear is the king of the forest, possessing the throne through raw power.

abilities.name: Lucent Beam
abilities.description: Calls a beam of lunar energy down upon an enemy, damaging and briefly stunning them.
abilities.lore: Selemene smites those who encroach upon the Nightsilver Woods.

abilities.name: Moon Glaives
abilities.description: Empowers Luna's glaives, causing her attacks to bounce between enemy units. Deals less damage with each bounce.
notes: Moon Glaives do not proc any attack modifier except Critical Strikes.
abilities.lore: Carefully sharpened, Luna's boomerang-like weapon cuts a wide swath through enemy numbers.

abilities.name: Lunar Blessing
abilities.description: Increases the attack damage for Luna and nearby allied heroes, with Luna receiving 200% of the attack damage bonus allies receive. At night Lunar Blessing is global, and Luna is blessed with increased vision range.
abilities.lore: The Goddess of the Moon smiles upon her kin.

abilities.name: Eclipse
abilities.description: Showers random nearby enemies with strikes from Luna's current level of Lucent Beam. These beams do not stun their targets, and there is a maximum number of times that a single target can be struck. Also turns day into night for a short time.
notes: Eclipse doesn't work if Luna doesn't have any points in Lucent Beam.
Beams will stop if Luna is killed.
Will not hit invisible units.
There is a [0, 0, 0] seconds gap between beams, 0.3 seconds with scepter.
abilities.lore: In times of great need, Selemene herself descends into the world, blocking out the light and hope of the opposed.

abilities.name: Summon Wolves
abilities.description: Summons two wolves to fight for Lycan.  Level 3-4 wolves have Permanent Invisibility, and level 4 wolves have Cripple that gives 20% chance to cripple the target, causing 8 damage per second and lose 60 attack speed for 4 seconds.
abilities.lore: The very enchantment that twisted his being also summons canine familiars.

abilities.name: Howl
abilities.description: Strikes fear into enemies, reducing armor and attack damage of all enemies within 2000 range of Lycan and his wolves. Non-hero controlled units flee for a short time. At night Howl's armor and attack damage reductions are global.
abilities.lore: Blood-curdling wolf cries signal to opponents that Banehallow is among them.

abilities.name: Feral Impulse
abilities.description: Increases the HP regeneration and damage of Lycan and all units under his control.
abilities.lore: His animalistic symbiosis with canine kind gives Banehallow enhanced reflexes and hunting capabilities.

abilities.name: Wolf Bite
abilities.description: Lycan bites an ally, granting them Shapeshift properties. Lycan and the bitten target gain 30% Lifesteal and share the healing effect of Lifesteal with each other as long as they are within 1200 range of each other.
notes: Wolf Bite cooldown matches the cooldown of the current level of Shapeshift.
abilities.lore: Does this bite look infected?

abilities.name: Shapeshift
abilities.description: Lycan assumes his lupine form, granting him and his units critical strikes and added vision at night. During Shapeshift, Lycan and all units under his control move at increased speed, cannot be slowed and have a 40% chance to deal a critical strike doing [160, 190, 220]% damage.
notes: Hex doesn't remove Lycan's movement speed.
Lycan has a smaller collision size in this state.
abilities.lore: Forever a slave to his lycanthropy, Banehallow has come to accept his curse, and embrace his own savagery.

abilities.name: Shockwave
abilities.description: Magnus sends out a wave of force, damaging enemy units in a line, pulling them towards him and slowing them for a brief period.
abilities.lore: Mt. Joerlak was a somewhat unstable mass, and Magnus has learned to channel its reverberations.

abilities.name: Empower
abilities.description: Gives an allied unit bonus damage and cleave on attack. Magnus receives 75% larger bonus.
notes: The bonus damage is based only on base damage and damage from primary attributes.
Cleave damage goes through spell immunity.
Ranged units cannot Cleave.
abilities.lore: With a deep bellow, Magnus displays his true power.

abilities.name: Skewer
abilities.description: Magnus rushes forward, goring enemy units on his massive tusk. Heroes hit on the way will be dragged to the destination, then damaged and affected by slowed movement and attack speed.
abilities.lore: Magnoceros horns are valuable in direct proportion to their danger to prospective merchants.

abilities.name: Horn Toss
abilities.description: Magnus tosses any enemies in front of him, launching them to his rear. Enemies take damage, spend 0.6 seconds in the air, and then are stunned upon landing.

abilities.name: Reverse Polarity
abilities.description: Magnus changes properties of matter, sucking all nearby enemies in front of him and stunning them with a powerful slam and dealing damage.
abilities.lore: Magnus fights with the fury of the erupting Mt. Joerlak.

abilities.name: Dispose
abilities.description: Marci grabs an allied or enemy target and throws it effortlessly behind her, damaging and slowing the unit if it's an enemy. Any enemy units in the landing area will also be damaged and slowed.
abilities.lore: Marci excels at removing obstacles from Princess Mirana's path.

abilities.name: Rebound
abilities.description: Marci bounds to the targeted allied unit, choosing a direction and distance she will spring away from it. Upon reaching the unit, Marci lunges to her final destination, damaging and stunning enemies where she lands.
notes: Has 150 minimum jump distance.
Marci's initial run to her target unit can be disjointed.
abilities.lore: With a friendly or brazen boost, Marci can find her way into the midst of any fight.

abilities.name: Sidekick
abilities.description: Marci's loyalty helps ensure survival, imbuing a chosen allied hero and herself with lifesteal and attack damage.
notes: Marci can self-cast Sidekick to buff herself and the nearest allied hero within 700 range.
abilities.lore: Marci learned at a young age that the best asset in a scrap is a steady companion.

abilities.name: Unleash
abilities.description: Marci taps a hidden power, gaining Fury charges that allow her to deliver a rapid sequence of strikes that slow movement and attack speed of the target for 2.0s. The last strike in every Fury combo creates a damaging pulse around the target. In between Fury combos, Marci is unable to attack for 1.5s.
notes: Once a Fury combo is started, each attack must be delivered within 1s or the Fury combo expires.
Removes attack speed limit.
abilities.lore: Though some have sought to understand its origins, Marci rebuffs all attempts to divine the source of her power.

abilities.name: Spear of Mars
abilities.description: Mars throws his legendary Spear with deadly precision, damaging each enemy unit it strikes. The first enemy hero it hits is skewered on the spear, pushing it back. If a skewered hero hits a tree, building, or cliff, they will be impaled to it and stunned.
notes: Spear of Mars can hit invisible units and reveals them if they are stunned.
Spear of Mars will only pin a unit to cliffs onto elevated areas, otherwise it will push them off onto lower ground.
abilities.lore: The legendary Spear of Mars still glows with the heat of the forge god's fires.

abilities.name: God's Rebuke
abilities.description: Mars smashes enemies in front of him with his shield, knocking them back and damaging them with a critical hit based on his attack. Bonus damage is added when hitting heroes. Has True Strike.
notes: Attack modifiers have a chance to proc on God's Rebuke attacks.
abilities.lore: There isn't a warrior alive who can stand unmoved by the sting of Mars' rebuke.

abilities.name: Bulwark
abilities.description: Mars wields his massive shield to block a portion of each physical attack when hit from the front or sides. Can be toggled, removing Mars's ability to attack, and locking the direction he is facing. When active, reduces movement speed and re-directs 70% of the attack projectiles aimed at Mars's allies towards Mars instead.
notes: Redirect only works if the projectile targets are in a cone behind Mars or within 100 range of him.
abilities.lore: Only the very foolish dare to fight fair with the god of war.

abilities.name: Arena Of Blood
abilities.description: After a short formation time, Mars summons an arena lined with the undead warriors of the Ash Legion, who block enemy attacks and movement. Enemy heroes near the inside edge of the arena will be attacked by spears, dealing damage and knocking them back.
abilities.lore: The long-dead members of the Ash Legion, assembled from the finest warriors to ever test the might of Mars, still revel in the thrill of combat, gladly beholden to the hand that fell them for as long as he so commands.

abilities.name: Split Shot
abilities.description: Medusa magically splits her shot into several arrows. These arrows deal a lower percent of her normal damage.
notes: Secondary targets will be the closest enemy units excluding the primary target.
If illusions of Medusa are created while Split Shot is active, they will also have this ability.
abilities.lore: All who encounter the cursed Gorgon will feel her rage.

abilities.name: Mystic Snake
abilities.description: A mystic snake made of energy jumps from target to target dealing damage. Damage and speed increases with each jump. After it reaches its last target, it returns to Medusa to replenish her with mana. The snake returns [16, 18, 20, 22]% mana based on the targets' total mana.
notes: Mystic Snake cannot be disjointed.
abilities.lore: The Gorgon's curse is her greatest strength.

abilities.name: Mana Shield
abilities.description: Creates a shield that absorbs 98% of incoming damage in exchange for Medusa's mana. Provides bonus mana capacity.
notes: Absorbs damage before any damage reduction takes place, meaning that armor will not reduce the amount of mana needed to absorb damage.
abilities.lore: While Medusa was not gifted with eternal life upon birth, her curse bestowed her with impressive defensive powers.

abilities.name: Cold Blooded
abilities.description: When Medusa is targeted with a spell, a single-target Mystic Snake is sent back towards the enemy.

abilities.name: Stone Gaze
abilities.description: Any enemy units looking at Medusa will have their movement and attack speed slowed.  If 2.0 seconds of total time is accumulated looking at Medusa while Stone Gaze is active, that unit will turn to stone.  Petrified units are stunned, and take bonus physical attack damage.
notes: Regardless of when a unit receives the Stone Gaze buff while the ability is active on Medusa, it will still receive the full debuff duration.
abilities.lore: The beauty of Medusa is legendary.

abilities.name: Earthbind
abilities.description: Tosses a net at the target point, rooting down all enemy units in an area around it.
notes: Affects invisible units, revealing them.
Does not work on Debuff Immune units or Roshan.
abilities.lore: Catching dinner in the Riftshadow Ruins can be quite the task.

abilities.name: Poof
abilities.description: Drawing mystical energies from the earth, a Meepo can teleport to another Meepo or itself after channeling for 1.5 seconds, damaging the enemy in both the departure and arrival locations. If the ability is in autocast state, all Meepos will also cast Poof to the target. When cast on the ground, all Meepos except the selected one will Poof to the closest location.
notes: Can be cast through the minimap.
Can teleport to Meepo illusions.
abilities.lore: Sometimes breaking one of the Riftshadow Crystals can be just the trick for getting yourself out of a bind.  Or your other self.

abilities.name: Ransack
abilities.description: Steals health from the enemy with each strike and heals all other Meepos for that amount.
abilities.lore: So you gonna need that, or...?

abilities.name: Dig
abilities.description: Digs into the ground for a short duration, dispelling Meepo and causing him to become invulnerable and untargetable for 3s. Restores 35% of his max health over that duration.DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

abilities.name: MegaMeepo
abilities.description: Primary Meepo mounts all other Meepos in a 600 radius around him on top of his shoulders. While in this form, he gains 50% of the other Meepo stats and can Fling them at enemies, dealing damage and slowing them.
notes: MegaMeepo is cancelled if Meepo is banished, hidden or becomes untargetable.

abilities.name: Divided We Stand
abilities.description: Meepo summons an imperfect, semi-autonomous duplicate of himself, which can gain gold and experience as he does and shares his experience, attributes and abilities. However, the clones cannot wield any items but the boots that Meepo himself wears.  If any of the clones die, they all die. Divided We Stand grants all Meepos bonus Magic Resistance.
notes: Clones can't use Arcane Boots, Guardian Greaves.
abilities.lore: Do I know you?

abilities.name: MegaMeepo Flin
abilities.description: In MegaMeepo form, Meepo flings the topmost meepo towards a target within a [900] range, dealing damage and slowing their movement speed.

abilities.name: Starstorm
abilities.description: Calls down a wave of meteors to damage nearby enemy units. The closest enemy unit to Mirana in a 650 radius will be struck a second time for 75% of the damage.
notes: Starstorm is not blocked by Linken's Sphere.
Starstorm cannot hit invisible units.
Starstorm will choose a new target for the second star if the first died before impact.
abilities.lore: The Goddess breaks the strata to empower her Princess in the time of need.

abilities.name: Sacred Arrow
abilities.description: Fires a long-range arrow with deadly precision, which stuns and damages the first enemy unit it strikes. The stun duration ranges from 0.01 to [3.2, 3.8, 4.4, 5.0] seconds, with bonus damage up to 180 added, based on the distance the arrow travels to its target. Instantly kills the first non-ancient creep it hits.
notes: For every 150 distance the arrow travels, the stun duration upon impact increases by 0.5 seconds, and the bonus damage added increases by 14.
Sacred Arrow can hit invisible units.
abilities.lore: Lunar energies make the Princess of the Moon's arrows more deadly than most.

abilities.name: Leap
abilities.description: Mirana leaps forward into battle, empowering herself with a ferocious roar that grants bonus attack and movement speed. Speed bonus lasts 4 seconds.
abilities.lore: None can fail to recognize Mirana's iconic white beast in the heat of battle.

abilities.name: Moonlight Shadow
abilities.description: Turns Mirana and all allied heroes invisible and grants bonus movement speed. If a hero is revealed, invisibility will restore after the fade delay as long as Moonlight Shadow's duration has not expired.
notes: Units affected will not auto attack enemies.
abilities.lore: Her tenure with Selemene allows Mirana to eclipse the ground, wrapping her allies in a cloak of shadows.

abilities.name: Boundless Strike
abilities.description: Monkey King enlarges his staff and slams it against the ground, stunning enemies in a line and damaging them with a critical hit based on his attack. Has True Strike.
notes: Does not affect spell-immune enemies.
abilities.lore: The legendary Jingu Bang grows to match its master's will, ensuring no enemy can escape the Monkey King's reach.

abilities.name: Tree Dance
abilities.description: Monkey King jumps to a tree and perches atop it. While perched, he gains the Primal Spring ability-a channeled leap attack. If Monkey King's tree is destroyed, he falls and is stunned for 4 seconds. Taking damage from player controlled units or Roshan while on the ground puts Tree Dance on cooldown.
notes: Tree Dance cooldown starts upon landing.
Right-clicking the ground will have Monkey King drop from the tree.
abilities.lore: Sun Wukong dances nimbly along the treetop canopy, always just out of arm's reach.

abilities.name: Primal Spring
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Monkey King springs out from his tree perch, damaging and slowing enemies in the area where he lands. Damage and slow amounts are in proportion to channel duration.
abilities.lore: Leaping from the safety of cover into the midst of his enemies, Sun Wukong attacks without mercy.

abilities.name: Jingu Mastery
abilities.description: Monkey King's attacks awaken the Jingu Bang's power. Upon the fourth hit on the same enemy hero, Monkey King earns four charged attacks that have bonus damage and lifesteal.
notes: Hitting an enemy with Boundless Strike adds to the hit counter.
Repeatedly hitting an enemy refreshes the Jingu Mastery debuff duration.
Hit charges on enemies cannot be dispelled.
Jingu Mastery buff on self can be dispelled.
abilities.lore: Always sensitive to the moods of its master, the Jingu Bang radiates power when Sun Wukong's combat fervor is on full display.

abilities.name: Mischief
abilities.description: Changes Monkey King's shape to deceive opponents, using the environment nearby as inspiration for the disguise. Taking damage, attacking, or using any item or ability breaks Monkey King's disguise. Grants damage immunity for 0.2 seconds upon transforming.
notes: If transformed into a courier, Monkey King matches the movement speed of the courier.
abilities.lore: Watch out for that tree.

abilities.name: Wukong's Command
abilities.description: Monkey King creates a circular formation of soldiers that spread out from his position. If Monkey King leaves the area his soldiers disperse. The soldiers have Monkey King's attack and only target heroes. Monkey King is granted bonus armor for the spell's duration.
notes: Soldiers do not receive Jingu Mastery bonuses.
Soldiers do not copy Basher or Abyssal.
abilities.lore: Monkey King rips out a tuft of fur to blow at his enemies, charging each strand to transform into a copy of himself.

abilities.name: Revert For
abilities.description: Reverts Monkey King's shape to his original form.

abilities.name: Waveform
abilities.description: Morphling dissolves into liquid and surges forward, damaging enemy units in his path.  Morphling is invulnerable during Waveform.
abilities.lore: A torrential flood takes enemies by force.

abilities.name: Adaptive Strike (Agility)
abilities.description: Launches a surge of water toward an enemy unit, dealing base damage plus additional damage based on Morphling's agility times a multiplier.  If Morphling's agility is 50% higher than strength, the maximum agility multiplier is used. Passively grants bonus Agility.
notes: Projectile moves at 1150 speed.
abilities.lore: The Morphling calls upon his elements to crush his opponents with waves.

abilities.name: Adaptive Strike (Strength)
abilities.description: Launches a surge of water toward an enemy unit, stunning and knocking back the target based on Morphling's strength. If his strength is 50% higher than his agility, the maximum stun/knockback is dealt. Passively grants bonus Strength.
notes: Projectile moves at 1150 speed.
abilities.lore: The Morphling calls upon his elements to crush his opponents with waves.

abilities.name: Attribute Shift (Agility Gain)
abilities.description: Morphling shifts its form, pulling points from Strength and pouring them into Agility. The process is reversible.  Additional points in Attribute Shift increase the rate of stat change.
notes: Attribute Shift can't convert stats from items.
Leveling up Agility Gain will also level up Strength Gain.
abilities.lore: Shifting water makes it difficult to discern the nature of Morphling.

abilities.name: Attribute Shift (Strength Gain)
abilities.description: Morphling shifts its form, pulling points from Agility and pouring them into Strength. The process is reversible.  Additional points in Attribute Shift increase the rate of stat change.
notes: Attribute Shift can't convert stats from items.
Leveling up Strength Gain will also level up Agility Gain.
abilities.lore: Shifting water makes it difficult to discern the nature of Morphling.

abilities.name: Morph
abilities.description: Morphling changes his form to match the targeted enemy, gaining their basic abilities. Can be toggled for the duration of the ability.
notes: You can't target yourself with Morph.
Morph won't copy Shard/Scepter abilities unless Morphling owns the respective item.
abilities.lore: Staring into Morphling produces a reflection that mimics the beholder.

abilities.name: Morph Replicate
abilities.description: Toggles Morphling's form between his own and the replicated enemy.

abilities.name: Dead Shot
abilities.description: Muerta fires a ghostly trickshot at an enemy unit or tree. When the bullet strikes, it damages and briefly slows, then ricochets in the targeted direction.The ricochet damages all units that it passes through, stopping when it hits a hero. Heroes hit by the ricochet are feared away from the impact.
notes: Feared enemies are phased and unslowable.
The ricochet will travel 1.5x Dead Shot's cast range.
Can ricochet off of magic immune targets.
abilities.lore: A steady gunhand and an eternity of practice produce trickshots that defy the mortal mind.

abilities.name: The Calling
abilities.description: Summons a group of 4 revenants that slowly circle the targeted location. Enemies within the area are slowed and have reduced attack speed. Revenants deal damage and silence enemies as they pass through them.
abilities.lore: Muerta's family are forever beyond the spirit veil, but her deal with Death allows her to briefly call on them in times of want or need.

abilities.name: Gunslinger
abilities.description: Muerta's attacks have a chance to fire a second shot at another target, prioritizing Heroes.
notes: If no other units are in range, she fires both guns at the original target.
Secondary shots can hit units within Muerta's attack range plus 150.
The secondary shot can trigger attack modifiers.
abilities.lore: Muerta offers all of her victims Mercy. Some are fortunate enough to also earn Grace.

abilities.name: Parting Shot
abilities.description: Muerta precisely shoots a hero in their soul, separating it from their physical body and knocking it 150 units away.The soul is untargetable, muted, disarmed, and invulnerable for 4 seconds.The body is stunned and has 50% damage reduction for this duration.After the effect ends the hero's soul is forcefully returned to their body applying a strong dispel. The soul will survive until the end of the effect even if the hero is killed.
notes: Debuff Immune units will take the damage from the shot but not be separated from their body.
Allied heroes hit with Parting Shot will not be damaged.

abilities.name: Pierce the Veil
abilities.description: Muerta transforms, becoming immune to physical damage. All of her attack damage is dealt as magical damage. Muerta gains bonus attack damage and phased movement.Muerta can attack ethereal units, but deals no damage to Magic Immune targets.DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
notes: Muerta will dodge projectiles upon transformation.
Muerta cannot attack buildings while transformed.
Other ethereal effects will not stop Muerta from being able to attack.
abilities.lore: Muerta sheds her corporeal form, crossing the spirit veil and striking her enemies with the fury of the damned.

abilities.name: Mirror Image
abilities.description: Creates multiple images of Naga Siren under her control.
notes: Naga Siren is invulnerable for 0.5 seconds when casting, allowing her to dodge stuns and damage.
Upon casting, most effects are removed from Naga Siren.
Upon casting, existing Mirror Image illusions are destroyed.
abilities.lore: Slithice, while being strong in her own right, is notoriously hard to track down.

abilities.name: Ensnare
abilities.description: Interrupts the target and traps them in place, preventing movement or blinking.
abilities.lore: The only way to escape the onslaught of a Slithereen is to never oppose one in the first place.

abilities.name: Rip Tide
abilities.description: Every 6 attacks from naga and her illusions, the Naga Siren and her images will hit all nearby units with a damaging wave of water that lowers armor for 4.0 seconds.
abilities.lore: A torrent from the Deep Ones crushes the defenses of the Siren's enemies.

abilities.name: Reel In
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Naga Siren channels for up to [5] seconds, pulling all units affected by Naga's Ensnare in a 1400 range towards her at a speed of 200.
abilities.lore: Even the youngest Slithereen are well schooled in trawling for prey with nothing but their wits and nets.

abilities.name: Song of the Siren
abilities.description: All enemies in range of the Naga Siren are put into a magical stasis where they cannot act or be attacked. Using Song of the Siren again will end the duration early.
notes: Units affected by Song of the Siren are invulnerable and cannot take damage from any source.
Doesn't affect Debuff Immune units.
The area of the song follows Naga, so if she moves far enough away from affected units, they will wake up.
abilities.lore: Slithice's powerful voice enchants leagues of opponents, while calling her Slithereen kin in a time of need.

abilities.name: Song of the Siren End
abilities.description: Release enemy units from your song so they can be targeted again.

abilities.name: Sprout
abilities.description: Sprouts a ring of trees around a unit, trapping it in place and providing vision in a 250 radius.
notes: Sprout can be cast on any unit, or the ground.
Trees created by Sprout have the same interactions with abilities as regular trees.
A Tango that consumes a tree created by Sprout provides double the heal duration.
abilities.lore: Verdant overgrowth is a common ailment reported by Nature's Prophet's attackers.

abilities.name: Teleportation
abilities.description: Teleports to any point on the map. After teleporting, Nature's Prophet gains stacks of bonus attack damage. Every attack consumes a stack of bonus damage to increase Nature Prophet's armor.
notes: Mana and cooldown take effect when the cast is completed.  Nature's Prophet will not use any mana or waste the cooldown if the spell is interrupted while casting.
When the cast begins, an effect is created at the target location, which is visible to allies and enemies.
abilities.lore: The Prophet keeps his sentinel over the forest, protecting it when in need.

abilities.name: Nature's Call
abilities.description: Converts an area of trees into Treants under the command of Nature's Prophet.
notes: Nature's Call can only create as many treants as there are trees in the target area.
abilities.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.

abilities.name: Curse of the Oldgrowth
abilities.description: Applies a curse on all enemy heroes within 1200 range, displaying them in fog, slowing them, and causing damage over time based on the number of trees within 250 radius. Treants count as trees for this purpose.
abilities.lore: Though powerful, Nature's Prophet's gifts do not include all-sight, and he must rely heavily upon reconnaissance and aid from a long-standing network of stalwart friends.

abilities.name: Wrath of Nature
abilities.description: Damaging energy bounces around the map, striking enemies close to the cast point that are in vision. Each enemy hit beyond the first adds damage.
notes: Wrath of Nature will not hit units out of vision.
Can be cast through the minimap; the nearest valid target will be selected.
abilities.lore: Nature's Prophet calls Verodicia's fury to strike down those who might ravage the wilderness.

abilities.name: Death Pulse
abilities.description: Necrophos releases a wave of death around him, dealing damage to enemy units and healing allied units.
notes: Death Pulse can't be disjointed.
abilities.lore: Poor souls who succumb to Rotund'jere's plagues are recycled for future use.

abilities.name: Ghost Shroud
abilities.description: Necrophos slips into the realm that separates the living from the dead. Unable to attack or be attacked, he emits an aura that slows enemies around him. He takes additional magic damage in this form, but his restorative powers are amplified.
abilities.lore: Rotund'jere uses the souls of his victims as bridge from life to afterlife.

abilities.name: Heartstopper Aura
abilities.description: Necrophos stills the hearts of his opponents, causing nearby enemy units to lose a percentage of their max health over time. Passively provides regen for 8 seconds for each unit Necrophos kills.
notes: Damage won't disable items like Blink Dagger.
Does not affect ancient creeps.
abilities.lore: Those who come within a short distance of Necrophos can feel pestilence and plague in the air.

abilities.name: Death Seeker
abilities.description: Necrophos turns into a large Death Pulse towards the target unit's position. Once it arrives to the location, the Death Pulse spreads towards nearby enemies and allies.

abilities.name: Reaper's Scythe
abilities.description: Stuns the target enemy hero, then deals damage based on how much life it is missing. If Necrophos kills an enemy this way, he'll permanently gain Health and Mana Regen. Any kill under this effect is credited to Necrophos.
notes: Damage is dealt at the end of the stun.
abilities.lore: The amount of death and suffering in the air increases the power of Necrophos's plague magic.

abilities.name: Void
abilities.description: Creates a damaging void that slows an enemy unit and deals damage. At night, Void also mini-stuns, interrupting channeling abilities, and the slowing effect lasts longer.
notes: Void does not ministun enemies during the day.
abilities.lore: Balanar creates a vortex of infinite night, tearing opponents violently into the eternal darkness that once was.

abilities.name: Crippling Fear
abilities.description: Night Stalker horrifies all nearby enemies, causing them to become silenced while near him.  The effect lasts longer at night.
abilities.lore: A vision of the twisted maw of Balanar etches itself into the minds of the poor souls unlucky enough to cross his path.

abilities.name: Hunter in the Night
abilities.description: Night Stalker is in his element at night, attacking and moving with great swiftness.
abilities.lore: The hunting prowess of Balanar improves as the night beckons.

abilities.name: Dark Ascension
abilities.description: Night Stalker smothers the sun and summons instant darkness, so that he might use his powers at their fullest. Night Stalker gains flight and bonus damage during this time. Has unobstructed vision.
abilities.lore: It is a humbling sight to see when the mightiest of warriors become afraid of the dark.

abilities.name: Impale
abilities.description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units take damage, then are hurled into the air and stunned.
notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 750 range.
Impale cannot be blocked by Linken's Sphere.
abilities.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.

abilities.name: Mind Flare
abilities.description: Deals damages to the enemy equal to a multiplier of its Intelligence. Additionally deals damage equal to a percentage of damage the target received from Nyx in the past 15s.

abilities.name: Spiked Carapace
abilities.description: When activated while above ground, Spiked Carapace reflects and negates damage dealt to Nyx Assassin (max once from each source), as well as stunning the source of the damage. Activating Spiked Carapace will not break Vendetta invisibility.
notes: The damage is calculated after all reductions.
Spiked Carapace will only trigger on damage from other player controlled units.
The damage reflected will have the same damage type as it had when it was dealt to Nyx.
abilities.lore: While their carapace is relatively thin, it's guarded by a retractable field of razor-sharp spikes.

abilities.name: Burrow
abilities.description: Nyx Assassin buries himself beneath the battlefield over a short duration. Once burrowed, Spiked Carapace instantly stuns nearby enemies when cast, the range of Mana Burn and Impale is increased, and Impale's cooldown is decreased. While burrowed, Nyx Assassin is stationary, unable to attack, and invisible. Nyx gains damage reduction from all damage sources.
notes: Casting Vendetta will cancel burrow.
abilities.lore: Some castes of zealot scarab are known to create small burrows to lie in wait, ready to ambush their prey.

abilities.name: Vendetta
abilities.description: Allows Nyx Assassin to become invisible and gain a speed bonus.  If Nyx Assassin attacks to break the invisibility, 50% of the target's max mana is removed and massive bonus damage is dealt with the attack.
notes: Has a 0.0 second fadetime.
If a spell is used to break the invisibility, or the invisibility expires, the bonus damage is lost.
abilities.lore: The scarab kills for the glory of his queen.

abilities.name: Unburrow
abilities.description: Emerge from the burrow.
abilities.lore: Some castes of zealot scarab are known to create small burrows to lie in wait, ready to ambush their prey.

abilities.name: Fireblast
abilities.description: Blasts an enemy unit with a wave of fire, dealing damage and stunning the target.
notes: When Multicast, Fireblast hits the same target each time with a 0.6 seconds interval.
abilities.lore: The Ogre Magi is easily amused, entertained for hours by playing with fire.

abilities.name: Ignite
abilities.description: Drenches the target and another random unit in volatile chemicals, causing it to burst into flames. The target is in immense pain, taking damage and moving more slowly.
notes: Multicast makes this spell have a chance to cast multiple times at random enemy units in a 1400 area of effect.
Ignite hitting an already affected unit adds to the burn duration.
abilities.lore: Batter up!

abilities.name: Bloodlust
abilities.description: Incites a frenzy in a friendly unit, increasing its movement speed and attack speed. Gives bonus attacks speed if cast on Ogre himself. Can be cast on towers.
notes: When multicast, nearby allies will be selected randomly in an 700.0 area of effect to receive Bloodlust.
abilities.lore: 'Running's not as fun as hitting... Not one bit fun.'

abilities.name: Unrefined Fireblast
abilities.description: Blasts an enemy unit with a wave of fire, dealing damage and stunning the target. Its mana cost is 35% of Ogre Magi's current mana.
notes: When Multicast, Unrefined Fireblast hits the same target each time with a 0.6 seconds interval.
abilities.lore: The 'who-casts-spell-first' argument between himself is solved simply by both casting at once.

abilities.name: Fire Shield
abilities.description: Creates a shield around the target ally, absorbing a percentage of the damage of next 3 attacks from enemy heroes. When damage is absorbed, a fireball is launched at the attacker. Can be cast on towers.
notes: When multicast, nearby allies will be selected randomly in an 1000.0 area of effect to receive Fire Shield.

abilities.name: Multicast
abilities.description: Enables Ogre Magi to cast his abilities and items multiple times with each use.
notes: Only targeted abilities and items have a chance to be multicast.
Targeted abilities and items apply to additional enemies and neutrals in an AoE around Ogre. Fireblast and Unrefined Fireblast hit the same target multiple times.
abilities.lore: Despite being largely incapacitated by his IQ, the Ogre Magi's success in battle is attributed to pure skill.

abilities.name: Dumb Luck
abilities.description: Ogre Magi's max Intelligence is 0. He receives mana and mana regeneration from Strength. Increases Multicast chance by 1% for each 20 Strength Ogre has.

abilities.name: Purification
abilities.description: Instantly heals a friendly unit and damages all nearby enemy units.
abilities.lore: Priests of the Omniscience are adept at removing impurities from fellow warriors.

abilities.name: Heavenly Grace
abilities.description: Applies a strong dispel on himself and the target ally and grants both of them bonus Strength and HP Regen based on the amount of Debuffs dispelled.
abilities.lore: The All Seeing One casts down his protection over those that Purist calls friend.

abilities.name: Hammer of Purity
abilities.description: Omniknight fires his hammer to a target to deal pure damage based on a percentage of his base damage and slows the target.

abilities.name: Guardian Angel
abilities.description: Omniknight calls upon a Guardian Angel that grants allies immunity from physical damage.
abilities.lore: The All Seeing One casts down his protection over those that Purist calls friend.

abilities.name: Fortune's End
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Gathers Oracle's power into a bolt of scouring energy that, when released, damages, roots, and dispels enemies of buffs in an area around the target. If target is an ally it will only dispel debuffs. The root duration is equal to the time spent channeling.
notes: Can be cast on invulnerable units.
abilities.lore: The astral orb crackles with power while raw energy lances out, temporarily disrupting an enemy's connection to their own body.

abilities.name: Fate's Edict
abilities.description: Oracle enraptures a target, disarming them if they are an enemy and granting them 100% magic damage resistance if they are an ally.
abilities.lore: An unbreakable prophecy resounds: a chosen ally shall briefly suffer no magics.  Other kinds of suffering however...

abilities.name: Purifying Flames
abilities.description: Burns away impurities, dealing heavy magic damage to the target before causing them to regenerate health over time. The amount of health regenerated over its duration exceeds the amount of initial damage. Can be cast on enemies and allies.
notes: The healing from Purifying Flames can be stacked with itself.
The damage from Purifying Flames cannot be lethal to allies.
abilities.lore: Like a hall of mirrors might amplify the light of a single candle, the shattered walls of the universe can transform the light of prophecy into a burning torch.

abilities.name: Rain of Destiny
abilities.description: Brings forth rain to the target area. Enemies standing in the area receive damage and have reduced heal amplification. Allies in the area heal and have increased incoming heal amplification.
abilities.lore: Through mixture of the astral and the atmospheric, Nerif bends a single reality into paradoxical alignment.

abilities.name: False Promise
abilities.description: Temporarily alters an ally's destiny, delaying any healing or damage taken until False Promise ends. Any healing that is delayed by False Promise is amplified. Removes most negative status effects and disables on initial cast.
notes: Delayed damage and healing will take armor and magic resistance reductions into account when received.
The delayed damage and healing takes effect as soon as the target becomes vulnerable.
abilities.lore: Foes and false prophets oft make lies of men's fates.

abilities.name: Arcane Orb
abilities.description: Adds extra pure damage to Outworld Destroyer's attacks, based on his remaining mana pool.
notes: The damage is calculated after the mana cost is spent.
abilities.lore: Harbinger's outworldly knowledge allows it to tap into the ebb and flow of all spiritual energy, infusing it into his being.

abilities.name: Astral Imprisonment
abilities.description: Places a target unit into an astral prison. The hidden unit is invulnerable and disabled. When the astral prison implodes, it deals damage to the target and steals a percentage of their max mana.
notes: Imprisoned units can still be hit by Sanity's Eclipse.
Max mana steal does not increase Outworld Destroyer's current mana values or directly reduce the victim's mana values.
abilities.lore: Locked away in the pocket between this world and the Outworld, victims realize their infantile knowledge and mortality.

abilities.name: Essence Flux
abilities.description: Passively grants you a chance to restore a percentage of your max mana each time you cast an ability.
abilities.lore: The Outworld is awash in arcane energy, inclined to diffuse through any of Harbinger's rifts.

abilities.name: Sanity's Eclipse
abilities.description: Unleashes a psychic blast that deals damage to enemies based on the difference between your mana and the target's mana. Sanity's Eclipse can hit units trapped by Astral Imprisonment. Deals bonus damage to illusions.
notes: Does not damage creeps or neutral units.
abilities.lore: When an Outworld crystal ruptures, cataclysmic energies are released, and the reverberations of this power are felt interdimensionally.

abilities.name: Swashbuckle
abilities.description: Pangolier dashes along the target line, then slashes all enemies in the drawn direction with several quick swipes.
notes: Attack modifiers have a chance to proc on Swashbuckle attacks.
Casting Swashbuckle during Rolling Thunder ends Rolling Thunder.
abilities.lore: The Pangolier's blade is even nimbler than his tongue.

abilities.name: Shield Crash
abilities.description: Pangolier jumps in the air and slams back to the ground in front of his current position, damaging and slowing all enemies in a radius. For each enemy hero hit, he gains a percentage of incoming damage reduction for a short time.
abilities.lore: Only in the midst of his enemies does the Pangolier truly thrive.

abilities.name: Lucky Shot
abilities.description: Pangolier rolls the dice and lets fate decide the outcome for his enemies. Grants a chance to apply a Disarm and reduce armor on any damage dealt by Pangolier's attacks or abilities.
abilities.lore: The Pangolier's blade is guided more often by whim than reason.

abilities.name: Roll Up
abilities.description: Pangolier curls into an immobile protective ball, gaining debuff immunity, 50% magic resistance, and allowing him to turn. Can be cast during Rolling Thunder to temporarily hit the brakes. Can cast Rolling Thunder and Shield Crash during Roll Up. If enemies attack Pangolier during this, he will roll away from the attacker, applying Rolling Thunder damage/stun if there are enemies in the way.

abilities.name: End Roll Up
abilities.description: Ends Pangolier's Roll Up early.

abilities.name: Rolling Thunder
abilities.description: Pangolier curls into a debuff immune ball with 50% additional magic resistance and rolls out. When rolling, he moves at an increased speed and can move through trees, but has a decreased ability to turn. Striking enemies knocks them back, inflicting damage and stunning them when they land.
notes: Enemies can be stunned multiple times per use, but cannot be affected a subsequent time until the previous stun duration ends.
If Pangolier is disabled while rolling, he will continue to stun and knock enemies that come within range.
abilities.lore: Where his ancestors sought only refuge, the Pangolier saw opportunity...

abilities.name: Stop Rolling
abilities.description: Halt!
abilities.lore: Donté Panlin stops when he pleases.

abilities.name: Stifling Dagger
abilities.description: Throws a dagger slowing the enemy unit's movement speed, dealing [65, 70, 75, 80]+[25, 40, 55, 70]% of Phantom Assassin's attack damage as physical damage and applying attack effects from items and abilities.
notes: If an attack effect is chance-based, the chance of its application will be the same as its chance to occur.
Spell-immune enemies are not affected by Stifling Dagger's slow.
Stifling Dagger grants vision around its location while it travels and upon impact.
abilities.lore: The first skill learned by the Sisters of the Veil often signals an incoming hit.

abilities.name: Phantom Strike
abilities.description: Teleports to a unit, friendly or enemy, and grants bonus attack speed and lifesteal while attacking if it's an enemy unit.
abilities.lore: Mortred's silken veil is the last thing her unfortunate target sees.

abilities.name: Blur
abilities.description: Phantom Assassin focuses inward, increasing her ability to evade enemy attacks. Can be activated to blur her body, causing her to be impossible to see until near enemy heroes, towers, or outposts.
notes: Attacking Roshan with a regular attack will dispel Blur.
abilities.lore: Meditation allows a Veiled Sister to carefully anticipate her opponents in combat.

abilities.name: Fan of Knives
abilities.description: Phantom Assassin releases sharp blades around her, dealing a percentage of each victim's max health on impact and applying Break.

abilities.name: Coup de Grace
abilities.description: Phantom Assassin refines her combat abilities, gaining a chance of delivering a devastating critical strike to enemy units. Stifling Dagger shares the same critical strike chance.
abilities.lore: A divine strike, Mortred honors her opponent by choosing them for death.

abilities.name: Spirit Lance
abilities.description: Sends a magical spirit lance to a target enemy unit that damages and slows, while summoning an illusory phantom to attack the unit.
notes: Nearby illusions will mimic the cast animation.
abilities.lore: Azwraith's proficiency at spearing his family's meal of fish is proving quite useful in the battlefield.

abilities.name: Doppelganger
abilities.description: Phantom Lancer briefly vanishes from the battlefield. After 1 second, Phantom Lancer and any of his nearby illusions reappear at a random position within the targeted location, along with two additional doppelgangers. Extends duration of all illusions. The two added doppelgangers have different properties: one takes normal damage and deals none, while the other takes %illusion_2_damage_in_pct% bonus damage and deals %illusion_2_damage_out_pct% less damage.
notes: This ability can be used to dodge projectiles, and dispel debuffs.
Trees near a reappearing unit will be destroyed.
Phantom Lancer and his allies can see which illusion is the 100% damage illusion.
abilities.lore: Dread Magus Vorn's death imbued the Phantom Lancer with the ability to bend and fracture all spectrums of light.

abilities.name: Phantom Rush
abilities.description: When targetting an enemy for an attack, Phantom Lancer quickly charges into range, gaining a temporary agility boost. Phantom Lancer's illusions also have this ability.
notes: If the attack order is cancelled, the movement speed bonus is lost.
Rush movement speed is 800.
abilities.lore: Azwraith knows that on the field of battle, speed can mean everything.

abilities.name: Juxtapose
abilities.description: Phantom Lancer has a chance to fracture his presence on an attack, creating an illusion of himself. Illusions also have a chance to fracture further. Illusions created from Phantom Lancer last for 8 seconds, while illusions created from other illusions last 4 seconds.
notes: Illusions created by Juxtapose will attack the target that the ability was triggered upon.
abilities.lore: Each of Azwraith's lance attacks feels like two from a normal warrior; or three; or four...

abilities.name: Icarus Dive
abilities.description: Phoenix dives forward in an arc with a fixed distance in the targeted direction, dealing damage over time and slowing the movement speed of any units it comes into contact with, and then orbiting back to its original position. If Phoenix casts Supernova, the dive ends.
notes: Icarus Dive has a 2.0 second travel duration, and can be cancelled by casting the ability again while in flight.
abilities.lore: Though no stranger to travelling the cosmic void, soaring within an atmosphere offers unique pleasures.

abilities.name: Fire Spirits
abilities.description: Summons 4 fire spirits that circle around Phoenix. Each spirit can be launched independently at a targeted area of effect. Affected enemy units take damage over time and have their attack speed greatly reduced.
