notes: Fire Spirits reveal the area they strike for 1 second.
abilities.lore: The ever-collapsing core of Phoenix often emits short-lived bursts of conscious light.

abilities.name: Sun Ray
abilities.description: Phoenix expels a beam of light at the cost of its own health. The beam damages enemies and heals allies for a base amount plus a percentage of their health. The percentage increases as the beam continues to fire.
notes: Sun Ray has a width of 130 units, and a length of [1200] units.
Sun Ray is canceled if Phoenix gets stunned, silenced, cycloned, hexed or slept.
Phoenix can use items and abilities without canceling Sun Ray.
abilities.lore: The vent through which such stellar energy flows is mere atoms wide.

abilities.name: Toggle Movement
abilities.description: Toggles slow forward movement during Sun Ray firing.
notes: Sun Ray allows Phoenix to move over cliffs and trees.
abilities.lore: SQAWRK!

abilities.name: Supernova
abilities.description: The Phoenix willingly ends its current life for the chance to be reborn. Transforms into a burning sun that scorches enemies in a huge area. The sun can be destroyed by attacks from enemy Heroes. After [6] seconds the sun explodes, stunning all nearby enemies while restoring Phoenix to full health and mana with refreshed abilities.
abilities.lore: The solar crucible of a Supernova may be fatal, yet from its flames arise new beacons to wander infinity.

abilities.name: Launch Fire Spirit
abilities.description: Each fire spirit can be launched independently at a targeted area of effect. Affected enemy units take damage over time and have their attack speed greatly reduced.
notes: Fire Spirits reveal the area they strike for 1 second.
abilities.lore: PKAWW! BOOM

abilities.name: Stop Icarus Div
abilities.description: Immediately cancels the dive.
abilities.lore: SCREE!

abilities.name: Stop Sun Ra
abilities.description: Immediately stops the Sun Ray.
abilities.lore: CHIRP!

abilities.name: Onslaught
abilities.description: Primal Beast charges up and then runs in the chosen direction, knocking back enemies and allies alike. Enemy units are damaged and stunned on impact. The longer the charge duration, the farther Primal Beast's momentum will carry him.
abilities.lore: The Beast's single-minded focus on chosen prey leaves all other considerations scattered in his ruinous wake.

abilities.name: Trample
abilities.description: Primal Beast stomps over everything. For every 140 units traveled, all enemies around the Beast receive damage. Deals base damage plus a multiplier of Primal Beast's attack damage. Primal Beast is disarmed for the duration of the ability.
abilities.lore: As the only member of his species to arrive on this world, locals can only speculate on the Beast's size relative to his kin. Such observation would prove easier of course if the subject didn't eat everything it sees and destroy most of what it doesn't.

abilities.name: Uproar
abilities.description: The Beast's temper passively provides bonus damage. Additionally, for every instance of 50 damage or more Primal Beast takes from enemy heroes, he accumulates stacks of Uproar.
abilities.lore: Already draped in a broken patchwork of barding and chains upon appearing in the mistwoods, the Beast tolerates no further attempts at subjugation.

abilities.name: Rock Throw
abilities.description: Primal Beast throws a rock at the target location that stuns and damages enemies. The rock cannot be thrown within a minimum range of Primal Beast. After landing, the throck splits into 3 additional fragments that land behind the initial target location.
abilities.lore: AGAIN WITH THE ROCKS!

abilities.name: Begin Onslaught
abilities.description: Begins the rush to the specified location.

abilities.name: Pulverize
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Primal Beast channels his rage, grabbing the target enemy and slamming them into the ground repeatedly, damaging and mini-stunning any enemies caught in the AoE. Lasts 2.3 seconds.
abilities.lore: Though none are certain whether his utterances have true meaning, most concede the Beast's powerful grip and tendency to smash his enemies into naught but pulp and pieces communicates his intent well enough.

abilities.name: Illusory Orb
abilities.description: Puck launches a magic orb that floats in a straight path, damaging enemy units along the way. At any point, Puck may teleport to the orb's location using Ethereal Jaunt.
notes: The Illusory Orb grants unobstructed vision around its location while it travels.
Jaunting to the Orb will disjoint projectiles.
abilities.lore: The playful Faerie Dragon delights in confusing others, vanishing and reappearing where unexpected.

abilities.name: Waning Rift
abilities.description: Puck teleports to the target location and releases a burst of faerie dust that deals damage and silences enemy units nearby.
abilities.lore: With a mischievous grin, Puck spreads its enchanted powder which disrupts magical flow.

abilities.name: Phase Shift
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Puck briefly shifts into another dimension where it is immune from harm.
notes: Puck retains collision size while under the effects of Phase Shift.
Issuing any action will cancel Phase Shift.
Puck is invulnerable during Phase Shift.
abilities.lore: With a quip and flash, Puck returns to the alien dimension from whence it came.

abilities.name: Ethereal Jaunt
abilities.description: Teleports Puck to a flying Illusory Orb.

abilities.name: Dream Coil
abilities.description: Creates a coil of volatile magic that latches onto enemy Heroes, damaging and leashing them.  If the enemy hero stretches the coil by moving too far away, it snaps, stunning and dealing additional damage.
abilities.lore: The Faerie Dragon sows confusion by forcing its enemies to vividly dream about their own mortality.

abilities.name: Meat Hook
abilities.description: Launches a bloody hook toward a unit or location. The hook will snag the first unit it encounters, dragging the unit back to Pudge, killing it if it's a non-ancient creep and dealing damage if it is an enemy otherwise.
notes: Interrupts channeling spells of the primary target if it's an enemy.
Meat Hook hits invisible units.
Meat Hook can go through trees, cliffs, buildings, ancient units and Roshan.
Meat Hook can drag friendly units, but they won't be damaged.
Meat Hook can hit and drag runes to Pudge, refunding the Hook's mana cost.
abilities.lore: The Butcher's hook is a symbolic nightmare, its curved blade a frightening reminder of his slaughterous intent.

abilities.name: Rot
abilities.description: A toxic cloud that deals intense damage and slows movement--harming not only enemy units but Pudge himself.
notes: Using Rot doesn't interrupt channeling.
Rot hits invisible units.
If Pudge is silenced, he can't deactivate Rot if it's activated.
Rot self-damage is non-lethal.
abilities.lore: A foul odor precedes a toxic, choking gas, emanating from the Butcher's putrid, ever-swelling mass.

abilities.name: Flesh Heap
abilities.description: Gives Pudge damage block against all sources. Passively grants bonus strength that increases each time Pudge kills an enemy Hero or it dies in his vicinity.  Flesh Heap is retroactive, meaning it can gain charges before it is skilled, which then become active.
abilities.lore: The Butcher gives new meaning to the words 'meat shield.'

abilities.name: Eject
abilities.description: Ejects the swallowed allied hero inside of you.
abilities.lore: Allies emerge forever changed.

abilities.name: Dismember
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Pudge chows down on an enemy unit, disabling it and dealing damage over time. Damage is increased by Pudge's Strength and heals him for the total amount. Pudge pulls the unit at a rate of 75 units, up to a minimum of 125 range. Lasts longer on creeps.
notes: If a unit becomes invisible while Dismembered, it will still be under the effects of Dismember.
abilities.lore: 'When I'm through with these vermin, they'll be fit for a pie!'

abilities.name: Nether Blast
abilities.description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals half damage to structures.
notes: Damage is delayed by 0.8 seconds.
abilities.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.

abilities.name: Decrepify
abilities.description: A powerful banishing spell that slows a unit and renders it unable to attack or be attacked. Healing on affected allies is increased, while afflicted enemies take extra magic damage instead. Can be cast while channeling.
notes: Only magical and pure damage can affect a unit under the effects of Decrepify.
Doesn't slow allied units.
Can be used on your Nether Ward.
abilities.lore: A now-mastered relic from his childhood, Pugna delights in banishing others into the Nether Realm, whether for good, evil, or simple enjoyment.

abilities.name: Nether Ward
abilities.description: Pugna places a Nether Ward at the target location. The ward will fire at any enemy hero who casts a spell dealing base damage plus the damage multiplier of the mana spent by the enemy hero.
notes: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect.
Nether Ward can be decrepified.
Illusions and creeps deal 25% damage to Nether Ward.
abilities.lore: While at the lamasery for the Arts of Oblivion, Pugna learned to dominate his classmates with a simple ward charged with Nether magic.

abilities.name: Life Drain
abilities.description: CHANNELED - When cast on an enemy, Pugna drains health from the target enemy unit to heal himself and granting vision over the target. If Pugna has full HP, and the enemy target is a Hero, Life Drain will restore mana instead.
notes: Illusions are destroyed on the first tick of damage.
abilities.lore: Pugna has truly become more powerful than even the grandmaster of Oblivion.

abilities.name: Shadow Strike
abilities.description: Hurls a poisoned dagger which deals large initial damage, and then deals damage over time. The poisoned unit has its movement speed slowed for 15 seconds.  An instance of damage is dealt every 3.0 seconds. Queen of Pain relishes in the pain inflicted, healing every time the enemy takes damage. Creeps heal for half the damage only.
notes: The affected unit slowly regains its original movement speed every second during the duration.
Units afflicted by Shadow Strike can be denied by their allies when their HP drops below 25% of their maximum health.
abilities.lore: Akasha's envenomed dagger allows her to delight in the drawn out suffering of her victims.

abilities.name: Blink
abilities.description: Short distance teleportation that allows Queen of Pain to move in and out of combat.
notes: You can use Blink to dodge incoming projectiles.
abilities.lore: The Secret Queen lives up to her title, making her pain impossible to escape.

abilities.name: Scream Of Pain
abilities.description: The Queen of Pain lets loose a piercing scream around her, damaging nearby enemies.
notes: Scream Of Pain will hit invisible units.
Scream Of Pain cannot be disjointed.
abilities.lore: The sultry voice of Akasha beckons her opponents while stealing their souls.

abilities.name: Sonic Wave
abilities.description: Creates a gigantic wave of sound in front of Queen of Pain, dealing heavy damage to all enemy units in its wake and pushing them back.
notes: Sonic Wave can hit units up to 1150 units away.
abilities.lore: Her most exquisite of all of torments, Akasha's Sonic Wave puts her poor foes out of their misery.

abilities.name: Plasma Field
abilities.description: Releases a wave of energetic plasma that grows in power as it expands, but also zaps on contraction, slowing and dealing damage to enemy units caught in its path. Damage and slow increases with distance from Razor. The Plasma Field hits each unit twice, once each direction.
abilities.lore: The Lightning Revenant rules the Underscape with plasmatic power.

abilities.name: Static Link
abilities.description: Creates a charged link between Razor and an enemy Hero, stealing damage from the target and giving it to Razor. Allows Razor to attack while moving with the link active.
notes: The link is broken when either unit dies or the distance between them becomes 250 units greater than Static Link's cast range.
abilities.lore: Razor's polarity channels electricity into his being, draining the power of his opposition.

abilities.name: Storm Surge
abilities.description: Passively increases Razor's movement speed.
abilities.lore: Merely approaching the Lightning Revenant is rewarded with shock therapy.

abilities.name: Eye of the Storm
abilities.description: A powerful lightning storm strikes out at enemy units with the lowest health, dealing damage and reducing their armor.
notes: Each blast targets the lowest health enemy unit within range.
Eye of the Storm will prioritize striking static linked heroes.
Successive casts of Eye of the Storm will stack.
abilities.lore: Ride the lightning.

abilities.name: Smoke Screen
abilities.description: Throws down a smoke bomb, silencing enemies, and causing them to miss attacks.
notes: Can be cast during Tricks of the Trade.
Doesn't prevent the use of active items.
abilities.lore: Since his escape during the night of his betrayal, Riki has valued the use of a simple smoke screen to confuse his opponents.

abilities.name: Blink Strike
abilities.description: Teleports behind the target unit, momentarily slowing them and striking for bonus damage if it is an enemy.
notes: Riki's first attack after Blink Strike will be a backstab.
Blink Strike's damage is dealt before the next attack.
You can Blink Strike to allies, but no damage is dealt.
abilities.lore: The Stealth Assassin's agile movement makes him impossible to escape.

abilities.name: Tricks of the Trade
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Riki phases out of the world while striking random enemy units from behind in an area around him.
notes: Moving while phased out will cancel the ability.
abilities.lore: The Stealth Assassin is not afraid to fight dirty, and specializes in attacking his opponents from behind.

abilities.name: Cloak and Dagger
abilities.description: Riki fades into the shadows, becoming invisible. Every time Riki strikes his enemy from behind, he deals bonus damage based on his Agility. Bonus damage is doubled against non-hero units. When Riki attacks, he becomes visible. Grants bonus experience for hero kills and assists.
notes: Illusions of Riki will play Backstab animations, but not deal any bonus damage.
Riki cannot Backstab buildings or Tormentors.
abilities.lore: Riki comes for you.

abilities.name: Telekinesis
abilities.description: Rubick uses his telekinetic powers to lift the enemy into the air briefly and then hurls them back at the ground. The unit lands on the ground with such force that it stuns nearby enemies.
notes: While the target is in the air, Rubick may use a secondary ability to throw the enemy in a targeted direction.
When the unit lands, it isn't affected by the area of effect stun.
abilities.lore: Even the Grandest Magus may use his powers for enjoyment.

abilities.name: Fade Bolt
abilities.description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage. Each jump deals less damage.
abilities.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.

abilities.name: Arcane Supremacy
abilities.description: Rubick's mastery of the arcane allows him to have a larger cast range and increased potency.
abilities.lore: Not every magus can be a Grand Magus...

abilities.name: Spell Steal
abilities.description: Rubick studies the trace magical essence of one enemy hero, learning the secrets of the last spell the hero cast. Rubick can use this spell as his own for several minutes or until he dies, and stolen spells last longer on enemies.
notes: Cannot steal item abilities.
Rubick will steal the Aghanim's Shard version of the ability, if he himself has an Aghanim's Shard.
abilities.lore: ...but even their lesser magics can be a source of much utility.

abilities.name: Telekinesis Lan
abilities.description: Chooses the location the target will land when Telekinesis finishes.

abilities.name: Telekinesis Lan
abilities.description: Chooses the location you will land when Telekinesis finishes.

abilities.name: Burrowstrike
abilities.description: Sand King burrows into the ground and tunnels forward, damaging and stunning enemy units above him as he resurfaces. Adds Caustic Finale poison to heroes hit.
abilities.lore: Crixalis often lies in wait, burrowing under the surface to ambush his adversaries.

abilities.name: Sand Storm
abilities.description: Sand King creates a fearsome sandstorm that damages enemy units while hiding him from vision.  The effect ends when Sand King leaves the area.
notes: Sand Storm can be used to dodge projectiles.
Sand King briefly becomes visible upon attacking or using spells while in Sand Storm. Sand King will become invisible again in 0.7 seconds.
abilities.lore: Some say Crixalis is a mirage; his carapace appearing then vanishing between the whirling sands of the Scintillant Waste.

abilities.name: Caustic Finale
abilities.description: Sand King's attacks inject a venom that causes enemy units to move more slowly and to violently explode when it dies.
abilities.lore: An injection from Crixalis makes one brittle and as dry as the arid wastes, subject to implosive demise.

abilities.name: Epicenter
abilities.description: After a cast point of [2] seconds, Sand King sends a disturbance into the earth, causing it to shudder violently. All enemies caught within range will take damage and become slowed. Each subsequent pulse increases the radius of damage dealt.
notes: The pulses are centered on Sand King, not where he first casted the spell.
abilities.lore: Many an explorer was lost to the quicksands of the Scintillant Waste.

abilities.name: Disruption
abilities.description: Banishes the targeted unit from the battlefield for a short duration.  Upon returning, two illusions of the banished unit are created under Shadow Demon's control.
abilities.lore: The pain of deception comes not while it happens, but when it is revealed.

abilities.name: Disseminate
abilities.description: Whenever the target takes damage, all enemies, including the target itself if it is an enemy, within 675 range of the target also receive a portion of that damage. Can target enemy and allied units. Effect is paused if the target is hidden by Disruption.

abilities.name: Shadow Poison
abilities.description: Deals damage in a line, and afflicts enemy units with a poison effect. The poison deals 1/2/4/8/16 times the stack damage based on the number of stacks on the target, up to 5 stacks. Additional stacks cause 50.0 damage each.  This deferred damage is dealt when Shadow Poison's duration is expired, or the Release sub-ability is used.
notes: Shadow Poison can affect units under Disruption.
abilities.lore: The ever growing influence of the Shadow Demon can pollute the most valiant and pure of heroes.

abilities.name: Shadow Poison Release
abilities.description: Releases the poison to do damage on all affected enemies. Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Shadow Poison.

abilities.name: Demonic Cleanse
abilities.description: Cleanses the target allied unit, removing negative buffs for the duration.  At the end of the duration, the unit is healed. Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Demonic Cleanse.DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
notes: Can be cast on invulnerable units.
Negative buffs are continously removed from the target for the duration of the Cleanse.

abilities.name: Demonic Purge
abilities.description: Purges the target enemy unit, removing positive buffs, and slowing the target for the duration.  The unit slowly regains its speed until the end of the duration, upon which damage is dealt.  Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Demonic Purge.
notes: The slow starts at 100.0% and decreases over time to 20.0%.
Positive buffs are continously removed from the target for the duration of the Purge.
Can be cast on invulnerable units.
abilities.lore: Once Shadow Demon no longer has any need for his collected cultist, he releases it from its subservience - and its life.

abilities.name: Shadowraze
abilities.description: Shadow Fiend razes the ground directly in front of him, dealing damage to enemy units in the area. Adds a stacking damage amplifier on the target that causes the enemy to take bonus Shadowraze damage per stack. Each consecutive stack also decreases movement speed.
notes: Stack duration refreshes on stack gain.
abilities.lore: Nevermore's trademark for harvesting souls.

abilities.name: Shadowraze
abilities.description: Shadow Fiend razes the ground a short distance away from him, dealing damage to enemy units in the area. Adds a stacking damage amplifier on the target that causes the enemy to take bonus Shadowraze damage per stack. Each consecutive stack also decreases movement speed.
notes: Stack duration refreshes on stack gain.
abilities.lore: Nevermore's trademark for harvesting souls.

abilities.name: Shadowraze
abilities.description: Shadow Fiend razes the ground a longer distance away from him, dealing damage to enemy units in the area. Adds a stacking damage amplifier on the target that causes the enemy to take bonus Shadowraze damage per stack. Each consecutive stack also decreases movement speed.
notes: Stack duration refreshes on stack gain.
abilities.lore: Nevermore's trademark for harvesting souls.

abilities.name: Necromastery
abilities.description: Shadow Fiend steals the soul from units he kills, gaining bonus damage. On death, he releases 40% of them from bondage.
notes: Denies and neutral creeps also provide bonus damage through Necromastery.
abilities.lore: Harvested souls swirl in and out of the Abysm, empowering the Shadow Fiend to increase the size of his collection.

abilities.name: Presence of the Dark Lord
abilities.description: Shadow Fiend's presence reduces the armor of nearby enemies. Every enemy hero killed nearby further improves armor reduction by 2 for 20s.
notes: Stacks fully with other armor reduction abilities and aura.
abilities.lore: Even being near Nevermore eats away at one's soul.

abilities.name: Requiem of Souls
abilities.description: Shadow Fiend gathers his captured souls to release them as lines of demonic energy. Units near Shadow Fiend when the souls are released can be damaged by several lines of energy. Any unit damaged by Requiem of Souls will be feared and have its movement speed and magic resistance reduced for 0.7 seconds for each line hit up to a maximum of 2.15. Lines of energy are created for every soul captured through Necromastery.  Requiem of Souls is automatically cast whenever Shadow Fiend dies, regardless of its cooldown.
notes: One line is generated from Shadow Fiend for every 1 soul in his possession.
Fear and movement slow do not apply if the Requiem was released on death.
abilities.lore: The captured souls of those past slain are released to ravage their former allies.

abilities.name: Ether Shock
abilities.description: Creates a cone of ethereal energy that strikes multiple enemy units.
notes: Can hit secondary targets up to 1000 distance away.
abilities.lore: Originally used to open shows with the travelling con-man, Rhasta's lightning display shocks adversaries in more ways than one.

abilities.name: Hex
abilities.description: Transforms an enemy unit into a harmless creature, disabling their attacks and abilities.
notes: Instantly destroys illusions.
The target will have a base movement speed of 100, but buffs granting maximum movement speed won't be disabled.
abilities.lore: Rhasta often ended performances by turning himself into a chicken - now, the humiliation is shared.

abilities.name: Shackles
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Magically binds an enemy unit so that it cannot move or attack, absorbing their life energy over time.
abilities.lore: A self-defense incantation, Rhasta developed shackles after his master was slain in the Bleeding Hills.

abilities.name: Mass Serpent Ward
abilities.description: Summons 10 Serpent Wards to attack enemy units and structures. The Wards are immune to magic.
abilities.lore: Snake charming was a big part of the Shadow Shaman's act; now Rhasta can empower the snakes to do his bidding.

abilities.name: Arcane Curse
abilities.description: Curses the target area, dealing damage and causing enemy heroes to take damage over time and slowing their movement speed. Silenced enemies take 1.5x slow and damage. Anytime affected enemies cast a spell, the duration is increased. The duration is paused as long as the target is silenced.
notes: Affects creeps.
abilities.lore: Nortrom's lack of incantations is less of a problem for him than it is for his adversaries.

abilities.name: Glaives of Wisdom
abilities.description: Silencer enchants his glaives with his wisdom, dealing additional damage based on his Intelligence. Silencer temporarily steals his target's Intelligence with each hit. If Silencer kills an enemy hero, he permanently steals 2 Intelligence.
notes: To permanently steal Intelligence, Silencer doesn't need to land the killing blow, as long as the enemy hero is killed within 925 range of Silencer.
The enemy does not need to have the Glaives of Wisdom debuff for Silencer to permanently steal Intelligence.
abilities.lore: Although lacking in traditional incantations, Nortrom's pedigree of the Aeol Drias gives him uncanny wisdom, which he applies to physical combat.

abilities.name: Last Word
abilities.description: Enchants a target, providing vision of them and causing them to be damaged and silenced if they cast a spell or if the enchantment timer expires. Deals extra damage based on the difference in intelligence between Silencer and the target.
notes: Channeling abilities will trigger this effect once the caster finishes its channel.
abilities.lore: Nortrom ensures that spells uttered by his opponents will be their last.

abilities.name: Global Silence
abilities.description: Silencer stops all sound, preventing enemy heroes and units on the map from casting spells.
notes: This skill works on invisible and Debuff Immune units, but gaining debuff immunity will remove its effect.
abilities.lore: With a shock to the ground, all magic and sound pauses, and Nortrom fulfills his prophecy.

abilities.name: Arcane Bolt
abilities.description: Skywrath Mage launches a slow-moving bolt of arcane magic, dealing damage to an enemy unit based on Skywrath Mage's intelligence. Upon impact, leaves a debuff that increases Skywrath Mage's spell lifesteal against the target.
notes: The projectile moves very slowly (500 ms), providing 325 vision around it.  Upon impact, it will reveal the target area for 3.34 seconds.
Arcane Bolt cannot be disjointed.
abilities.lore: Within the Ghastly Eyrie's endless intrigue, only the clever and calm can hope to survive.

abilities.name: Concussive Shot
abilities.description: Skywrath Mage sets off a long range shot that hits the closest hero within a long range.  Upon impact, it deals damage and slows in an area of effect. Deals 75% damage to creeps.
notes: If no enemy heroes are in range or they are in fog, Concussive Shot targets the nearest enemy creep.
Damages creeps around the impact area.
Provides 400 vision around the projectile, and reveals the target area for 3.34 seconds upon impact.
abilities.lore: Those who serve the court of the Ghastly Eyrie are ever locked in covert war. One must always know where danger lurks nearest.

abilities.name: Ancient Seal
abilities.description: Skywrath Mage seals the targeted unit with an ancient rune, silencing it and causing it to take additional damage from spells.
notes: The magic damage resistance reduction doesn't affect creeps.
abilities.lore: A holy incantation, whosoever finds themselves touched by Avilliva's sigil must suffer in penitent silence.

abilities.name: Shield of the Scion
abilities.description: Every time Skywrath Mage deals magic damage to an enemy hero with an ability, he gains a buff that grants bonus Intelligence and Armor. Each charge stacks independently.

abilities.name: Mystic Flare
abilities.description: Skywrath Mage uses his ultimate magical ability to conjure a precise and violent mystical field that lays waste to his adversaries. Deals massive damage distributed evenly among any Heroes in the area over 2.0 seconds.
notes: Mystic Flare only affects Heroes; it does not damage illusions or creep heroes.
Spell immune enemies do not count toward the damage distribution.
Mystic Flare will damage enemy creeps if no enemy heroes are present.
abilities.lore: Only the most practiced of Skywrath sorcerers could hope to shape the skies into such a storm.

abilities.name: Guardian Sprint
abilities.description: Slardar slithers ahead, moving significantly faster and passing through units. Slardar gains bonus movement speed, health regeneration and armor while in a puddle or river.
notes: Activating this skill doesn't interrupt channeling abilities.
abilities.lore: As Slardar has made the transition from the Deeps, it has been necessary to use his powerful tail for sprinting instead of swimming.

abilities.name: Slithereen Crush
abilities.description: Slams the ground, leaving a puddle of water, and stunning and damaging nearby enemy units.  After the stun, the affected units are slowed.
abilities.lore: A swift crush of might and water breaks even the toughest of defenses.

abilities.name: Bash of the Deep
abilities.description: After 3 attacks, your next attack will bash the target. Deals double damage against creeps.
notes: Does not stack with Skull Basher.
abilities.lore: Thieves of the wealth of the Deep Ones meet the brutality of the Slithereen Guard in melee combat.

abilities.name: Corrosive Haze
abilities.description: Reduces enemy armor to amplify physical damage and provides True Sight and vision of the targeted unit, revealing invisibility. The enemy unit leaves a trail of water behind it for 8 seconds.
abilities.lore: Even the strongest armor counts for little when left to the brine of the sea.

abilities.name: Dark Pact
abilities.description: After a short delay, Slark sacrifices some of his life blood, purging most negative debuffs and dealing damage to enemy units around him and to himself.  Slark only takes 30% of the damage.
notes: 1.5 seconds after cast, a series of 10 pulses separated by 0.1 seconds deal the damage.
Each pulse also removes debuffs from Slark.
You can't kill yourself with this skill.
The pulses stop if Slark dies.
abilities.lore: Slithereen are capable of quickly regrowing appendages, in case of critical injury, to save their own lives.

abilities.name: Pounce
abilities.description: Slark leaps forward, leashing the first hero he connects with and applying Essence Shift Stacks.  That unit can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
notes: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of 933.33, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled 700 distance.
Debuff Immune units cannot be leashed.
Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location.
abilities.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.

abilities.name: Essence Shift
abilities.description: Slark steals the life essence of enemy heroes with his attacks, draining each of their attributes and converting them to bonus Agility. If Slark kills an affected enemy hero, he permanently steals 1 Agility.
notes: Attributes cannot be dropped below 1.
Essence Shifted stats are returned to normal on death. The stat return for Slark and for the affected hero are separate.
To permanently steal Agility, Slark doesn't need to land the killing blow, as long as the enemy hero is killed within 300 range of Slark while having the Essence Shift debuff.
abilities.lore: With each strike at his adversaries, Slark's knowledge of their weaknesses improves.

abilities.name: Depth Shroud
abilities.description: Creates a cloud at the target location. All allies inside the radius are hidden and affected by Shadow Dance.

abilities.name: Shadow Dance
abilities.description: When used, Slark hides himself in a cloud of shadows, becoming immune to detection. Attacking, casting spells, and using items will not reveal Slark.  Passively, when not visible to the enemy team, Slark gains bonus movement speed and health regeneration.
notes: If Slark is damaged by a neutral unit, the passive movement and health regeneration bonuses are lost for [2, 2, 2] seconds.
The passive movement and health regeneration bonuses have a [0, 0, 0] second activation and deactivation delay.
abilities.lore: The hidden Thirteenth is a slippery foe.

abilities.name: Scatterblast
abilities.description: Snapfire unloads with a wide blast that damages and slows enemies in a cone. Enemies caught at point-blank range take an extra 50.0% damage.
abilities.lore: A favorite from her collection, Beadie crafted Ol' Rackatee as her first line of defense when she ventured into the Outlands.

abilities.name: Firesnap Cookie
abilities.description: Snapfire feeds a potent cookie to Mortimer or an ally, causing them to hop a short distance. The hopping unit stuns and damages enemies in the landing zone.
notes: The cookie projectile has a speed of 1100.
abilities.lore: With the help of a secret mixture that pairs Beadie's baking skills with her passion for black powder, these battle biscuits pack a punch.

abilities.name: Lil' Shredder
abilities.description: Snapfire heats up her mounted turret to rapidly fire 6 fixed-damage attacks. Each attack reduces the enemy's armor. Provides bonus attack range for the duration.
notes: Sets base attack time to 1.0s for the duration.
Attack modifiers have a chance to proc on Lil' Shredder attacks.
abilities.lore: Beadie constantly tinkers with a design she first dreamed up plotting an exodus from her old gang.

abilities.name: Gobble Up
abilities.description: Mortimer gobbles up a creep or an allied hero, which he can then spit towards enemies. The unit stays in his belly up to 3.0 seconds.
notes: Snapfire earns the creep's bounty after it has been spat out and died.

abilities.name: Spit Out
abilities.description: Mortimer spits out the unit that's in his mouth, causing impact damage and stun in a large area. The glob leaves a pool of firespit that slows and applies damage over time. Spit Out has a no minimum launch range.

abilities.name: Mortimer Kisses
abilities.description: Snapfire's friend launches a barrage of firespit globs over 5.5 seconds. Globs cause impact damage and create pools of firespit, which slow and apply damage over time. Snapfire has a reduced turn rate for the duration and a minimum launch range of 600. Each glob can be targeted with a right click.
notes: Can be cancelled by pressing Stop, Hold Position, or using another ability.
Has a minimum travel time of 0.8 and maximum travel time of 2.0.
abilities.lore: Little did Beadie know when she adopted Mortimer, dragon toads--which aren't even toads at all--share more than just a name with their distant draconic cousins.

abilities.name: Shrapnel
abilities.description: Consumes a charge to launch a ball of shrapnel that showers the target area in explosive pellets. Enemies are subject to damage and slowed movement. Reveals the targeted area. Shrapnel charges restore every [35] seconds.
notes: Damage is dealt 11 times, immediately at spell effect then every second.
Does not damage buildings.
Provides vision in the targeted area.
abilities.lore: Kardel's modular rifle also fires incendiary rounds, useful for assaulting entrenched locations.

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.description: Sniper increases his accuracy, giving him a chance to deal extra damage and knock back his enemies. Headshots briefly slow enemy movement and attack speed by -100%.
notes: Works on allied creeps.
abilities.lore: Taking potshots at steepstalkers in his childhood has been thoroughly refined into perfect leads on enemy combatants.

abilities.name: Take Aim
abilities.description: Extends the attack range of Sniper's rifle. Can be activated to provide 100% Headshot chance. Slows you by [45, 40, 35, 30]% for the duration.
abilities.lore: Kardel always takes it upon himself to stay as far from harm as he can while still performing his role - taking perfect aim.

abilities.name: Concussive Grenade
abilities.description: Launches a grenade at the target area, dealing damage to enemies and knocking them and Sniper himself back. Enemies affected are disarmed and have their movement slowed after the knockback.

abilities.name: Assassinate
abilities.description: Sniper locks onto a target enemy unit and, after a short aiming duration, fires a devastating shot that deals damage at long range and mini-stuns the target.
notes: Crosshair effect is only visible to allies.
Invisibility doesn't disjoint the projectile.
abilities.lore: In order to fulfill the prophecy and return to his home town, Kardel must make another shot as perfect as the one on the day of his ancient test.

abilities.name: Spectral Dagger
abilities.description: Spectre flings a dagger to draw a Shadow Path, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed of any enemies along the trail. Units hit by the dagger also trail a Shadow Path. While treading the path, Spectre phases through otherwise impassable terrain. Spectral Dagger applies an instance of Desolate to targets with no allied units within 400 radius of them.
notes: There is a 1.0 second grace period after leaving the path where no collision is preserved.
abilities.lore: Mercurial's dagger eclipses the physical plane in shadow, a state in which mortals cower, but spectres thrive.

abilities.name: Desolate
abilities.description: Deals bonus damage whenever Spectre attacks an enemy that does not have any allied units within a 400 radius around them.
notes: Damage is dealt before Spectre's attack.
Spectre's illusions also have Desolate.
abilities.lore: Often times, warriors find themselves alone with a vision of Mercurial - the fated question is if it is the true Spectre.

abilities.name: Dispersion
abilities.description: Damage done to Spectre is reflected on her enemies, leaving her unharmed. The effect lessens with distance.
notes: The reflected damage is not dealt to Spectre.
Illusions don't get this ability.
Damage is reflected before reductions, and is returned as the same damage type.
abilities.lore: A daunting task lies before enemies of Mercurial - killing a shadow with blade and magic.

abilities.name: Reality
abilities.description: Spectre exchanges places with a chosen Haunt.
abilities.lore: The scattered shadows unite into the one true Spectre.

abilities.name: Shadow Step
abilities.description: Allows Spectre to perform a single target Haunt on a visible enemy. Casts a Spectral Dagger on the target.
abilities.lore: With great focus of will, Mercurial can sometimes limit the extent of her division.

abilities.name: Haunt
abilities.description: Creates a spectral nemesis to attack each enemy hero. At any moment during the duration, Spectre can use Reality to exchange places of a given haunt.
abilities.lore: At the height of combat, Mercurial's physical manifestation shatters, and the shadowy pieces haunt those who still cling to life.

abilities.name: Charge of Darkness
abilities.description: Spirit Breaker fixes his sight on an enemy unit and starts charging through all objects.  All enemy units passed through and the targeted unit will be hit by a Greater Bash.  If the targeted unit dies, Spirit Breaker will change his target to the nearest enemy unit to that location.
notes: Spirit Breaker passes through trees, cliffs, and units.
The charge indicator is visible only to allies.
Spirit Breaker gains shared vision of the target.
abilities.lore: Barathrum erupts from the darkness with unwieldy force.

abilities.name: Bulldoze
abilities.description: Spirit Breaker gains movement speed and status resistance to ram through enemies. Can be used while charging.
abilities.lore: Barathrum warps the fabric of reality around him, lessening its influence on his physical form.

abilities.name: Greater Bash
abilities.description: Gives a chance to stun and knockback an enemy unit on an attack. Deals a percentage of movement speed as damage. Deals 1.5x damage to creeps.
notes: Does not stack with Skull Basher.
abilities.lore: The signature strike of Barathrum's ghostly ball and chain.

abilities.name: Planar Pocket
abilities.description: Barathrum distorts the fabric of planar space, increasing his own magic resistance and redirecting the first targeted enemy hero spell in a radius towards him. Effect ends when the first spell is redirected.
abilities.lore: Barathrum's unyielding focus forms a pocket of planar convergence from which not even the most powerful arcane energies can escape.

abilities.name: Nether Strike
abilities.description: Spirit Breaker slips into the nether realm, reappearing next to his hapless victim. Upon reappearing, a Greater Bash of the current level occurs and deals bonus damage. Knocks back for double the normal distance.
notes: Spirit Breaker appears behind the target to deliver the bash.
abilities.lore: Barathrum temporarily returns to the realm from where he came, bringing with him the retribution of both worlds.

abilities.name: Static Remnant
abilities.description: Creates an explosively charged image of Storm Spirit that lasts [12] seconds and will detonate and deal damage if an enemy unit comes near it.
notes: Remnants take 1.0 second to materialize after the spell is cast.
Remnants grant unobstructed vision for their duration.
The explosion actually hits units in a 300 radius, but will only be triggered in 235.
abilities.lore: Raijin Thunderkeg's duality allows him to admire himself in shocking fashion.

abilities.name: Electric Vortex
abilities.description: A vortex that pulls an enemy unit to Storm Spirit's location.
abilities.lore: Raijin's thunderous, boisterous energy often draws others into an electrifying situation.

abilities.name: Overload
abilities.description: Casting a spell creates an electrical charge, which is released in a burst on Storm's next attack, dealing damage and slowing nearby enemies.
notes: Using items doesn't trigger Overload.
Overload charges do not stack.
abilities.lore: Pow!  Zip!  Zap!

abilities.name: Ball Lightning
abilities.description: Storm Spirit becomes volatile electricity, charging across the battlefield until he depletes his mana or reaches his target. The activation mana cost is 25+7.5% of his total mana pool, and the cost per 100 units traveled is 10+0.65% of his total mana pool.  Damage is expressed in damage per 100 units traveled.
notes: Abilities and items can be used while traveling.
This ability will destroy trees.
Storm Spirit is invulnerable during Ball Lightning.
abilities.lore: The Storm is coming in.

abilities.name: Storm Hammer
abilities.description: Sven unleashes his magical gauntlet that deals damage and stuns enemy units in a small area around the target.
abilities.lore: The Rogue Knight's iron gauntlet, taken from the school of his father, strikes his foes to their core.

abilities.name: Great Cleave
abilities.description: Sven strikes with great force, cleaving all nearby enemy units with his attack. Passively grants bonus Strength.
abilities.lore: The Vigil Knights still seek to reclaim the stolen Outcast Blade from Sven, a weapon capable of cutting wide swaths through lesser warriors.

abilities.name: Warcry
abilities.description: Sven's Warcry heartens his allied heroes for battle, increasing their armor and movement speed. Lasts 10 seconds.
abilities.lore: Calling a few lines from the Vigil Codex fortifies Sven's obedience to his rogue code. So poetic!

abilities.name: God's Strength
abilities.description: Sven channels his rogue strength, granting bonus damage for [35] seconds.
notes: The bonus damage is based on base damage and the primary attribute of Sven.
abilities.lore: With the strength that shattered the Sacred Helm, the Rogue Knight stands unopposed in melee combat.

abilities.name: Sticky Bomb
abilities.description: Lobs a Sticky Bomb towards the target area. If it lands next to an enemy hero, the bomb will stick to it, slowing its movement speed. After a few seconds the bomb will explode, dealing damage in an area around the detonation and applying a secondary slow for 3 seconds.
abilities.lore: Such revolutionary brilliance was meant to be shared.

abilities.name: Reactive Tazer
abilities.description: Techies trigger an electric charge giving them bonus movement speed for a short period of time. Enemies attacking Techies are temporarily disarmed and get a Basic Dispel. At the end of the effect, the charge explodes, disarming all enemies within the radius.
abilities.lore: A steady bomb hand prefers an abundance of personal space.

abilities.name: Blast Off!
abilities.description: Techies hurtle themselves into the enemy's midst, detonating charges upon impact which deal massive area of effect damage and stun enemies. Upon landing, the assault deals Techies non-lethal damage equal to a percentage of their current health.
notes: The self-damage Techies receive from this blast is non-lethal.
This ability destroys trees.
abilities.lore: Where we going?

abilities.name: Minefield Sign
abilities.description: Plant a warning sign, causing mines within it's radius to be invulnerable. Only one sign can exist at a time. Lasts 60 seconds.
abilities.lore: Watch your step!

abilities.name: Proximity Mines
abilities.description: Plant an invisible mine that cannot be detected by True Sight, but is visible if an enemy is within the active 500 AoE of the mine. Mines detonate if an enemy is standing within the active AoE for 1.0 seconds dealing damage and temporarily reducing the enemy's Magic Resistance. The explosion deals full damage if the target is within 150 radius and decreases up to 50% on the edge. Deals 30% damage to buildings.
notes: Cannot be placed within 350 AoE of another Proximity Mine.
Proximity Mines do not block neutral creep camps from spawning.
Mines last until they explode or are destroyed.
Mines are triggered by invisible units.
Mines will not be triggered by some flying units.
Grants 30 gold if destroyed by an enemy hero.
Spell immune units will reveal mines, but not trigger detonation.
abilities.lore: The bane of Toterin!

abilities.name: Refraction
abilities.description: Templar Assassin becomes highly elusive, avoiding damage and gaining a bonus to her damage.  The damage and avoidance effects are separate, and have a limited number of instances.
notes: Damage as HP Removal bypasses Refraction (it won't reduce the charges).
Only instances of 5 or more damage will trigger Refraction.
Refraction is visible to enemies.
abilities.lore: Manipulating her psionic veil, Lanaya bends nature's law to her will.

abilities.name: Meld
abilities.description: Templar Assassin conceals herself, becoming invisible as long as she remains still.  If Meld's invisibility is broken by attacking an enemy, Lanaya will deal bonus damage to the enemy and reduce their armor for [12] seconds.
notes: Meld is broken by any action other than staying in position or channeling Psionic Projection.
Meld's armor reduction does not work against towers.
abilities.lore: Lanaya is as elusive as her covenant with the Hidden Temple.

abilities.name: Psi Blades
abilities.description: Templar Assassin's psi blades slice through the attacked unit, splitting and damaging enemy units directly behind it, while gaining bonus attack range. For each unit it damages, the spill damage is reduced by a percentage.
notes: Split damage hits invisible units.
Attack effects like Bash will only be applied to the main target.
abilities.lore: Her blades pierce the skin as much as the mind, furthering her understanding of the mystery that is reality.

abilities.name: Trap
abilities.description: Springs the trap nearest to Templar Assassin, slowing nearby enemies. If the ability is in autocast state, springs the trap that is closest to the mouse cursor.

abilities.name: Psionic Projection
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Allows Templar Assassin to teleport to any Psionic Trap after channeling for [1.5] seconds, detonating it upon arrival. Channeling Psionic Projection does not break Meld.
abilities.lore: In reward for her service, Lanaya has been granted access to secrets that unlock new techniques for her psionic gifts.

abilities.name: Psionic Trap
abilities.description: Templar Assassin places mystical traps that invisibly monitor enemy movement. When sprung at her command, they exert a slowing influence of 30% in the area. Traps charge up to slow 60% after 3.5 seconds. Deals bonus damage when fully charged.
notes: Traps last indefinitely.
They have invisibility that fades in over [2.0, 2.0, 2.0] seconds, spell immunity, and 100 HP.
Traps have 400/400 vision range and don't prevent neutral camps from spawning.
abilities.lore: Calling upon the reach of the Hidden Temple, none escape the eye of the Templar.

abilities.name: Reflection
abilities.description: Terrorblade brings forth an invulnerable dark reflection of all enemy heroes in a target area. Affected enemy heroes have movement and attack speeds slowed and attacked by their reflection.
notes: Reflections are untargetable, invulnerable illusions, that will be destroyed if the slow debuff is removed.
Reflections can only attack their source.
abilities.lore: In the fractal prison of Foulfell, Terrorblade learned the truth of this old tale: you are your own worst enemy.  Now it is a lesson he teaches others.

abilities.name: Conjure Image
abilities.description: Creates an illusion of Terrorblade that deals damage.
notes: Illusions created by Conjure Image are visually different for enemies.
abilities.lore: There's only one thing more dangerous than facing Terrorblade.  Facing MORE Terrorblades!

abilities.name: Metamorphosis
abilities.description: Terrorblade transforms into a powerful demon with a ranged attack. Any of Terrorblade's illusions that are within 1200 range will also be transformed by Metamorphosis.
notes: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Terrorblade was in when the item was used.
abilities.lore: Temper, temper. The rage rises up and takes control.  Meet Terrorblade's own worst self.

abilities.name: Demon Zeal
abilities.description: Costs part of Terrorblade's current HP to cast, dispelling Terrorblade and providing bonus movement and attack speed.  The bonuses are stronger out of Metamorphosis.DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

abilities.name: Terror Wave
abilities.description: Causes a wave to travel outwards in all directions forcing enemy heroes to become Feared upon impact, and grants Terrorblade Metamorphosis for a short time.

abilities.name: Sunder
abilities.description: Severs the life from both Terrorblade and a target hero, exchanging a percentage of both units' current health. Some health points must remain.
notes: Debuff Immune enemies don't get their HP modified.
abilities.lore: You didn't need that life, did you?  The demon marauder steals that which you hold most dear.

abilities.name: Gush
abilities.description: Summons a gush of water to damage an enemy unit, reducing their movement speed and armor.
abilities.lore: During his championship of the Sunken Isles, Leviathan gained mastery over the open sea.

abilities.name: Kraken Shell
abilities.description: Thickens Tidehunter's hide to passively block a portion of any incoming physical attack damage. The hide also removes negative status effects if the damage taken crosses a threshold.
notes: Only damage from player owned sources is counted towards debuff removal.
The counter will reset if no player owned damage is taken for [7.0, 7.0, 7.0, 7.0] seconds.
Kraken Shell removes most debuffs, even if they are generally not purgable.
abilities.lore: Claddish navymen tell tales of a mighty sea-faring beast that suffered spear and sword but continued to lay waste to the fleet.

abilities.name: Anchor Smash
abilities.description: Tidehunter swings his mighty anchor to attack and deal bonus damage to nearby enemies and reduce their attack damage.
notes: Anchor Smash works on all Ancient creeps except for Roshan.
abilities.lore: Stolen from one of Admiral Kunkka's flagships, Leviathan's heavy anchor proves useful as a melee weapon.

abilities.name: Tendrils of the Deep
abilities.description: Tidehunter unleashes a targeted slew of tentacles that damage and stun enemies within reach. The tentacles deal 50% of Ravage's damage and stun, with a range 75% of Ravage's radius.

abilities.name: Ravage
abilities.description: Slams the ground, causing tentacles to erupt in all directions, damaging and stunning all nearby enemy units.
notes: Ravage will hit invisible units.
Ravage waves move outwards at a speed of 725.
abilities.lore: Calling to the abyssal god Maelrawn has resulted in entire armadas being lost at sea.

abilities.name: Whirling Death
abilities.description: Timbersaw whirls extremely sharp edges, damaging enemies and destroying trees around him in an area.  If an enemy hero is affected, it loses some of its primary attribute for a short duration.  Whirling Death will deal bonus damage per tree destroyed.
notes: Universal Heroes will lose 5% of each attribute.
abilities.lore: In the case that Rizzrack gets surrounded by the vines and plants of his nightmares, he has an immediate chainsaw defense.

abilities.name: Timber Chain
abilities.description: Timbersaw fires a chain that embeds itself in the first tree it hits, pulling him towards it.  Any enemy in the path takes damage.
abilities.lore: You never know when you might need to escape from malevolent saplings.

abilities.name: Reactive Armor
abilities.description: Each time Timbersaw is attacked, he gains increased health regen and armor. Heroes grant double the amount.
abilities.lore: The saw-suit is equipped to react to the slightest touch with fortified defenses.

abilities.name: Second Chakram
abilities.description: Launches a second independent Chakram.
notes: The Chakram will return if Timbersaw runs out of mana or moves over 2000.0 distance away.
Slow effects from two chakrams do not stack.
abilities.lore: Cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut!

abilities.name: Flamethrower
abilities.description: Releases a flame in the direction Timbersaw is facing. Applies a debuff that deals damage per second and slows enemy movement speed. Affects buildings for reduced damage.

abilities.name: Chakram
abilities.description: Fires Timbersaw's main saw blade at the target location where it will spin in place, dealing damage in an area around it.  Enemies caught in the saw blade will move more slowly for every 5% of health missing. The blade deals damage and cuts down trees in its path when fired and retracted.  While active the ability costs mana, and Timbersaw loses the ability to attack.
notes: The Chakram will return if Timbersaw runs out of mana or moves over 2000.0 distance away.
abilities.lore: The ultimate in anti-flora weaponry.

abilities.name: Return Chakram
abilities.description: Returns the Chakram to Timbersaw.

abilities.name: Return Second Chakra
abilities.description: Returns the Chakram to Timbersaw.

abilities.name: Laser
abilities.description: Fires an intense energy beam, dealing damage to the target and all enemy units around it. The main target is blinded, causing them to miss all physical attacks.
abilities.lore: Boush perfected this rock cutting laser in his subterranean laboratory, never considering its combat utility.

abilities.name: Heat-Seeking Missile
abilities.description: Launches rockets at the nearest visible heroes within 2000 range.
abilities.lore: The last contraption Boush was able to save was a retrofitted rocket launcher with a homing mechanism.

abilities.name: Defense Matrix
abilities.description: Targets an allied unit, applying an all damage barrier to them that also provides Status Resistance.

abilities.name: Warp Flare
abilities.description: Throws a flare towards an enemy, dealing damage, teleporting them away and reducing their Cast and Attack Range for 3 seconds.

abilities.name: Keen Conveyance
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Teleport to a target friendly structure. Level 2 allows teleporting to friendly units and Level 3 to friendly heroes.
abilities.lore: As Boush likes to say, 'There is nothing the arcane can accomplish that the curious mind cannot reproduce given time. And proper funding, of course.'

abilities.name: Rearm
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Resets the cooldown on most of Tinker's items and abilities.
notes: Rearm works on all items except Aeon Disk, Arcane Boots, Black King Bar, Hand of Midas, Helm of the Dominator, Helm of the Overlord, Linken's Sphere, Meteor Hammer, Pipe of Insight, Refresher Orb, Revenant's Brooch (passive ability), and all neutral items.
abilities.lore: A new battery here, another set of rockets there, Boush continually improves on existing technology.

abilities.name: Avalanche
abilities.description: Bombards an area with rocks, continously doing small intervals of damage and stun to enemy units. Avalanche does 2x damage to units being tossed.
abilities.lore: Inanimate rock becomes animate when called by the Stone Giant.

abilities.name: Toss
abilities.description: Grabs the nearest unit in a 300 radius around Tiny, ally or enemy, and launches it at the target unit or rune to deal damage where they land.
notes: You can toss allies, but they don't take damage.
Toss deals 33% of its damage to buildings.
Debuff Immune units can be targeted but cannot be tossed.
abilities.lore: Tiny's gargantuan stature allows him to catapult even the sturdiest of warriors.

abilities.name: Tree Grab
abilities.description: Grabs a tree to whack enemies on the head for a limited number of attacks. Grants bonus attack range. Attacks deal more damage and fully splash on units along the way. The tree can be thrown, to deal your attack to a unit at a distance.
notes: The cooldown begins when the tree is thrown.
abilities.lore: Sticks and stones break all the bones, with structures sure to follow.

abilities.name: Tree Volley
abilities.description: CHANNELED - Tiny channels to throw random trees within range towards the targeted area. Deals Tiny's attack damage to enemies in that area with each tree thrown.
abilities.lore: Sticks thrown from stones are like to shatter many bones.

abilities.name: Grow
abilities.description: Tiny gains craggy mass, increasing his attack damage, and armor, and toss power while slowing his attack speed.
abilities.lore: Watching a hill become a mountain is awe-inspiring - especially if the mountain begins laying waste to adversaries.

abilities.name: Tree Throw
abilities.description: Throws the tree at the target unit, proccing your attack on it and splashing damage around the target.
abilities.lore: Even enemies can share in Tiny's arbor ardor.

abilities.name: Nature's Grasp
abilities.description: Creates vines towards the target location. Vines slow down and deal damage to enemies that walk through. Vines deal 50% more damage if they touch a tree. Does half damage to creeps.
abilities.lore: The Protectors don't often come into vision; their natural state being nestled within their leafy brethren.

abilities.name: Leech Seed
abilities.description: Treant plants a life-sapping seed in an enemy unit, draining its health, while simultaneously slowing it. The seed heals friendly units around it.
abilities.lore: Rooftrellen nurtures the beings under his stewardship, sustained by the lifeforce of trespassers into his sacred ground.

abilities.name: Living Armor
abilities.description: Infuses the target hero or structure with a protective coating which heals the target and provides bonus armor.
abilities.lore: The roots and tendrils of the Treant Protectors are far-reaching, stimulating the growth and rejuvenation of all of nature.

abilities.name: Eyes In The Forest
abilities.description: Treant Protector enchants a tree, which grants him unobstructed vision in that location. If Overgrowth is cast, units within a radius of an enchanted tree will be entangled and damaged. Passively causes all trees to respawn much faster.
notes: Being entangled by Overgrowth through enchanted trees from Eyes in the Forest does damage.
If the enemy has True Sight, they will be able to see which trees are enchanted.
abilities.lore: One can never be too certain who, or what, might need protecting.

abilities.name: Nature's Guise
abilities.description: Provides Treant with Tree Walking whenever he hasn't taken damage for 3 seconds. While active, Treant gains bonus movement speed.
notes: While affected by Nature's Guise, Treant can move unobstructed through other trees.
abilities.lore: The Protectors don't often come into vision; their natural state being nestled within their leafy brethren.

abilities.name: Overgrowth
abilities.description: Summons an overgrowth of vines and branches around Treant that deal damage to afflicted enemies and prevent them from moving, blinking, going invisible, or attacking.
notes: Works on Debuff Immune units, but if units gain debuff immunity after the effect starts, they'll break free.
abilities.lore: Rooftrellen calls the ancestral spirit of nature, releasing its power through all of his kin.

abilities.name: Berserker's Rage
abilities.description: While active, Troll Warlord swaps from using ranged to melee attacks. Melee attacks have a chance to ensnare, preventing the target from moving or using mobility spells. Berserker's Rage also grants additional movement speed, armor, and decreases base attack time.
notes: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Troll Warlord was in when the item was used.
abilities.lore: Like his anger, Troll Warlord's supply of axes is infinite.

abilities.name: Whirling Axes (Ranged)
abilities.description: Troll hurls a fistful of five axes in a cone shape over 950.0 range, slowing and damaging enemy units.
notes: Does not affect Roshan.
abilities.lore: Only axes fueled by hate whirl with such a deadly spin.

abilities.name: Whirling Axes (Melee)
abilities.description: Troll hurls two axes around him in a close range area of effect, damaging enemy units and causing them to miss some attacks.
notes: Does not affect Roshan.
abilities.lore: Keep your enemies close.

abilities.name: Fervor
abilities.description: With each continuous blow on the same target, Troll gains increased attack speed.  If Troll changes targets, the stacks drop to zero.
abilities.lore: If at first you don't succeed, strike, strike again.

abilities.name: Rampage
abilities.description: Grants all allied Heroes globally a bonus based on whichever stance Troll Warlord is currently in. Ranged provides bonus Attack Speed and melee provides Status Resistance.

abilities.name: Battle Trance
abilities.description: Troll unleashes a powerful battle trance, that forces you to continuously attack the closest enemy unit within 900 range, prioritizing heroes. Damage does not kill you during this mode. Grants you bonus lifesteal, attack speed and movement speed. Applies a Basic Dispel.
notes: Troll can still use his items and abilities while affected by Battle Trance, but not other commands.
Troll can still be killed with Axe's Culling Blade.
Troll is granted vision over the target.
abilities.lore: An adrenaline rush of pure hatred quickens your blades.

abilities.name: Ice Shards
abilities.description: Tusk compresses shards of ice into a ball of frozen energy that damages all enemies it comes in contact with. When the ball reaches its target destination the shards are released, creating a barrier that lasts for [4, 5, 6, 7] seconds.
notes: Creates an impassable barrier.
abilities.lore: In the frozen tundra near the Barrier, after the last sun of autumn has set, ice can form with alarming speed.

abilities.name: Snowball
abilities.description: Tusk begins rolling into a snowball. Allies within a 350 radius can also be added to the snowball by right-clicking on them, even while the snowball is moving. Once launched, any enemies caught in the snowball's path will be stunned and take damage. Each allied Hero in the snowball will add to its damage.
notes: The snowball will break apart a maximum of 3 seconds after launch.
The snowball can be launched early by pressing using the Launch Snowball ability.
Doesn't carry illusions, but will carry Meepo clones and other units that Tusk controls.
Each Meepo clone added to the snowball will add its own bonus damage.
Allies can click on a snowball to add themselves to it.
abilities.lore: Tales are still told of the wild feat that ended the grand brawl at White Fields.

abilities.name: Tag Team
abilities.description: Temporarily applies a negative debuff aura around you, causing enemies that are attacked under it to take bonus physical damage and reduced movement speed. Lasts 5 seconds.
notes: Affects attacks from allied heroes, Tusk or any of his units.
abilities.lore: Even far from Cobalt, Tusk carries the 'Barrier Chill' in his very bones.

abilities.name: Walrus Kick
abilities.description: Kicks the closest enemy unit in the drawn direction, stunning, damaging, and slowing them. Also deals damage to all heroes within 250 radius of its landing area. Cooldown is reduced by 50% if kicking a creep.
abilities.lore: Tusk may have made his name with his fists, but the wise enemy is wary of any and all limbs.

abilities.name: Frozen Sigil
abilities.description: Summons a flying Sigil that slows movement speed by -40% for enemies within 650 radius. Lasts 25 seconds. Cooldown: 30
notes: If no order is given, the Sigil will follow Tusk.

The Sigil has unobstructed movement, has a 310 movement speed, requires 3/3/4/4 hero attacks to destroy and 12/12/16/16 creep attacks to destroy, provides 400/400 vision, and gives a 90/100/110/120 gold bounty.
Heroes deal 1 damage to the sigil, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.
abilities.lore: The chill of home!

abilities.name: Walrus PUNCH!
abilities.description: Tusk connects with his mighty Walrus Punch, a critical strike so powerful it launches its victim into the air. The victim is slowed upon landing.
notes: Walrus PUNCH has true strike.
abilities.lore: It never matters who throws the first punch, only who throws the last.

abilities.name: Launch Snowbal
abilities.description: Launch the snowball toward the target.
notes: The snowball destroys trees.
Doesn't carry illusions, but will carry Meepo clones and other units that Tusk controls.
Each Meepo clone added to the snowball will add its own bonus damage.
abilities.lore: Into the great wide white!

abilities.name: Firestorm
abilities.description: Calls down waves of fire that damage enemy units in the target area, burning for additional damage over time.
abilities.lore: The flames of conquest blaze forth from the darkest depths of the abyss.

abilities.name: Pit of Malice
abilities.description: A deadly pit is conjured at the target location; any unit that enters will be rooted. Each enemy unit within the pit are affected every 3.6 seconds.
abilities.lore: Twisting into the seams of reality itself, Vrogros' manifest hatred paralyzes those who defy his will.

abilities.name: Atrophy Aura
abilities.description: Nearby enemy units are weakened, losing a portion of their base damage. If an enemy dies while under this effect, Underlord gains temporary bonus damage.
abilities.lore: To merely stand in the presence of the Underlord is to feel the conviction of battle sapped from one's soul.

abilities.name: Fiend's Gate
abilities.description: Opens 2 portals, one next to Underlord and one in the target location. Heroes can channel a portal for 3.5 seconds to teleport to the other side. Allies that pass through the portal temporarily gain Damage Reduction and Movement Speed. Portals have to be at least 2000 away from each other.
abilities.lore: They come without warning, leaving fire and blood where kingdoms once flourished.

abilities.name: Decay
abilities.description: Undying steals strength from all enemy heroes in an area, dealing base damage as he claims the enemy's strength for himself. Deals 2.0x damage to creeps.
notes: The strength stolen stacks, but can't cause a hero to have strength below 1.
The strength steal takes effect before the damage is dealt.
Affects invisible units.
abilities.lore: The strength of the living is simply borrowed from the strength of the dead.

abilities.name: Soul Rip
abilities.description: Undying rips health away from all nearby units and uses it to heal an ally, or damage an enemy. Soul Rip can also be used to heal Tombstone.
notes: Can heal Tombstone, but can't heal or damage other buildings.
Does not rip from invisible units, invulnerable units, units in the fog of war, or spell immune enemies.
Does rip from spell immune allies, including zombies.
abilities.lore: Even allies feel despair in Undying's presence.

abilities.name: Tombstone
abilities.description: Summons a tombstone at the target point.  Zombies will frequently spawn next to every enemy unit in the area around the Tombstone, and attack them.  Zombies have the Deathlust ability, which causes their attacks to slow the target, and if the target reaches below a certain amount of health, increases the attack and movement speed of the zombie.
notes: Tombstone is Spell Immune, but can be healed by Soul Rip.
Zombies and Tombstone are Spell Immune.
If their initial target dies or goes out of vision, the Zombie will die.
abilities.lore: Dirge calls on his fallen brothers to fight for the Dead God.

abilities.name: Grab Ally
abilities.description: Load an ally into the nearest available tombstone.

abilities.name: Flesh Golem
abilities.description: Undying transforms into a horrifying flesh golem. Gains a percentage increase to strength and imbues attacks with a slow and damage amplification.
abilities.lore: The flesh of the recently dead add to the power of Dirge's plague.

abilities.name: Earthshock
abilities.description: Ursa leaps forward 250 units and slams the earth, causing a powerful shock to damage and slow all enemy units in a nearby area for [4] seconds.
abilities.lore: The very steps of a male ursine shake the ground as well as the resolve of opposing warriors.

abilities.name: Overpower
abilities.description: Using his skill in combat, Ursa gains increased attack speed for a number of subsequent attacks.
notes: Overpower isn't removed by Black King Bar.
Missing an attack still consumes a charge of Overpower.
abilities.lore: For a behemoth of his size, Ursa is deceptively nimble.

abilities.name: Fury Swipes
abilities.description: Ursa's claws dig deeper wounds in the enemy, causing consecutive attacks to the same enemy to deal more damage.  If the same target is not attacked after [8, 12, 16, 20] seconds, the bonus damage is lost.
abilities.lore: In nature, the wounded rarely survive the attacks of hungry predators.

abilities.name: Enrage
abilities.description: Ursa goes into a frenzy, providing damage reduction and status resistance. Removes any existing debuffs.
abilities.lore: Ulfsaar succumbs to his ancient spirit, becoming the most ferocious creature on the battlefield.

abilities.name: Magic Missile
abilities.description: Fires a magic missile at an enemy unit, stunning and dealing damage.
abilities.lore: A simple Skywrath technique, the magic missile is Shendel's primary tool for vengeance.

abilities.name: Wave of Terror
abilities.description: Vengeful Spirit lets loose a wicked cry, weakening the armor of enemies and giving vision of the path ahead.
abilities.lore: Shendel's haunting voice hints at her approaching vindication.

abilities.name: Vengeance Aura
abilities.description: Vengeful Spirit's presence increases the damage of nearby friendly heroes.
abilities.lore: Although they may not share her undying passion for revenge, allies do draw on her fanaticism in combat.

abilities.name: Nether Swap
abilities.description: Instantaneously swaps positions with a target Hero, friend or enemy. Nether Swap interrupts channeling abilities on the target. Enemy Swapped units take damage. Allied swapped units receive less damage for a short duration.
notes: Works on Spell Immune units.
Trees near Vengeful Spirit and the target will be destroyed when the spell is cast.
Channeling spells are interrupted by Nether Swap.
abilities.lore: Martyrdom is a small price to pay for vengeance.

abilities.name: Venomous Gale
abilities.description: Launches a ball of venom in a line, poisoning enemy units so that they take both initial damage and damage over time, as well as suffering slowed movement.  Venomous Gale deals damage every 3 seconds over its duration.
notes: Venomous Gale can be lethal. Units afflicted by Venomous Gale can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.
Duration damage is dealt every [3, 3, 3, 3] seconds.
Slow starts at [-50, -50, -50, -50]%, and decreases as time passes.
abilities.lore: A concoction of various stings, poisons, and toxins gathered from the jungles of Jidi Isle, victims surviving it are rare.

abilities.name: Poison Sting
abilities.description: Adds poison damage to Venomancer's normal attacks and slowing movement speed.
notes: Poison Sting damage can be lethal.
Damage from Poison Sting does not interrupt healing from items, nor does it activate the cooldown on Blink Dagger.
abilities.lore: The paralytic sting of the creature which caused his transformation now belongs to the Venomancer.

abilities.name: Plague Ward
abilities.description: Summons a plague ward to attack enemy units and structures. The ward is immune to magic. Wards gain the Poison Sting level from Venomancer, dealing 50% of the full damage.
abilities.lore: A mixture of his old herbalist talents and newfound toxic mastery creates a living embodiment of plague.

abilities.name: Latent Toxicity
abilities.description: Applies a weak poison that minorly slows and deals damage to its target. If this poison is dispelled in any way, the target will receive a large amount of damage and be stunned.
abilities.lore: As Venomancer's own origins corroborate, some of Jidi's most horrifying dangers become apparent only with time.

abilities.name: Poison Nova
abilities.description: Whenever Venomancer dies or the effects of Venomous Gale end prematurely on an enemy hero, a spreading ring of poison erupts. Enemies hit by the poison will take non-lethal magic damage over time and have their magic resistance reduced. This effect can trigger every 10 seconds and cannot be refreshed.
abilities.lore: In the Acid Jungles, creatures releasing noxious poison to their attackers is common; Venomancer spreads this plague beyond the Jidi Isle.

abilities.name: Noxious Plague
abilities.description: Infects an enemy with a deadly plague that does an initial burst of damage and additional damage over time based on the unit's maximum health. The plague slows the target and nearby enemies based on their distance to the target. When the target dies or the debuff expires, all nearby enemies are infected with a noncommunicable version of the plague.

abilities.name: Poison Attack
abilities.description: Intensifies Viper's venom, adding an effect to his normal attack that applies a stacking movement speed slow and magic resistance deduction while dealing damage over time. Stacks up to 5 times.
abilities.lore: The Netherdrake's inborn toxic breath quickly drains the vitality of its afflicted.

abilities.name: Nethertoxin
abilities.description: Viper releases a Nethertoxin at the targeted area. Units in that area take an increasing damage over time based on how long they remain in it. Disables passives of affected units.
abilities.lore: Poison from the Nether Reaches turns wounds into fatalities, and fatigue into death.

abilities.name: Corrosive Skin
abilities.description: Viper exudes an infectious toxin that damages and slows the attack speed of any enemy that damages it in a 1400 radius. The acid exudate also increases Viper's resistance to magic.
notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other magic damage resistance sources.
abilities.lore: It is not unusual for sword and shield alike to corrode in the very hands of those who attack the Netherdrake.

abilities.name: Nosedive
abilities.description: Viper slams into the ground, disarming each enemy in a 500 AoE for 4 seconds and splattering everyone in a 1200 AoE with the effect of Corrosive Skin.
notes: Cannot be used while Leashed or Rooted.
abilities.lore: It was thought that Netherdrake wings touch ground only in death, but some surmise that those who've witnessed more intentional landings merely haven't survived to tell the tale.

abilities.name: Viper Strike
abilities.description: Viper slows the targeted enemy unit's movement and attack speed while also dealing poison damage over time.  The slowing effect reduces over the duration of the poison.
abilities.lore: Once used to slay his sadistic summoner, the most powerful of Netherdrake infections spreads through the veins of those foolish enough to cross Viper.

abilities.name: Grave Chill
abilities.description: Visage drains the movement and attack speed of the targeted unit, gaining it for itself and nearby familiars.
notes: The two buffs can be removed separately by dispels.
The speed gained is independent of the speed lost on the target.
Familiars within 900 range of Visage will also receive bonuses from Grave Chill.
abilities.lore: The warmth of the sun is never felt in the dark cold of the Narrow Maze.

abilities.name: Soul Assumption
abilities.description: Visage gathers charges of soul essence each time nearby heroes take more than 100 damage. When the essence is released, it deals base damage as well as damage for each gathered soul charge.
notes: Charges are only gained for damage greater than 2.0 and less than 3000.0 that is dealt by a player or Roshan.  Self-damage or Soul Assumption damage isn't counted.
abilities.lore: The collected souls of the dead reach out to bring another into their fold.

abilities.name: Gravekeeper's Cloak
abilities.description: Visage generates a layered barrier that protects him from damage.  If he receives damage from a player, one layer is removed, and takes time to recover.
notes: Each time Visage receives damage greater than the Minimum Damage that was not self-inflicted and was from a player owned source, a layer is removed.
Familiars within 900 range of Visage will receive the current damage reduction from Gravekeeper's Cloak.
abilities.lore: Visage's tough scales share equal properties of ghost and stone, making it nearly impervious to blade and magical assault.

abilities.name: Stone Form
abilities.description: After a short delay, the nearest Familiar turns into stone and smashes into the ground, stunning and damaging all targets in the area.  The Familiar becomes invulnerable, and will regain its health very rapidly.  After 6.0 seconds, the Familiar will automatically leave Stone Form.
notes: While Stone Form is not dispellable, the stun can be removed by strong dispels.

abilities.name: Silent as the Grave
abilities.description: Turns Visage and familiars invisible, granting Visage bonus movement speed and upgrading its movement type to flying. When Visage or its familiars leave invisibility they deal more damage for a short duration. Lasts 35.0 seconds. Invisibility ends when attacking or casting.

abilities.name: Summon Familiars
